description:
Decent seafood spot on Fisherman's Wharf. I feel like all the restaurants on this block are about the same quality so look for whoever's menu looks most interesting to you. A few of the other restaurants on this block have rooftop seating if that appeals to you, but it's the same food served for a higher price. This restaurant only has one dining room inside. 

Often times their staff stands outside trying to convince you to pick their restaurant to eat at. In this case we were offered free bread and free soup and salad. The bread is San Francisco's famous sourdough. We also shared a clam chowder and lobster bisque which were both quite good although the chowder was served just a tad bit lukewarm and I wish it had been hotter. 

I highly recommend trying the Dungeness crab and cioppino, both of which are famous in SF. My favorite was definitely the cioppino. The broth was delicious and comes with basically every kind of seafood: crab, clams, mussels, shrimp, scallop, and fish. You'll definitely want to use the sourdough to finish off the broth and garlic butter sauce that comes with the Dungeness crab.
author: Catherine Y.

description:
you cannot go wrong with anything from their menu !!!
from soups to salads to their delicious seafood menu ... 
topped off with sourdough  bread !!! they also have alcoholic ans n/a beverages 
for your choices.. 
the entire staff at nick's lighthouse are the most courteous and professional people .
it is also extremely inexpensive 
to eat there and be sure to wrap up the rest to take home for later on .
the only mistake you can make is not visiting Nick's. !!!
                              " ENJOY " !!                  
                           Jay & Joan Urbanski
author: Jay U.

description:
Decided to try somewhere new this trip and I'm so happy we did! The food was delicious and totally worth the try. 
We had the oysters and that was delicious it didn't have that fishy salt water taste but very tasty.
We had the calamari (light & crispy) and the two dungeness crabs prepared with spicy sauce and garlic butter sauce both flavors were so yummy!!
The service was also great everyone was so helpful and attentive, we will definitely be back!
author: Jay P.

description:
the food is very rich but I recommend the imperial dish, the good attention rs guaranteed. 
a congratulation to the Cuban crabber very good attention
author: Alexeis T.

description: Fun atmosphere. Diverse menu. Very friendly service. We didn't have to wait at all which was a huge plus. However, make sure you really enjoy your company, the seating is VERY cozy! Quality of the seafood was not up to par with other places in SF especially for the price. I had the Cioppino and wedge salad with fresh crab. The fresh crab lacked flavor and the Cioppino was overly salty. Next visit we will be trying another place for our seafood fix.
author: Kaitie B.

description:
I'm not sure why I keep coming back here... perhaps out of habit and familiarity? My family has made many trips to San Francisco over the years and during each trip, we make sure to head over to Fisherman's Wharf for a meal, usually consisting of raw oysters, clam chowder, fish & chips, and occasionally some dungeness crab or lobster. 

Naturally, on our honeymoon, I dragged my husband here to get some easy street fare. I've never sat down in the restaurant behind the seafood stalls because of the outrageous prices they charge just for a table. The food that we would order is coming out of the front, why go inside for a huge upcharge? 

This time, we were terribly disappointed. We stopped by Nick's so I could get 6 raw oysters. We wanted clam chowder in a bread bowl as well, but seeing the state of the chowder sitting in the tub, we decided to find it elsewhere. He wound up getting some shrimp cocktail along with our oysters. 

We stood around for almost 10 minutes as the seafood guy chatted with the cashier girl. He had no idea our order was in because he wasn't paying any attention, and only when the manager yelled at him to get the oysters did he start shucking them. To his credit, he threw in an extra one for making us wait.

The oysters were pretty disappointing. They came out of a chilled cardboard box and while they didn't taste dead, they certainly didn't taste fresh. There was this weird muted metallic taste and the texture wasn't crisp and clean at all. We only ate 6 of the 7.

I really wasn't a fan of the manager. He was being obnoxious and waving two huge lobsters around, trying to get tourists to stop and pose for photos with the lobsters. The photoshoots usually ended with him carelessly throwing the live lobsters on a table until the next unsuspecting traveler came along. Not cool dude.

Dungeness crabs are all pre-cooked and re-boiled when ordered. Same with lobsters. You can't really ruin something that's already good plain.

If you're still determined to come here, just get some seafood. Skip the chowder and the fried stuff. DO NOT sit inside unless you just love throwing money away. If you order by the stalls, it's reasonably priced for average food on the Wharf.
author: Belinda J.

description:
Visiting San Francisco with family you have to try clam chowder, right? So we had some at Boudin and at the Chowder's on Pier 39, both were good.

Later in the evening we walked by this place and decided to try some more. This was easily the best chowder we tried in our trip.

We ate outside, which feels like eating street food in a fish market. After seating we found out they have a full restaurant behind the street-food counter. They have a broader menu than chowder including fried fish and other things which we did not try.

But, great spot for clam chowder.
author: Gerardo D.

description:
This is like a family/gang hustling passersby into an unsatisfactory, tasteless scam. Market price for dungeness crab was $19/lb. I ordered a crab which they offered at about $30 (for outdoor eating). For some reason the price jumps to $40 when eating inside. When the crab finally did come out it was drowning in a garlic butter sauce (what a shame). About halfway thru consumption i could swear some of the legs were missing (i could be wrong).

In short, if you give this place a try, dint get any sauce, like the garlic butter. Just eat crab straight up, perhaps with the sauce on the side.

Cheers
author: Edward A.

description:
Oysters were $2 each which was a steal. 
They shocked them in front of you and they were so fresh. I didn't need any sauce because it was good flavor just by it self.

We had to wait because this place was busy but it was worth it.
author: Sarlyn P.

description:
Clam chowder was great just don't do the crab with garlic not worth the price :(
Definitelycome back for the clam chowder that's about it
author: JD W.

description: The man out front does an excellent job of getting people in the door. This is exactly what I imagined a Fishermans Wharf seafood experience to be. It is old school, small, and cozy. The food was solid. The bisque was excellent. I would recommend it for the experience.
author: Sarah M.

description:
So it was our last night in San Fran and I wanted to have seafood for dinner. They have an outside area where you can eat your food in a counter or sit inside. We opted to sit inside, and wow its a small area really busy with tight seating, they gave us a round table booth for the two of us and good thing it was only two of us because it was tight trying to sit down. 

I ordered the Dungeness crab special which you can order a half or a full with soup. If your not that hungry a half order of crab will be good for one. The waiter told me the full  one is enough for one but yeah I was struggling to finish since my friend was allergic to shell fish. 

I got the clam chowder - which was okay they need to add more clams, the crab was prepared spicy garlic style. I love spice and garlic, but so I was kind of sad that I couldn't taste the garlic, they need to add more. The crab was good though very fresh easy to take the meat out of the shell considering they crack it for you, and big piece came out which I love. It was very messy wished they gave me a bib. I was struggling to keep the napkin attached to the neck of my sweater since I didn't want crab juice all over me. 

The service was good even though they were really busy, she came by to take out the plate for the the empty shells, refilled our waters and gave new bowls to place the shells. Overall, I've giving them 3 stars because the taste was a okay. I've had better clam chowder and if you tell me spicy garlic, I want to taste the garlic.
author: Julie Ann I.

description: Maybe food tastes different when it is being expensed versus out of your own pocket?  Came to SF with family rather than business and the crab just wasn't as good as we remembered.  Still love to watch the production as the workers seem to make it a musical demo working through hammering the knuckles of the crab to make for easier consumption.  It was expensive.  In fact, shortly after returning to home, we were able to buy two crabs for the same price at Costco.  Definitely something to do if you are a tourist or if your company is paying for your meal.  I will be back in October on business may have to see if it tastes better then.
author: Maria K.

description:
This review is for Nicks seafood stall in front of their restaurant. I cant decide if I want to give this place 3 stars or 4 stars. 

Crabbing season has officially started and I was CRAVING fresh crab so we came here. This stall had the most decent looking crabs (no legs missing, doesn't look too dirty/muddy) so we bought one crab for the 3 of us to share. Right now the crabs are going at about $17 per pound, which is still a bit pricey but I think it's really worth it. 

The reason I wanted to give this place 3 stars is because the stall is sooo dirty. Crab shell pieces everywhere, seafood juices all over the place, smells like seafood due to the giant boilers, it's just grimy in general. I probably could have bought crab at a better location but my cravings were so bad I didn't care about how clean the place was, I just wanted my food LOL

As for the crab, it was so good! They will crack it, heat it up for you, and you can either eat it there or take it to go. The crab was super meaty, sweet, tender, ugh just thinking about it makes me want to drool. I took the crab back, my absolute favorite part, and devoured the shit out of it. The tomalley was so rich and flavorful! I know you're not supposed to have too much of it due to the high cholesterol it contains (or so ive heard) and because of the domoic acid level problem from last year buuuut IDGAF. The crabs here are a solid 5 stars.

Overall i'm going to even it out to 4 stars. The crab here is great but the cleanliness makes me squeamish.
author: Shannon C.

description:
If you're trying to experience the authentic San Francisco scene, it doesn't get much better than having a warm clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. What makes this spot unique among the other stalls in the area, is the service. 

Special shout out goes to Javier who represented himself and the company very well. Javier is friendly and personable. I'll definitely be stopping here again.
author: Jose A.

description:
Okay, let me explain something. I come to San Fran FROM Stockton JUST to get a crab with spicy garlic sauce from here. I have always had great service and the guys have always been nice. HOWEVER, I recently visited the area to buy crab and because my experience left me feeling like crap, it makes me question whether I want to come back.

The 2 guys working outside ignored me. They were blatantly rude and insulted me over me tipping them "only" a few dollars for prepping my to-go order. Then they proceeded to briefly talk about me in Spanish to another co-worker who was on a break. Screw you. I know Spanish too. That whole experience made me feel like shit, especially when I didn't have to tip them at all or even choose their restaurant stand.
author: lisa m.

description:
We were starved and had to pick up something quick along the way. We perused the various seafood stands and opted not to get the chowder, since we were craving fried seafood. We decided to each get combos with calamari, fish, chips, and shrimp. Nick's has a couple of stands where you can order, so if you are on the street side and there is a long line, go towards the back since there is another counter. There was no line and we got our food quick. 

If you are inclined for a sit down, there is a restaurant available. However, if you are on the go (like us) we found a sitting area to quickly eat our lunch and continue on our site seeing. There really is no seating as you need to find some benches somewhere and to hide from the flying birds! These birds are aggressive too and are not afraid to fly up to your food and steal a fry!
author: Maria C.

description:
I got the Dungeness crab with garlic butter

I ate outside on the street next to the guy 

Cooks them and breaks it up for you as well 

as the lobster, shrimp and the oysters

$44 dollars

I think it's the experience that you pay for 

most of all
author: B I.

description: They did a bait and switch on my order. I ordered LIVE Lobster and CRABS. They also showed it to me. When it was served in less than five minutes, the food was cold, ice cold. I told the waitress, all she said that it took us too long for use to eat the food. She did not even apologies. There food is no good. Go somewhere else...
author: Evaristo C.

description:
Ate dinner inside. Place was small and had an old school vibe to it. Staff was friendly and attentive. Waiter, or possible the cook, came by with a huge lobster offering it at a "special price." Husband ordered the spicy garlic dungeness crab and I had the crab chowder. Both were good. Nothing amazing stands out about either one, but nothing horrible does either. 

Tip: Since they serve bread at the table, it's not necessary to order a bread bowl with your soup. I don't like my bread getting soggy but I do enjoy dipping small pieces and eating it so it's a Win win situation.
author: Rose P.

description:
On a recent 24 hour trip from Arizona to SF, my wife and I stopped into Nick's for lunch before concluding our brief but action packed trip.   The restaurant is in the middle of Touristville, so is impossibly crowded.  Walk up, wait, and hope that people finish up their meals and get out so you can snag a table.  We waited perhaps 15-20 minutes.  Not bad.  

First, the food - thumbs up.  I ordered the Lobster Bisque, the seasonal green salad and a Whole Cracked Spicy Garlic Dungeness Crab.   I never received my Bisque, but I tasted my wife's and liked it.  The salad was salad but their Thousand Island dressing was creamy and superb, likely house made.   Further, the crab was insanely good.  That Spicy Garlic bath they cook the thing in is just delicious .  It wasn't spicy to me, and it wasn't overpoweringly garlicky, it was just really, really tasty and worth the extra $3.   Seriously, go for it.   Also, at a market price (at the time of our visit) of only $34 for the whole crab, I truly felt like it was a reasonable price.  

Second, the service - thumbs down.  Things started out great but attentiveness to our table degraded rapidly as our visit progressed.  We ordered drinks but were not ready to order food immediately after being seated, so asked our server for "one more minute".  Friendly, he replied "I'll give you two" as he smiled and moved on to another table.    It was more like 20 before I was finally able to flag his attention again, and I was ready for another Anchor Steam at that point too.   That would be the theme for the remainder of the visit - lots of time between visits by our server, lots of water refills that took way too long, several requests for things that had to be requested a second time or never came at all - so the lunch we figured would take an hour ended up taking almost 3.   I never got the Lobster Bisque I ordered, but I did not get charged for it either.

I hesitated between 3 & 4 stars.   I liked the garlic crab so much that this was a tough choice, and our waiter was super friendly (when he was available).  The place was incredibly busy the whole time we were there, so I have to give them some credit for that, but still.  If the service had been great I would honestly have gone 5 stars because of the food and pricing on the crab, but I just can't do it.   It's a 3 banger.
author: Scott M.

description:
A restaurant located at Fisherman's Wharf should scream red tourist flag. Like many seafood restaurants at the wharf be prepared to pay a little extra from your pocket. A little place, but you're able to get a place to sit pretty quickly. 

The food wasn't bad, but nothing spectacular. I ordered the scallop and shrimp pasta with some clam chowder. The pasta was your average pasta and I found the seafood to be quite fresh. The clam chowder was my favorite part. You can never go wrong with calm chowder from most places in San Fransisco. It was delicious and came with a bag of crackers. They also serve you a loaf of sough dough bread which was nice as nice snack.

The service was ok. Waiter was nice, but also some of the staff came off as rude. While waiting for the bill to come they were basically forcing us out by constantly cleaning already clean table, but there wasn't much we could do as we were waiting for the bill to be completed. Not your typical restaurant, but if you're being a tourist it will do.
author: Chris N.

description:
Service is slow. The place feels dirty. Crowded. The location was perfect and you can validate your parking so it's free up to 3hr parking. 

Clam chowder/ lobster bisque are bland. 
I got a shrimp pasta and it was ok. Not impressed. I rather go elsewhere.
author: Christina J.

description:
Food --
Clam chowder tastes like it's from a can, crab chowder taste old .. 
I would save yourself and your money and pick another place on the pier. 

**SERVICE IS THE WORSE HERE, & the manager was SUPER disrespectful** 
We had a table of 5 and apparently there is an automatic 15% tip added to the bill. On the top of our receipt it says to ask the manager if we had any questions regarding why the 15% was added and I called over the manager to ask and he said it's added automatically to a table of 6... but... ummm we had 5??? He said "5, 6 same thing." No, it's not the same LOL ?? 5 and 6 are CLEARLY different. Tbh, I refused to pay that high of a tip because I had to ask 3 servers to take my order and they just kept walking away from us.. sad, because I always remembered coming here as a kid w my parents and it was our go to restraunt on the pier ..
author: Jaydelyn S.

description:
Gotta have the clam chowder bowl when your at fisherman's wharf. It was really cold so we opted to sit down inside. 

Service was below par. It's a little irritating when your server walks away and says to another "there only have chowder bread bowls". SORRY! We could go spend our $50 (Yes our bill for 3 bread bowls) at one of the other establishments right next door.

As for food also below par. The soup was not even hot. The bread wasn't soft and the portion was tiny.

I won't be back.
author: Corabelle G.

description:
We wanted to try something near the wharf, came across this place and decided to give it a try. In all
Honesty, the food wasn't that great To me. Very mediocre. Things tasted bland, and some dishes were really good. We got the platter which pretty much had a little bit of everything. Make sure you have an appetite because it's ALOT of food. 


I don't regret coming here, but there are many other seafood places near by. Service was great. Had a great Filipino server who was very tentative ! The seating area is extremely small
And tiny. So I hope you guys aren't claustrophobic!
author: Alan P.

description: I went here last night with some friends for dinner before heading back to Socal. This place is in fisherman wharf where it one of the tourist attraction in SF. I  got myself a fresh steamed whole crab for a good price. There was no wait at all and I got my crab within minutes. It was so delicious and fresh. I love to dip my crab meats with lemon, salt, peppers and Tabasco.  Beside crab, they do offer crab chowder, fried seafoods and other seafoods. The  services was great and very friendly. The guy cracked everything for me so that I don't have to break any pieces of the crab. This place is at the end of the food stand. There is also spots where you can sit and enjoy the views of the area. Parking is kind of hard so it best to park far and walk over. I will be definitely be back to this place and try their other items.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Poor everything. Food quality & Place. On the menu it said you have to spend a minimum of $10 to get your parking validated, in which we did. When she asked if we wanted our checks, the waitress told us we had to spend a minimum of $15 per person to get your parking validated. Updae your menu, first of all. We ordered garlic fries and when the food came to our table, it was literally garlic.. on top of like 4 french fries. The chairs we sat on had rips and the table was uneven which was annoying because when someone would get up to use the bathroom, they needed to hold onto the table for support and it kept moving. Waiter was fast enough to take our checks after we put it down but was slow when it came to checking up on us and serving our food. Just not my type of dining. Over all, clam chowder was okay.
author: Nina F.

description:
Bloody mary = excellent!
oysters = good
cioppino = not good

It's sad to say, but their cioppino was not good.  and its at fishermans wharf!  but its okay, not all cioppino's can be as good as sotto mare.  

service was good.  friendly and patient.
author: Dayneen M.

description: Absolutely delicious!! My family and I visited San Francisco and were looking for something good to eat- we ended up here and was not disappointed at all! I would come back here every time I visit the bay. Fernando was a really great waiter helping us choose what to order. Definitely would give this place 5 stars, great quality food and amazing customer service!
author: Gaile B.

description: My first time and last time coming here. We were seated immediately. The clam chowder had no clams, the sandwich was not only very salty but overloaded with mayo, the steam clams were not as fresh. Food served to our table was fast and quick. I don't have anything good to say for this restaurant, so I'll stop here.
author: Lovetea C.

description:
No frills . Wait staff super busy . 
Sometimes a wait to sit but probably the best crab on fisherman's  wharf . My husband and I have came back to back two nights in a row. Why ? Wait staff is busy but super friendly sometimes the market staff helps the waiters . Friendly funny staff makes the dining experience . It's crab season so fresh crab is everywhere but this place stands out . Fresh, sweet and briny whole crab is there special. I don't know about anything else but come for the crab . Clam Chowder comes with the meal pair it with an anchor steam on tap .... you are set for the day
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Had not very long to eat before a flight so decided to stop in here because I needed to eat asap and was literally standing right in-front of it. 
They could seat my group and I right away which was nice and service was fast which was a plus. Other than speed service was below average but not awful. 

You get a lot of food for the money imo. Food was good but not great.

All in all it is what I expected. They probably get a lot of tourists off the street looking for somewhere to eat. So it isn't bad, isn't great.
author: Rose P.

description: We enjoyed nothing from this restaurant... looked delish but after we ordered & crab chowder bowls came out we realized it was a mistake... it actually had an "old" flavor taste to it.  We should have kept walking, there were better restaurants have we kept walking towards the beach area...  We are planning to return and this place will not be on our list
author: Anne M.

description: You don't come here to eat out on a whim, you come here because you're at Fisherman's Wharf and you don't feel like being on your feet anymore and want to avoid all the tourists. With that said, this restaurant itself is a tourist trap. The price to quality ratio here is severely imbalanced. The seafood is pretty average, you're really paying for a place to sit in an enclosed area really. I had an order of the rainbow trout with a side of rice and broccoli. It was okay, the rice and broccoli was just plain and the fish had like the blandest seasoning ever, I mean could you even call it seasoning, if it tastes like the black abyss? I would not recommend unless you're desperate to actually sit down and eat.
author: Alex N.

description: I have absolutely no complaints about this place. My boyfriend and I arrived into San Francisco late at night and were staying near fisherman's wharf and wanted something to eat. Luckily Nick's lighthouse was one of the few restaurants open around 10pm. We were greeted by a really nice man out front and he immediately brought us to a table. We were brought waters and immediately asked if we had any questions on the menu. Everyone from the get go was very nice and welcoming. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp fettuccini Alfredo and I got the linguine portofini. Omg. My dish was soooo good. It came out nice and hot and even though the flavors were simple, it all went together very well. His fettuccini was honestly pretty basic but nothing to complain about. Each dish came with either a soup or salad. The salad was small and simple, but the lobster bisque is definitely a must try! We will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Michela K.

description: It's hard to find, and isn't as flashy as other restaurants to get your attention, but this is a delicious restaurant that you have to visit! Our waiter was so personable and would even tell us if some appetizers were small orders that we wouldn't like. That's so helpful! The food was delicious. The atmosphere is beautiful with grapes hanging down from the ceiling. They were family friendly as my sister brought in a stroller and her newborn. We had no waiting time. Great restaurant like this deserves a great review! I'd go back in a heartbeat. One thing, that night I felt a little sick from the fettuccini with jumbo prawns, but it was delicious to eat! ‍
author: Cole D.

description:
Just have to write a review about this place. We are not tourist but was in town with s tourist. She wanted crab so we stoped at Nicks at Fisherman Wharf.  
The guy who helped us out, (and we didn't get his name but he has great curly black hair piled on top of his head) cleaned 3 crabs and packed them for our trip back to San Jose. 
What a great job he did, I don't like the smell, so to my surprise there was absolutely no smell in the car and at the table.  The crab was cleaned and cracked to perfection.  Great job.
author: Char M.

description: there was about a 5 minute wait which is no big deal! The staff was so friendly and fast. they made sure we had everything we needed and were ready to answer questions about the menu! We got the crab, shrimp cocktail, mussels, clam chowder, and red snapper. Every dish was very delicious. the kitchen was a bit busy the night we went, but the chef sent us a free calamari dish to make up for the crab coming out a bit late. i would definitely recommend this place. if you are visiting san francisco and are looking for a great and friendly seafood restaurant with fair prices then i definitely recommend this restaurant !
author: Ryann M.

description:
Review based on the outside crab stand. 

Tourist location!  You bounce around a bit between ordering and paying.  

The crab was outstanding.  Wait a bit to find the seat or stand right around the stand.   Crab had exceptional flavor and was well cooked.  They crack it for you so easy to eat.  

Not sure why they add lettuce!  ;v)  Just gets gross and soggy.
author: Chris M.

description:
If you like chowder. You must have their CRAB chowder its AMAZING....and the service top notch. OMG the lobsters are HUGE. and you can hold them
Outstanding  restaurant you have to ty when in the city!!!  Super experience. Thank you Fernando!!!!!
author: Preston B.

description: Brigitte was a great server, made sure I was taken care of. I stopped in one evening for dinner. Yes, I know it's a tourist spot, but I was there, and I fancied a big pile of fried seafood, and they definitely have one on the menu. The inside is cozy, with a water view out the back.   Price was reasonable and I left stuffed to the gills!
author: Stewart G.

description:
If you are in San Fransisco and looking for quick, quality seafood with spectacular service this is the place to be.

A friend and I had just walked the Pier and were completely famished in search for the best/most affordable seafood on the wharf. While stumbling upon Nick's Lighthouse an employee reached out to us in a friendly manner asking if we had any questions, wanted to know where the seafood came from, what's hot, etc. He was extremely informative and shockingly polite. 

We ended up going with the typical touristy clam chowder bread bowls and even after bypassing all his wonderful suggestions he poured our soup with a smile AND gave us an amazing deal. On top of that, it was probably the best clam chowder I've ever had - Perfect temperature, thick consistency, tons of clams, in a fresh sourdough bowl. It makes my stomach growl just thinking about it!

I will definitely be back here when in town due to the phenomenal customer service, authenticity, and high quality seafood Nick's Lighthouse carries.
author: Dani N.

description:
Staff is not very attentive. If it's not your server they will not serve you. They'll "call your waiter over". Food was delicious. Fried calamari was one of the best I've had. Ambiance was a 7/10. Aliotos next door has a better ambiance for the same price. 


Calamari 5/5
Clam chowder bread bowl 5/5
Pasta 4/5 (size)
author: Evelina C.

description:
Pros

Lightning fast service

Everyone is very helpful and attentive plenty of staff to meet your needs.

Deep fried platter looked absolutely delicious. Unfortunately I did not order it myself. But we will go back again to try it.

Cons

It looks like they fired the house cleaner back in 1950. The amount of dust which has accumulated in the place is atrocious.

Archaic interior design leaves something to be desired for a restaurant his prices indicate they generate quite a bit of revenue.

Commentary:

Set a tour of the southern entrance of the fisherman's wharf is Nick's lighthouse seafood restaurant. When tables are Available a gentleman will be outside calling to you to let you know that the tables are available in the truck more than welcome to come and dine. The restaurant is in a very small compact space however it has more of a cozy intimate feel than a small compact feel. Which is a good thing. 

As I look at the pace of other people, the food look fresh I came out rather quickly and it look like it was enjoyable. My issue with all three things which we ordered was that they were way too salty. It was sourdough bread with Parmesan and butter I don't understand how that salty enough to make me feel like I was going to have a heart attack. The Crab chowder with sludgy chunky and did not have a great flavor. It to was overloaded with salt. The fried zucchini however was excellent. Unfortunately they did not have any marinara sauce to go with it. I asked for marinara sauce and I was actually bought tomato bisque. Ironically enough, that was the one thing that was not at all salty. However, when we looked around at the dishes of other people, some of the food they chose the excellent so maybe the appetizers that we decided on one of the best choices at the restaurant. We are particularly interested in returning for the deep-fried platter. It looked phenomenal!

Conclusion 

The place could use a good rate of deep cleaning like extensive deep cleaning like someone needs to shut it down for a week and just grab it from top to bottom and buy some new ceiling tiles and replace the ventilation system which is caked up with dust. After that, and decreasing the amount of salt and the dishes by 75%; this place could be a real five star treat talked in to the boardwalk. But for today, it's simply gets three stars.

I would go back to this place again. Ultimately I just know it's a 3 Star Place. I would get for if they would honestly just clean it up a bit.
author: Sj B.

description:
We sat down and then weren't acknowledged for another 10 minutes. We were about to get up and leave when the waiter finally came. 

Food was trash. Waiter at one point asked, how is everything? And as I'm about to answer walks away. Cool. 

Don't ever come here.
author: Robert S.

description:
One of the many seafood joints by the pier. They have a dine in restaurant and stand outside. I am just rating only for the stand outside. Chose this place since it had the longest lines assuming the best tasting one. Supposed to be good right?! ;-) 

We ordered their crab cakes which come in three. They did provide packaged tarter sauce for it.  It needed it. The crab cakes were made of real crab but did it lack flavor to me if eaten by itself. It actually looked burnt on the outside but inside was not. It just lacked flavor and maybe cuz it's dry. It was just too dry to the pallet.

The clam chowder I thought it was decent. The chowder did not have a lot of potatoes like others but more soup and clams. They did provide oyster crackers.

Good enough to try once but will try more other stands since there are so many by the pier.
author: Edna G.

description:
Clam chowder bowls are a must if you're visiting San Francisco. I usually go to Boudin, but my boyfriend goes to San Francisco much more frequently than me & frequents this place. They also have a restaurant, but we only ate from the outside area. 

In my opinion, Nicks' has more of an "authentic" clam chowder bowl/SFO feel, not sure if that's the right word, but it's like eating dim sum in Chinatown compared to eating Dim Sum at Panda Express. (Lol i don't know if that makes sense). 

The bowls here are about $2 dollars cheaper than Boudin and I feel like I got a lot more soup. We also got an order of calamari as well. The bread bowls were reasonable ($7.25). The calamari was either really expensive or she overcharged us because our bill was about $28 and we only got a (I didn't even check the price because I was so excited to eat & my bf paid). 

Overall, I would definitely come back and get their clam chowder bowls. I would also want to try their lobster bisque. Their calamari was really good too, but I need to go back and check that price because it seemed a little too expensive for calamari. If you want a for sure place to sit, you can also eat inside their restaurant. Otherwise, you're going to have to defend yourself from the seagulls that fly around.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Food was subpar, like most other comments suggest.
Price was absurd. Was not a $22 meal [IMO AYCE korean bbq and hotpot are worthy $22 meals].

Anyways, I really liked the clam chowder, which was the side/appetizer that came with the meal.
The meal itself I wasn't a huge fan of, but it was edible.

What else... the seats were a little squished, and I felt crammed in between the the table and the backrest.
author: Subrat M.

description: This is what I had. It was a mess on the plate. The space in there is so cramped that it was a struggle just sitting. They took forever to bring water and only refilled the water when we called. My boyfriend ordered shrimp and steak and the steak was so dry he just kept chewing and couldn't swallow it. 2 plate with a calamari appetizer was $70. Good thing I didn't have that much cash on me. I didn't tip them to much because the service was so bad. I could of went to Cheesecake Factory instead of maybe some other restaurant. This place doesn't deserve the money's worth. I can have better seafood for cheaper price.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
This place is too overpriced for the old furniture including the seat booths etc.... corner walls very scuffed up. Their prices are fine dining prices which a restaurant like this is not of the condition its in.
The bathroom toilet seat completely broken. That shows if employee  cleaned the bathroom they did not report it to have it repaired..
Also, two different employees Busser & waiter) were cursing bad words in Spanish! Very unprofessional & inappropriate! We speak Spanish so that's how we understood! It seemed like employees were complaining about patrons! I was so disappointed eating lunch here on my Birthday!
author: Carol M.

description:
We wanted to try a place at the Fisherman Wharf and since everywhere else was super crowded we decided to come in here especially since there was indoor seating and we were seated super fast. 

This place was just meh okay. I expected something a lot better. The clam chowder was bland and the lobster bisque chowder was a bit sour to my liking. I ordered shrimp and scallop pasta and for $26 I expected the portion size to be a lot more, honestly it tasted like they cooked some noodles and added 4 pieces of shrimp and poured over a canned sauce.  

The only good thing about this place they serve you sour dough bread bowl as a snack. 
But you are better off trying something else in the Wharf.
author: Paola P.

description:
This place made my SF trip a bad a experience for the time that I was there.  

Fist, the service it's really bad.  The waiters try to act like they're busy but they are not.  They just move all over the place.  

Then they offered a plate without telling us it was $120 for per plate, yes one plate,  that was not well. Long story short, 2 plates and 1 large mineral water $200.  I was still ok, BUT then I left the waiter a cash $15 tip, since I was not pleased with the service.  I do not exaggerate, the waiter ran out to the street and put me on the spot to tip him $35 because according to him, it was a good service.  I was about to explore but just gave him even more money which hopefully will go to a pool, not to him.  

There are many other restaurants to go in the area, the following night we went to the Elephant Bar, $85 for a great dinner for 4, not 2 plates for 2.
author: Victor S.

description:
We ate outdoor takeout from here. The line was more like a bunch of crowded people around the front and we had no idea where to stand so we just strategically positioned people everywhere that could potentially be the start of a line.

One of the tourists I was with wanted some soup from them so we bought some. It tasted good with the leftover bread we had from Boudin.

They validate parking for the parking lot here.
author: Jeff L.

description: This place is in the heart of pier 39. There is over priced parking right across the street. It's the city so expect parking to suck. I consider myself a seafood expert. Seafood is my favorite food and it's what I mainly eat. This place is on a seafood strip. You can eat inside at the restaurant or the outside little market has counter space. The outside market it's more of a grab and go kind of place. Good seafood is expensive so don't expect to pay a little bit of money. Especially when they have fresh live crab and they cook to order. Some reviews are bad but I personally had a great experience. I came on a holiday weekend they were super busy. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. Price was pretty much the same as everywhere on this strip. They give you fresh crab,plenty of lemon, and butter. There is a few benches were you can eat. The container they give you here is perfect. If you are a seafood lover this is a must try.
author: Isaiah G.

description: The food was subpar...service was not good. One gentleman was very nice when we told him there was a mistake with our order. He said he would inform the kitchen and return...he never came back. Our server laughed when we told him something was not good about my husband's meal. The wait was not long, shrimp cocktail was clean but way over priced. Wouldn't do this again.
author: Aisha W.

description: Felt really sad for the sea animals they serve here. the live crabs and lobsters shouldn't be placed outside of water and tortured to draw in customers. Really sad treatment of animals
author: Rater 1.

description:
First time here ever and why did we stop here you ask????
Luis the waiter he alway help us my wife and I for service the grotto two doors down.  Found him and tried the food with Luis help . It's was awesome thanks Luis !!!! Again the food and service A-1 for us. Again thanks Luis it was great seeing you we will be back too for
author: Kevin S.

description: Terrible service. We went to visit San Francisco. We could not order too much because we went by group tour so we have short time for eating. The old lady server was so ruth. She got mad and talk with my kids so impolite. So upset and really want to recommend you shoud NOT try with this restaurant.
author: Diem N.

description:
Like other establishments here, Nick's has both a sit-down restaurant as well as outdoor stands selling food. We went with the stands because they seemed a little cheaper and faster. Nick's actually has three different stands, which means you may have to wait in multiple lines depending on what you want.

We ordered garlic fries ($4.50), a pint of clam chowder ($9.40), and a small marinated calamari ($4) from one stand. The quality of each item felt skimpy - the fries didn't have enough garlic, the chowder didn't have enough clams, and the calamari had a lot of filler like onions. We might've been happier ordering a dungeness crab, but those were sold at a different stand and the line looked to be a 30 minute wait.

The prices at Nick's looked to be on par with other stands nearby. Had our appetizers been satisfying, we might've decided to get in line for some crab. Instead, we took our wallets and our half-filled stomachs elsewhere.
author: Anson W.

description: The foot is delicious and the service is excellent. Definitely recommend to any coming to fisherman's wharf!
author: Alan H.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! We got three crabs and three dozen oysters and we were able to get everything pretty quick. The manager (maybe owner?) took the time to talk story with us. He gave us extra lemon and butter and even threw in almost a dozen fresh oysters on the house. May it be almost closing time and they didn't want to waste product, or not, we truly appreciate Nick's Lighthouse hospitality and generosity. Fresh, delicious, generous and delicious made our trip to San Francisco worth it! Visiting from Hawaii and having a limited amount of time in the "Mainland"; we definitely don't have time for bad experiences. Our one day in San Francisco was well spent!!!
author: Maile H.

description:
I had a cup of clam chowder, calamari, shrimp cocktail, grilled swordfish.
All was better than expected.  

Food: good
Service: great
Price: good
Ambience: good
author: Yaeko M.

description:
Cleanliness: 1 (bad)
Used same gloves to cashier and serve food

Taste: 2 (unsatisfactory)
Bread was cold, chowder did not have much flavor. It was very simple, potatoes and clams, no herbs, Luke warm

Service: 3 (fair)
Fast paced, no charm or frills, will skip you if you're undecided. 

Cost: 3 (fair)
$8 a bread bowl
author: Food E.

description:
We were going to get the Boudin Clam Chowder but decided to give Nick's Lighthouse a chance. The clam chowder with bread bowl didn't taste good at all and it wasn't cheap at all either. We would go back to Boudin next time if we are craving clam chowder.

The service at Nick's was unprofessional and they were not very helpful. It was like we weren't welcomed.
author: Cecilia C.

description: We ordered a bread bowl of lobster bisque at the outside counter, it was one of the grossest things I have ever put in my mouth. We were starving, but the soup went straight in the trash where it belonged. Just thinking about it makes me nauseous. The best way to describe it is old spaghetti sauce with a touch of soured milk and lobster shells ground up in a blender. There was no lobster in it, and each bite I did eat trying to like it I had to spit shell out. Absolutely disgusting.
author: A K.

description: I love the clam chowder every time I'm in the city I make sure I go there service is good
author: Antonio A.

description:
Terrible.
The oyster not fresh at all. Taste super weird.
We are oysters lovers and came here to try different restaurants oysters.
This one is the worst.

The oyster taste super funny we didn't even finish the plate. There's a little crab in one oyster and it looks even weirder.

We told the waiter and she said can't cancel it. I order to get out of this restaurant, we decided to pay.

There are many good restaurants here, don't get in here simply bcoz of it's affordable price.
author: Cindy T.

description:
This place is amazing! The crab chowder was so good I can't stop thinking about it even after I returned home. Don't skip the bread bowl or the crab cakes. Hubby had the fish and chips but loved the crab. Kid-friendly and casual old-school atmosphere. Our waiter, Isauro, was so helpful and nice.

We read it's been there since 1934. I think it's because of the chowder!
author: Casey T.

description:
Decent food but way too pricey for what you get. Dropped by my first day in San Fran when I was super hungry and not prepared for Cali prices. The place was pretty packed with other tourists and the decor was pretty neat to look at. 

As an appetizer my mom and I ordered fried zucchini, which was pretty delicious. The breading fell apart but I don't think there's much to do about that to be fair. I ordered fish and chips to try a classic, although no fried foods aren't typically my favorite. As expected, I wasn't blown away by the fish or chips. Not the kind of fries that I prefer and the fish was bland in my opinion. Finally, my mom ordered the avocado salad where I had the most issues. I'm not exactly sure what I expected but it wasn't on the salad portion of the menu, I believe it was on the days specials. All I know if that an $18 plate of lettuce isn't what I hoped for. Ok that's a bit harsh, there were other things and now I'll get into specifics because I was horrified by it all. For $18 only you can get your very own plate of lettuce, beets, and onion. Topped off with two slices of tomato, maybe a quarter of an avocado sliced to the side, and a scoop of shredded crab. This would've been fine if it had been explained that it was basically all lettuce. Definitely not worth the price of anything we got. Plenty of other places right next door. Plus if you want good fish and chips, check out the Codmother!
author: Cara H.

description:
Seafood while strolling down Fisherman's Wharf is a must. When there are seafood stalls outside of restaurants with guys yelling at you to buy their goods, how can you not stop by and consuming some mercury? 

This super cozy restaurant (note: I mean it's a really tiny little restaurant) could definitely use a make-over. It's dated (they've been around since 1934!) and probably has seen better days. It's still a super popular spot. Service could be better though and if they hired more bussers and wait staff, things could run a lot more smoothly. I had actually wanted to go next door to a more favored spot but the two gentleman outside convinced us to give them a try. So tada! Lunch is served.

Three of us decided to order half a dozen Blue Point oysters and three lunch entrees. The oysters were okay. I wasn't too impressed. They were a bit meager and lacked any distinct flavor. I had ordered the Red Snapper Napolitano for myself and it wasn't anything spectacular. The marinara used overpowered the fish as did the capers. The flavor profile was all over the place. The Linguine with Mussels were decent. I don't think I've eaten mussels so plump. The Fettuccine Alfredo with Shrimp and Scallops was the dish I probably enjoyed the most and that's not saying much. The scallops were disappointingly small and the shrimp seem to be the frozen variety but heavy cream sauce is always tasty. My lobster bisque was incredibly fishy and I had pushed it aside but the clam chowder was decent. That was probably the best thing we had.

All in all, I don't think I'll be back. We had to wave down our waitress halfway through our entrees to ask about the oyster and overall, it wasn't that impressive of a place.
author: Joyce W.

description: My favorite clam chowder bread bowl place was closed by the time we arrived so we tried Nick's Lighthouse.  It was super disappointing.  The flavor fell short and the other seafood did not taste very fresh.  I will avoid the next time I'm in the area.
author: Nancy P.

description:
This place is so overpriced and I was really disappointed with my experience here.

I got the chilled seafood platter and I couldn't even finish the oysters because they were so disgustingly slimey and not fresh at all (and I normally LOVE oysters). They make the plate seem full, its cause they load the plate with salad that you can't even eat cause it just gets soaked with all the seafood juices. In reality, the portion sizes are really disappointing especially considering it costs $31. I don't know what kind of seafood they got, but everything lacked taste. For the shrimp, if you closed your eyes, you wouldn't even be able to tell what it was since it was just so plain. 

I also got the clam shower bread bowl. The bread is cold. Like not even room termperature, actually cold. I guess they took them out of fridge or something, which is honestly pretty disgusting for "fresh chowder". At least they added a decent amount of seafood in the chowder, but taste wise, it was very mediocre.

Finally, the free bread they gave you with the meal was burn. It was entirely dark brown/black, you can't even eat the crust if you wanted to.

Absolutely avoid this place at ALL costs! Not worth the price and I wouldn't even eat here if it was free.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
I went to the stand outside and ordered fish and chips (~$10.50). There were a lot of curly fries and 5 - 6 pieces of fish. The fish was oily and wasn't super crispy. The fries were a little bit soggy. They were very soggy as I got to the bottom of the plate. The lemon slices made the fries and fish taste much better. 

There was not much outside seating near the area that was clean. There were too many seagulls trying to grab food, so I couldn't take a picture of the size. 

Overall, the food was just ok.
author: Kristina M.

description: $18 for two sourdough bread bowl soups (Lobster Bisque and Clam Chowder). Bread was great, soup was filling but lacked significant flavor that we were hoping for. Also, staff was cordial but not friendly.
author: Grayson W.

description:
Let's just say, once we got the food, we could hear crickets since nobody spoke for a good 10 minutes, as we were chow'ing down the chowder and cioppino (seafood stew). 

We tried all the chowder samples from the exterior shacks. We chose nicks since we liked. We chose to sit inside as it was a tad bit chilly outside. Glad we chose to sit inside since the waiter was able to recommend the seafood stew and the fried sampler platter. The sampler platter was just ok since it was too much friedness in one sitting. Wish they did this in a garlic white wine sauce. The ambiance is good for family but it's a bit stuffy inside. But in all, it's a good place to check out if you want to get your San Francisco chowder fix!!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Yes, of course it's a tourist attraction and yes the wait was outlandish but my pasta was good and there's no telling where the seafood actually comes from but everything together tasted fresh and was filling for the price.

I had some sort of garlic shrimp pasta concoction which was great. Scott had some bay shrimp (aka, puny shrimp) red sauced ravioli which I was this close to swapping my meal with his because I thought it was pretty bomb. He was disappointed that he discovered what bay shrimp was only AFTER he had ordered his entree. Poor thing! Needless to say it was delicious.

Side note, why was the bread so stale? It was literally inedible. It was so hard you absolutely could not for the life of you even bite into it without chipping a tooth. Beware of the free bread!
author: Alexys E.

description: My husband and I ordered a whole crab meal. We were told that the crab was $20/lb. we ordered a 2 pound crab. The crab that was given to us was definitely not 2lb. It was extremely small. The clam chowder that came with the meal was the worst clam chowder that I have eaten. Do not ever order the oyster Rockefeller!  It was such a ripoff. The sauté shellfish plate was so salty that we couldn't eat it at all. The service was ok. BEWARE- they charge you 4% for "gov mandate". See below picture. We were told that the gov mandate was to help pay for their employee health insurance. I can't believe it!
author: Emma T.

description: So I was going to go to the fancier restaurant on the pier, but decided to try one of the smaller spots because I believed it would be cheaper and taste better! I was so happy with this spot. At first I was scared. The place looked like it needed a whole entire makeover. The bathroom was a nightmare but I'm not one to stress the small stuff lol. I like the quality of the food over everything. I ordered the crab chowder which was delicious. My dinner was the whole crab in the spicy sauce, I told them medium heat. AMAZING again. Staff was so nice and helpful. I'm going back tomorrow. 2 thumbs up.
author: Kay R.

description: Great service but food was lacking. Prices right so it's one of those times that you get what you pay for.
author: Christopher E.

description: Food was great.  This is the second time of ate here.  Last time was 6 or 7 years ago.  Very busy.  I had the mixed seafood pasta plate.  Everything tasted fresh and great.  My wife had the muscles and she enjoyed them.  I also had the clam chowder and it was very good.  My son had the appetizer calamari and at least for me was the best of all the food.
author: David M.

description: First, the clam chowder was watery. Boudin is much better and closer to the Wharf.  Next, the lobster bisque was beyond salty. Highly disappointed and most disgusting seafood I've ever eaten. I would not waste my time and skip this from itinerary on future visits.
author: Steven Q.

description:
definitely a huge tourist location.  I popped over to the city with my friend to buy some new pants and afterward, we decided to pretend to be tourists for a bit, so we headed to fisherman's wharf to find a place for clam chowder and seafood!

We settled on Nick's because there was a man outside yelling that there was one table left so we just figured, what the hell, let's do it.

We sat down and were immediately greeted by our waiter.  He was pretty pushy and we were suckered into buying a calamari appetizer.  I'm not that upset about it though because it was decent.  a little tough though.  I don't like pushy waiters, because I can definitely order for myself, but I get it.  It's a tourist spot and I guess I can respect the tactic, haha.

Our clam chowders were DELICIOUS though!  I ordered the capelloni (I think that's what it was called)  and it was ok.  Not amazing, but it was ok, there was some nice crab inside with shrimp.  Not amazingly fresh, which was a little disappointing.  My friend ordered the seafood pasta, which she really loved.  My favorite part was definitely the clam chowder though!  It honestly took the place of my favorite San Francisco clam chowder from another restaurant I frequent in the city.  

GREAT SOURDOUGH BREAD!

I'm not sure if I'll go back for a whole dinner, but I'd definitely go back for just a bowl of clam chowder!  I'd say to just go here for the soup.
author: Kevin K.

description:
When you're in Fisherman's Wharf and you're walking down the row of seafood proprietors and restaurant hosts as they are calling out "Are you hungry?!", "Come on come in, let's get you seated right away!", "The best, fresh crab cocktail right here!"... how do you know which one to pick? Well, you don't! You just kinda go to where your body gravitates or whoever sold the better pitch!

Even though we just had brunch, we got lured into Nick's and were immediately seated in a cozy circular booth. We decided on a light "snack" and ordered 1/2 dozen Blue Point oysters, prawn cocktail, and some crab chowder with a couple bottles of Stella beer.

Everything tasted as fresh (and delicious) as expected. Really, it would be a travesty if it didn't! Service was friendly and efficient. Total for everything, with 20% tip, came to $65. Pricey snack but it is expected for fresh seafood and it was worth every penny.
author: Julie B.

description: Oh my gosh!!! I was told the crab is fresh.. But it was DRY!! Very Dry!!! You can tell its been sitting in their fridge. Please if you love your hard earned money, DONT EAT at this place!
author: Maggie A.

description:
Over priced and they say a pint of beer is 16 Oz of beer but I brought a 12 ounce Coca-Cola poured it into the 16 ounce cup and it filled it up completely to the top!!! It's way overpriced inside. 
Not at all a happy costumer!!!
And then to top it off this place has  the worst calamari I've ever had in my life!
author: Kyle R.

description:
Love Nicks lighthouse! 
Food is amazing and so is the staff.
I try and go there almost every time I am in San Fran. 
Which is often...
It's one of the original/oldest restaurants left on the warf.
Try the crab Mac and cheese
author: Ashley S.

description:
I had been walking and on my feet for over6 hours. Having seen the great looking seafood vendors I thought taking a seat in a restaurant behind them would give me the best of 2 world's, a rest and great seafood.

Well, I got the rest.

Being an East Coaster I know crab and lobster.  Nick's does not.

The lobster bisque may have been cooked with a lobster watching,but none made it into my tomato soup.

The crab sandwich was served ,looked and tasted like a tuna sandwich with less flavor.  The bread looked toasted but it was a special effect because it was out of the bag of bread soft.

The fries were just awful,unless you like cold and funny tasting.

I've had bad meals the past 2 months I've been traveling but this was the most disappointing....by far.
author: Thomas B.

description:
Bread bowl with clam chowder $9 with tax.

AMAZING. So good. So good. So good. 

Get it. Don't hesitate. Oh and the stall next to it had some decent calamari. I'd get that too.
author: Jacqui L.

description:
Picking a place to eat fresh dungeness crab at Fisherman's Wharf is basically picking blindly out of a hat. All of the restaurants offer basically the same type of food, just a matter if which one appeals to you. They all have a hot boiling pot of water, just waiting for the crab to be dumped in. There are even salesmen outside trying to lure you into their restaurant. They're really pushy...reminds me of people at an outdoor flea market. Honestly, I can't even tell you why we chose Nick's.

We ordered a whole dungeness crab which was about $30. Yes, it's overpiced. But then again, you're in a touristy area. The crab tasted fresh, without a doubt. There was plenty of meat in the claws/body of the crab. By ordering the crab, it also comes with a side. We decided on getting the crab chowder and it was pretty good! I wish we got more than a cup though. 

My biggest complaint was the size of the tables inside the restaurant. SUPER crammed. You can barely move once you're seated cause the table is so close to you. Not a relaxing environment at all. Luckily, devouring the fresh crab made me temporarily forget about the tough seating arrangements.
author: Jason L.

description:
Our experience here ruined our good memories about our second SF trip. The servers are sooo rude! The food is not even superb. We ate at Sabella & La Torre during our first SF trip (yr2017) and the food is good and servers were nice - but since it was crowded when we got there, we decided to try this place.
Do not spend your money and time here, it's not worth it!
author: Joan T.

description: The whole family was loving everything we ordered! Fried shrimp, calamari, shrimp cocktails & a NY steak sandwich! Cool view of Pier 39
author: Brenda G.

description: After so many bad experiences with other restaurants, Nick's had us leave full and happy! They were really busy inside, but our server made sure we had everything we needed. My steak was cooked perfectly and all of our food was seasoned so nicely. Their chowder is bomb so don't skip that. We had the perfect view of the water as well. Unfortunately, I wouldn't suggest this as a large group environment, but it's perfect for a date night or small gathering.
author: Trish O.

description: Came here yesterday after spending some time walking up and down the wharf.  Place is really small and cramped.  4 of us sat at their largest table and it was still too small for all the menus, cups, plates and cutlery.  I ordered the linguini and Dungeness crab and It came with ur choice of soup (ordered the lobster bisque) or salad.  The food came out pretty fast.  The seafood was fresh and the taste of the sauce was good.  They offered a generous amoint of crab bits,  seems like every bite there was some amoint od crab in it.  The pasta was cooked well, not too aldente or too mushy.  Would've given them a 4 star but they double charged us food we didn't order which would've been a problem of we didn't catch it and the place was to cramped to enjoy.  Majority od the staff was not too friensly, thankfully we had a nice waitress.  Overall, the food was good but will be trying other offerings at fisherman's wharf in the future.
author: Benedict A.

description:
Long story short: Their crab sandwich gave me food poisoning and as a sandwich it was abysmal as well. The crab chowder was quite acceptable though (which is why it's 1/5 not 0/5)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On Thanksgiving morning (having completed a successful and healthy bowel movement), I decided to go on a long walk and grab a light meal before the main event at a relative's house. I walked from FiDi to Liguria bakery hoping to get some Foccacia, but they were closed. Discouraged, but not defeated, I trudged onwards to Fisherman's wharf. 

After observing the sea lions for a bit, I meandered over to the section of the wharf with the sidewalk shacks and restaurants. After browsing the menus posted outside, I made my biggest sober mistake of 2017: entering Nick's Lighthouse (not a euphemism).

It was fairly empty at the time, so service was quite prompt. I made my decision pretty quickly: A small cup of crab chowder and the Crab sandwich. Once the chowder came out, I went through it pretty quickly and it was quite delicious, especially since I had doused it with hot sauce. 

Then came the sandwich: Bread was solid, lightly toasted, fresh. But what was inside...well let's just say I'm avoiding mayonnaise for a while. It was extremely heavy on the mayo, they probably should have described it as "Mayo sandwich with some crab". There was also some finely chopped crab, and what looked like the occasional fleck of celery and/or carrot. Anyway, it wasn't that great, I only ate around 1/3 of it before calling it quits. I paid, grabbed a ride share, and eventually made my way to the South Bay by early evening. 

By the time dinner was served, I knew there was something wrong. Despite the small volume I had eaten, I was still feeling unusually full, bloated even. I also felt lethargic and feverish. I had a few bites of what my hosts were offering, but I really wasn't in the mood to eat. Shortly after, it began. 

Nature called, and being a somewhat civilized individual, I went to the bathroom to answer. However, this was a case of "What goes down, must come up". 

For those of you that have seen the exorcist, my projectile vomiting was like the movie, but with better aim. For those of you that have not seen the movie, imagine oatmeal/porridge  coming out of your mouth with the force of a Saturn V rocket launch (link below). However, instead of the colour or smell of oatmeal, it has this disgusting brownish red colour (think Utah Sandstone, but wet) and a putrid marine bottom feeder stench that only a seagull could love. That smell is likely to linger in that bathroom for a while, the residents may need to move out.  

The "pandemonium vomitorium" continued on and off for a solid 45 minutes. I kind of wish somebody could have caught the event with a slow motion camera, it would have made a great viral or national geographic video on bodily functions. When I skulked out of the bathroom, I realized I needed to return home. Since I had pretty much emptied out my insides and because of the skilled driving of Lyft driver Zyed, we had an uneventful ride. 

I drank some water and it appeared I could keep down liquids. I thought my condition was improving! I was wrong. A few hours later, the other end started to fire up instead. Mud coming out of a wood chipper is my most apt description and should suffice. I had a sleepless night since I had to get up and use the bathroom roughly every 45 minutes. 

The next day I went to work. Later on when looking for lunch options, everything was closed except McDonalds because of Black Friday. I had my 6 piece McNuggets, and I successfully kept it down...for two hours. Then it came back up....the other end continued to fit the wood chipper description. 

By Friday night I was mostly back to normal, but the point is, Nick's ruined my Thanksgiving.
author: Parvez A.

description:
When in SF, you gotta have clam chowder right?

I came in with a group of about 8 late rainy night.  Clam chowder sounded about right for the weather.  I ordered the Clam Chowder bread bowl.  It was decent, but might have needed a bit more flavor.  

Overall, good food, friendly and efficient service.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I had a magical day in the wonderful city of San Francisco and I topped it off with a stop by what is now one of my favorite places! 

The boo thing and I began with a 1/4 loaf of bread and shrimp cocktail, which was to die for! I finished my meal with the Lobster Thermidor (Australian Lobster in White Wine Cream Sauce, Mushrooms, Parmesan Cheese & baked in its own shell) and a lobster bisque, yum! He had the Deep Fried Platter (Fried Dungeness Crab Legs, Sea Scallops,Tiger Prawns, Pacific Oysters, Calamari, Fish with French Fried Potatoes) and the clam chowder. I couldn't help but steal his calamari which was the BEST! 

I loved the mixture of hustle & bustle and intimacy that the cramped restaurant provided. And I am a fan of the service from the wait staff, super professional! 

The only thing I didn't like was that I was seated towards the back by sea lions... they don't smell too great!

I would suggest this place to anyone who loves seafood and intimate spaces.
author: James H.

description: Terrible experience. Never come back again. Service bad. Food not good. Expensive than others. Not honest person. Not recommended!
author: Ken H.

description:
Ehhhh................My friends and I accidentally walked into this restaurant. We originally had the place next door in mind but the exterior format confused us.This was one of the poor choices we made that day. 

The service was just okay but at times my friends and I felt neglected. We would have to wait to catch their attention as they stood there chatting. The food wasn't that good either and would go cold super fast because of the rotating fans above us. I ordered the lobster based soup and my friend got the clam chowder. The clam chowder was bland in flavor and a bit watery. The lobster soup was good because of the lobster bits and was the only thing I really enjoyed. We also got calamari rings which were mediocre. 

It does have a view of the dock and the interior is interestingly decorated. The tables can even be merged with the removal of the small wall in between the tables.  The bathrooms in particular were not clean. I waited for the female stall to open up to see a male staff walk out. The male stall was entirely fine but either he really had to go or he couldn't care any less. It felt uncomfortable using the stall after he did. Not pleasant at all. 

I paid with my credit card but they told me it didn't work so I gave them cash instead. Turns out it did work when I went to the Starbucks at the Wharf a little while later. Don't really know what was up with that. Maybe because the waitress couldn't swipe the card properly. 

I'd say this place would have a smidgen of potential if the staff were more attentive and interested in their job.
author: Jessica Q.

description: The food is just okay. The clam chowder, okay. The pasta I had was...okay. The bread was okay and so were my sons chicken tenders. He had the best plate actually. Pricey as well.
author: Patricia G.

description: Great seafood stand right on the wharf. Get the clam chowder bread bowl, you will not be disappointed. There are multiple stands, but I can vouch for this one.
author: Eric S.

description:
Based off of the reviews I was expecting a lot worse from here. The food was pretty good, the crab had a nice saltiness to it and the shrimp was really good. It was however a little over $50 for 1 lb and one crab. 

Also the dining was pretty messy but what can you expect for the whole fisherman wharf experience?
author: Stephanie F.

description: We have eaten at many places on the wharf and wanted to add this one to our list. The service was very good, the food, not so much. I would expect the Dungeness crab to be excellent considering the locale, but it was mushy and difficult to get out of the shell, an indication of frozen, not fresh crab, which was over cooked. Very disappointed. My Wife had the scallops which were just OK. The wine list was good and well priced. I wish I could have given it a better rating considering its historical location and operation.
author: Jim W.

description: Got food at the stand outside.  The food looked fresh & hot & they had a line late at night.  We got fried shrimp & fish & chips.  The people in front of us got shrimp & got a huge order.  Our order was the remaining shrimp (we thought they would make more for us). Fish tasted fishy & chips were inedible
author: Just K.

description: Good for street food. Skip the fried breaded shrimp and go for the bread bowl with the clam chowder in it for $7.75. If you like a bit of a less-creamy, more watery / thinned out chowder, this is the place for you. Could use more clams in aforementioned chowder.
author: Dan E.

description:
Overpriced Mediocre Food

Precious wanted a crab.  It was late in the day, and we just got off a ferry, and we were hungry.  I don't know why Precious was attracted to this place.  When we got in there, the first impression that I got was how cramped it was.  We had to cram ourselves in the booth.  Tulita is petite, and she had no problem, but for me it was very uncomfortable.

Precious ordered lobster bisque and a big crab.  I ordered the fried oyster po boy.  Tulita ordered a salad.  Precious was pleased with the lobster bisque, but the crab was mediocre.  She couldn't finish it so I offered to help out.  It was severely devoid of spices.  The fried oyster po boy was awful.  The oysters were soggy and tasteless.

And then for the three of us the bill came to $120.  I would never go to this place again.
author: Dave M.

description: I would not give this place a star at all if I could, but I have to in order to rate it. First time coming to this place and decided to do take out from the outside booth versus dinning in. Mind you, there are TWO booths for the same restaurant. All I wanted was steam crab, raw clams and oysters. They had me go pay at the next booth, so I decided to purchase fish and chips and fried shrimp at the booth. I told the cashier lady that I was sent over here to pay for the crab, raw clams and oyster. She asked the guy and they had a large argument in Spanish and told me to go back to purchase the crab at the booth I was originally was at. I went back and he gave me a ticket to go back and pay the lady cashier and also told me tat I also have to order the raw clams and oysters at the lady's booth....but it was not on the menu at the lady's booth and the lady had originally told me to buy it at the guys booth! I got irritated as I had to wait in the long line and when I finally got my food, there were no sauce of any sort....nothing. I understand that they were busy, but this was the worst costumer service I have had thus far while visiting Fishermans wharf.
author: Crystal T.

description: Got the fried calamari and fried prawns.  Prawns were being cooked fresh so gentleman behind the counter gave me a generous portion of calamari - so amazingly good!!  The prawns were good too, but the calamari was fantastic!
author: Claudia M.

description: Tourist trap now a days ! The food overall was terrible.  I gave most of it away to the homeless on the street!  Cod fish was greasy and not tasty.    The place is old ! But with old comes charm and tasty.   This is not the case.  Not fresh.   Shame.   I hate giving this review.
author: N S.

description:
I started going to Nick's Lighthouse when I was a child. My grandparents took me here to get clam chowder during cold December days. 

When I was older, I took my girlfriend (now wife) to Nick's. It had been years since I was last there and it was everything I remembered from my childhood. 

Great service, charming ambiance, and excellent food.

My wife and I have made Nick's Lighthouse into our special anniversary restaurant. 

We ate there tonight (9/23/17), and once again we had a perfect evening.
author: Dan E.

description: Disgusting I'm so disappointed my noodles for my pasta was cooked hours previous! My clam chowder was not clam anything and my lobster bisque was disgusting!!! I spent $90 for nothing we didn't even eat. Please spend your money elsewhere!! We should have known better when we were walking by and they were begging for us to eat there right ‍‍‍
author: ShyAnn V.

description: Gosh I really wanted to give them 5 Stars, but the waiter screwed up big time when he followed me out side and reminding me that the minimum tip is 20 percent.
author: Mohammad S.

description:
Overall not impressed at all.

1. Charge normal prices for cheap proportions. Bread bowl was mostly bread, very little soup. Combo cocktail had lots of lettuce padding at the bottom so had less crab / shrimp than expected. 

2. Disorganized / not great service. Our order was taken by someone who wasn't a waiter because waiters were too disorganized to tend to us properly / seemed like they couldn't handle a normal / busy day. 

3. Little dirty. Guess that's to be expected by the pier and by the fish market but still. Not worth the $$. 

4. Food was not great. Clam chowder was the best thing we had but it's better at other places. Lobster bisque tasted reaaallly fishy (maybe they mixed it with fish or something??), Lobster not supposed to taste like that. Crab meat was not bad, shrimp in the cocktail was okay.

Oh forgot to add - seats are really cramped / no leg room and they didn't give us bread.
author: Kevin C.

description: Just simply amazing!! Oysters are the bomb...all food was delicious  family sitting and reasonable prices .. left very happy.. thank you
author: Christina G.

description:
Food was pretty good but dining environment was awful.  We were seated at a booth that was tiny and left us feeling miserable and claustrophobic.  There is hardly any room to walk around inside and the line for the restroom was insane.  I finally made it inside the restroom and immediately regretted it as it was disgusting!!!  

We won't be back as there are just too many yummy choices in the area.
author: Amy Q.

description:
Apart from a nice waiter nothing to save. We had the special Cioppino mix, spaghetti vongole, Neptune Salad, dungeen crabcake, and Fish & Chips.
The quality of the food is lousy. The spaghetti were tasteless and the crab of the crabcake were killed by drowning them in the garlic.
Add 2 beers, and 4 sodas and you get a check of $ 211.00!! Definitely not worth even half of the money. Stay away is just a trap for tourist (as we were).
author: Mimmo D.

description:
Since this restaurant was located at Fisherman's Wharf with the seafood being fresh and being a sit down place, I expected it to be expensive. But at the same time, I expected the food to wow me or at least give me some indication that the food was worth the price. I also expected some decent service. In the end, the food was alright but not worth the price and the service was barely there. I should have just gotten food from an outside stand. 

The service was horrible. We didn't get any plates or utensils until 5-10 minutes after our food came out. I tried flagging down someone but no one was responding and or ignoring me. I understand that they were busy so I'll cut them a little slack for that. 

My girlfriend and I got a crab cake and bouliabasse which came with a clam chowder. The crab came was alright but kind of bland. The bouliabasse was seafood located in a sea of red liquid consisting mostly of tomato sauce and white wine. The seafood was drowning in it. Our clam chowder was never brought out until I asked the server if our food came with clam chowder. He promptly went to go grab one for us. 

All of that food plus two soda costs us 70$. I could have gone out to the stands and gotten at least twice as much food and been more satisfied and happy.
author: Solomon H.

description:
Looking for the best clam chowder in this area will be difficult to find. We stumbled across this place because we were tired of looking for a place to eat and we also wanted to sit down (you can order it outside to go too). My friend and I both ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl and she also ordered garlic fries. Our food took a while to come but by the time it did come we were too full from our bread. The clam chowder itself was okay. It wasn't bad but it wasn't the best thing ever. I felt bad because I barely even touched the bread bowl. I probably wouldn't recommend getting it in a bread bowl because it's a lot of bread and it'd be hard to finish it all. (Seeing as this place is very touristy, I would recommend it if you've never had it before).We were so full from the free bread that we barely finished our clam chowder and didn't even touch the fries.

The inside of the restaurant is very nice with lots of random decorations that all seem to fit together.
author: Tiffany C.
