description: Every time we go to San Francisco we go straight to the Warf.... absolutely the best seafood always with an Italian twist in the pasta... welcome to the fabulous NICKS lighthouse.... it's been there forever it's small yet we've always been able to get in and have never ever been disappointed ...the serving sizes are large everything on the menu is wonderful.... fresh and absolutely fabulous service...our favorite warf side seafood fix!!!
author: Janet C.

description:
A visit to the Fishermans wharf is incomplete if you have not had Clam Chowder and Crab Cakes .
Most of the restaurants serve the same style of food and you can walk into any of the stands to try fresh sea-food. 
If you are eating outside, do keep in mind that these places don't look clean and there might be garbage dumped outside. Plus, you get to compete with the seagulls for your food. 
We usually take the food to-go and eat on the pier on a comfortable bench.
Nicks lighthouse can get pretty crowded but they are super fast and everything is served immediately!
They serve variety of fried and steamed sea food. From lobsters, dungeness crab, shrimps, clams to oysters...they have everything! Both hot and cold options are available.
We tried the Clam chowder in a bread bowl - best $7 I have ever spent on sea food. They also serve Lobster bisque and Crab chowder but both of them don't come close to the flavors of Clam Chowder!
Crab cakes - 3 for $10 is a steal. Lightly fried with crab meat and veggies, almost like a crab patty. This is a must try. 
Shrimp sandwich is shrimp salad inside a sourdough bread. While the shrimp salad is creamy textured and flavorful, sourdough bread can be pretty hard. I just wish they had more options of bread on the stands.
Steamed clams and oysters are super tasty and served fresh. 
But like my friend says this place is a tourist trap and food can be slightly expensive than other parts of the city. Well partially right because sea food is not cheap  either.
So if you are an avid sea-food lover and happen to visit the Wharf - it's definitely worth a try!
author: Sudesna M.

description: We went to the little shack outside of the actual restaurant. The boy behind the counter was very sweet and they were very quick with service. The clam chowder bread bowl was great and by far better then the one served at Boudin's. Also, cheaper then Boudin's and most of the other restaurants.
author: Emma J.

description:
I always go to Nick's when I come to SF, but I'll never come again.

The food was pretty good, as usual. We got the clam chowder, live lobster, and meat sauce spaghetti. However what was extremely alarming was that we were nearly scammed. When we asked for the check, the tip was already added -- which was fine and reasonable. On the customer copy of the receipt, the total amount was correct. On the merchant copy, the prefilled total was exactly $100 more than the customer copy. If we hadn't noticed it, I'm pretty sure we would've paid $100 more for nothing. 

Tldr; food is pretty good but always check the receipt. I've lost my trust in this establishment.
author: Karen K.

description: I would suggest to just stand in line to get food on the food stands outside. They are cheap and reasonable. How will I start. First service. I understand that they are busy but, no one even set our tables up they didn't get gave us utensils or plates or napkins to eat. We have been trying to gain someone's attention but everyone seems to pretend that they are busy (busy chatting with one another). So as a result our appetizers are out and guess what we still don't have utensils. So we have been starring at our appetizers for a good 10 minutes before some one actually noticed that we can't eat because we do not have freaking utensils. Anyway on to the food. I am very disappointed with the food and its price. We ordered crab cake as an appetizer and guess how much it is for 1 piece of crab cake! It's $16. And imagine my disappointment when I turn around and check their menu in their food stand outside. They are selling the crab cakes 3 for $10. I was pretty mind blown. Okay on to the most exciting part, their special. We order Bouliabasse which came with Dungeness Crab, Jumbo Prawns, Manila Clams, Calamari, MediterraneanMussels, Sea Scallops, Fresh Fish, Tomato Sauce, Parsley, Garlic, Green Onion, & White Wine. It is very bland and swimming in its sauce. Plating is dirty and it's look is not very appealing to eat. With that being said, they forgot to give us the clam chowder which was supposed to be an appetizer. With the crab cake and the bouliabasse our with 2 sodas our total was almost $70. Imagine my disappointment. So let me warn you. Stay away from this place. And just eat on the food stands. I would never going to recommend this place or even come back to this place.
author: Gicele C.

description: 100% recommend! Delicious food, Quick service, friendly waiters, clean/neat interior.  It is pretty expensive but you will most definitely get your pennies worth! :)
author: Reagan G.

description:
It may not look appealing when you walk up but the service is fantastic and the food quality/taste
Is fantastic!! The Red Snapper Napoloitino and the Cioppino was fabulous!!!
author: Priscilla F.

description: Don't be turned off by the prices.  There are specials inside but the food was terrific.  We had the oyster po-boy, clam chowder, fettuccine with shrimp and scallops and crab caesar salad.  The po-boy was the best I have ever had so far and was only about $10-$15 and came with fries and coleslaw.  The crab caesar salad was ok.  I found the crab good but tasted plain.  The clam chowder was very good.  But the star was the oyster po-boy sandwich and is a must have!
author: Jim C.

description: I'm just a little disappointed in the clam chowder to be honest. We should've bought the chowder on the actual pier but waited too the end. Still ok but not Fishermans Wharf good. The shrimp and chips was BOMB! My wife and I loved that. And the sauce was delicious!
author: Eddie H.

description:
You gotta do the clam chowder bowl in the wharf at least once. Yes, it's super touristy but there's a certain charm from eating on the wharf with your clam chowder on your lap while being serenaded by a street musician and seagulls gunning for your food. 
The clam chowder was aiiightt.. and the bread bowl... aiightt but still enjoyable. The crab sandwich was full of crab and the calamari was actually really good. Grab some napkins because it's goinna get a lil messy.
author: Heather M.

description: The guy out front told us the open crab would cost us $25 with a free soup or salad. He also said we could go inside to eat. We did and our bill came out to $47. When I showed him the bill he said it was two different prices. Total scam
author: Oshay M.

description: We hadn't been to San Francisco for about 15 years at least so I was excited. We were hungry and came across this place as my husband saw some questions walk out with huge fried prawns. First off sat at a table for 2, we are not small people so it was snug. I am short and the table was so high my boobs rested on table. LOL. we sat there for about 10 mins no waiter. Finally had bread thrown on table. Cold and too hard to eat. Finally was acknowledged by someone only to never have him return. A young waiter came over and took order, had to repeat it numerous times. Never got refills on drinks or the water I ordered. We orfered app of fries those never came but charged for them. My food, a shrimp pasta, came 5 mins before my hubby's. It was ok. Finally his food, fried prawns, came out 5 small prawns, some very raw broccoli with huge amounts of garlic and the app of fries we ordered came on his plate. It was a handful. His food was cold and sucked. After we ate we sat for about 10 mins before we could even get bill. It was the worst lunch ever. We never got tarter sauce or any condiments after we had to ask for it. Will never eat here again.
author: Cassandra D.

description:
I and my group ordered a bunch of pastas.  But one of my friends who had been to this place 20 years earlier ordered the Cioppino because it was what he ordered on his date night with his wife.  

The place has a great ambience perfect for a seaside touristy seafood place.  The service was superb.  At one point, we pointed out that they hadn't brought out our calamari and something else.  The floor manager came over and profusely apologized and got a bunch of the crew to jump on everything for us the rest of the meal and we were treated like royalty from that point forward.

The food was not a 100 on all dishes, but the pasta bolognese ordered by 2 of our group proved to be the winner of the table for best dish.  Yeah, we shared a dozen dishes.  

Definitely worth the visit.
author: David K.

description: A Thrillist article led me here for their crab chowder, so I wanted to try something different and got it. I was disappointed and wished I had gotten the clam chowder instead - there was basically no crab in this soup, mostly potatoes. Flavorful, yes, but I expected some seafood.
author: Ling X.

description: Service was good but crab was just okay. We got one whole crab for $20 (after tax). I think the clam chowder in the bread bowl is the way to go though. That looked pretty good.
author: Mailoha A.

description: We asked outside how much the crab would be. He weighed on and said $25 then said we could sit inside and get free soup with it so we said sure. We ordered the crab. When the bill came it was $37!!! Total bait & switch!!!! Buyer beware. Also their bread had good flavor but could totally tell they microwaved it. I'd recommend NOT going to that spot!
author: Sue H.

description:
If you are claustrophobic this is the not the place for you.  I'm pretty small and the tables were still too small for me.  It's super uncomfortable and the restrooms looks like ones that are from the cruise ship. TINY.

The clam chowder was just okay, I had better at the Pier before.  We got al po boy sandwich, it was pretty good.  It's a fried oyster sandwich.  It tastes like fuji's buffet fried oyster, stuffed in a loaf of bread.  But, if you came to Pier 39 to try out their seafood.  This wouldn't be the place for you.  You're better off just trying the food stands or other restaurants near by.

I felt like this place wasted my time, it didn't amaze me.
author: Joyce L.

description: Service was poor. The soup wasn't even warm. They took very long to come to the table to take our order. Not what we thought it would be especially in fishers man wharf
author: Christina K.

description:
We were walking at the Wharf and decided to grab a bread bowl of chowder. There are so many restaurants along the strip of the Wharf that sells the exact same thing: seafood and soups/bread bowl soups. We wanted a place to sit and got waved in by the host at this restaurant and just decided to go in to grab a bread bowl of soup. 

For the atmosphere, if you are claustrophobic or don't like tight spaces, it would be best to not come here. The tables were oddly very small and tight. The table was so close to the booth's seat.  

We all got bread bowl soups. I got the lobster bisque and my party got bread bowl clam chowder. The lobster bisque tasted just okay for me... Nothing remarkable compared to the many reviews I've seen on their lobster bisque. But being that it was sooo cold at the pier, the hot soup was just so comforting. **Also, being that the soup was in the bread bowl, the inside of the bowl was very thick, so the amount of soup was literally 3/4 to 1 cup only. 

It's pretty pricey as well, turned out its $1-2 more than Boudin's bread museum/restaurant on the same strip. 

Service was below average. Our server was not attentive at all. We saw him once: once to take our order and food was brought out by another server. Water cups remained empty up until we left. We waited so long to finally pay our check and get out of there.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I got a crab meat and bay shrimp combo in a cup from the shop not a restaurant. I felt super sick after couple hours, got a sweating and throwing up.
author: C S.

description:
Damn, we stuffed ourselves here. I know I shouldn't judge a book by its cover, but when we first went in, I wasn't really expecting much. I thought it would be just a mediocre restaurant in a touristy area. 

BUT the food was very very good! We ordered the crab cake, fish and chips, fried calamari, and clam chowder in a bread bowl. The fish in the fish and chips was very soft and moist with a crispy outside. The calamari was not chewy at all! The crab cake was packed with crab meat. The clam chowder was very tasty, not salty at all.

Overall, it was a very satisfying meal!!
author: Sun Bin Y.

description: At request, prepared our crab in a extra spicy broth (opposed to the other crab stalls offering Tabasco as 'spicy'). Also had the crab chowder, great flavor and lots of crab meat. Will definitely visit again!
author: Kanti Kiran S.

description:
As we were strolling by all the out door Markets/pantries (opened up by the restaurants) trying to decide where we wanted to get our clam chowder we hear a gentleman ask if we'd like a seat inside. I look at my 1 yr old and 9 yr old and immediately said yes! It was way to crowded, hectic and a bit cold for my darlings to try to eat outside standing like their awesome mommy, auntie Jenny and uncle Freddie. LOL. So in we went like most seafood place I've been to the lighting was dimmed with an ocean view.  There were many booths and tables but the restaurant seemed compact, packed, it was hard to get by with a stroller. Kinda felt like we were in a sardine can whenever we had to get up. Luckily we had a large booth near the window that was able to accommodate my fortunately small umbrella stroller of the day. Any bigger, had I brought one of my other 2, we would not have fit.
  Our server, whose name I can't recall, was friendly. She got our meal out, checked up on us as needed and we'll gave awesome service. 
  The food. We started off with calamari, lobster bisque and of course CLAM CHOWDER. The calamari was on point crispy, flavorful and yummy. The lobster was delicious it seriously melted in my mouth. Apparently the lobster bisque did the same for my 1 year old because my baby finished my bowl, only giving me a few spoons lol. The clam chowder however was just ok. It didn't wow us like I had hoped. So we were a bit disappointed since it was what originally brought us out to dinner at Fishermans Wharf that night.
   For our meal we  decided to do it family style. I went with the special which was linguine with an awesome amount of seafood (mussles, fish, shrimp, crab) sautéed in white wine sauce. YUMMMY! Freddie ordered us the fried platter which comes with more calamari, fish and fries. Jenny also ordered one  lobster with shrimp and raw oysters.  Not a big meal since we were munching at different places through out the day and still had to meet my BFF for dinner lol =P the food here was delicious! Everyone including my kids enjoyed the meal. We even grabbed a lobster sandwich from outside as we were walking to our car lol. Oinky status (^_^) I would definitely be back on our next trip (^_^)
author: Marilyn C.

description:
The family spontaneously decided to go here for dinner . As we walked in, the restaurant has a funky, fishy smell to it. I guess that's normal since it's right next to the pier. 

We ordered the boston and crab chowder, fish n chips, and crab fettuccine: 

- Both the chowders were okay, a bit on the saltier side . 3/5

- Fish n chips were decent . 3/5

- Crab Fettuccine was surprisingly better than expected ! 4/5 

In general, the experience was okay. The server we had seemed unexperienced! He was slow and didn't know the menu. We wouldn't come back here .
author: Alicia N.

description:
It was okay. I visited the restaurant at a Saturday night and it was packed, I was with my family of 6 and we waited 10-15 minutes, so it was a good wait compared to the other restaurants that required a 20-25 minute wait. What was cool is that they had a seafood bar outside so we ate oysters while we waited (oysters were delicious, not overly salty and a decent price). When we were seated the staff were nice and were great on communicating with my Spanish-bound family with poor English. My only problem was the clam chowder, 
---if you want to come here for the clam chowder DO NOT COME HERE.--- However, the lobster soup was pretty decent and have not tried the crab chowder. I ordered the linguini portofino and it was pretty good (to me is was). A little on the pricy side but it was good!
author: Kristabel M.

description: The Crab Chowder is delicious! We are from San Diego, and every time we come to SF we always make it a point to stop by for a bowl of Crab Chowder.  Definitely worth you money, and you will also enjoy the calamari.  They are so meaty!
author: Shaun W.

description: On 4/12/17 during our visit to SF we decided to have lunch at our favorite eatery,  Nick's Light House. My 5 year old daughter ordered chicken strips (3 strips) and as she's eating the third strip I noticed the chicken was not only undercooked but actually raw. I spoke with waiter and manager and was terribly disappointed  in how the situation was handled. Of course nothing they could have said or done would have made it better.
author: Bego W.

description:
I've eaten at this place before I had clam chowder. This rating is based on both experiences. 

My bf and I were taking a stroll around the pier looking for dinner. We passed this place by and there was a gentleman who said he had a window side table reserved for us lovebirds. We took a look at the menu and told him we were going to look around some more. When we came back, he was still there and so was the table. It was really romantic and we were very pleased with the food not so much the service. I remembered they gave a small bowl of complimentary chowder and all I remember was that is was the best I had in a long time. My bf thought it was just alright. 

My friend and I came last week for some chowder and it was during the day so it was pretty empty. There was more waiters than diners. The service was decent in the beginning but after we received our food, we were forgotten. The chowder bowl wasn't as good as I remembered and the place had lost its charm. We were seated by the door where they charge people cards and we couldn't help but notice how horrible they treat their employees. They should do that behind closed doors so as not to ruin other peoples meals.
author: Lynn C.

description: Waiters were very welcoming especially Eddy who was really friendly! Food was great and filling.
author: Fiona T.

description: Favorite Fisherman's Wharf restaurant...Very fresh seafood, competitive prices, cool, unpretentious vibe..recommend mixed shellfish plate with 1/2 Maine lobster (with claw!), dungenous crab, etc....
author: Mark S.

description:
The food is mediocre at best. 

Our group had the fish and chips, hamburger, crab sandwich, and clam chowder bowl. Tasted as if it was microwaved from frozen foods like their kids fish and chips (server told us so).
author: Eunice S.

description:
We came here in a group of five and were seated quickly.
Service was great! I wish I could remember than name of our waiter because he was really sweet and thoughtful.
Everyone ordered some sort of chowder whether it was clam chowder or Manhattan chowder. Both were delicious.
Fishermans wharf is a very touristy area and the restaurants are expensive so keep that in mind especially with seafood. We bought the cheapest bottle of wine for the table which was about $25. But I think if you visit fishermans wharf you need to 
1. See the sea lions
2. Try some seafood

So I think this restaurant was a good choice!
author: Kamila M.

description: Did not get what I paid for. Missing one of the legs on my lobster. Asian man smokes then handles food. No hand washing, lobster fell on the floor then was picked up and thrown back in the boiling water.
author: Maurizio F.

description: The food was great. Walking by and noticed all the people so had to stop. I had to sit in the restaurant area. Good choice.
author: Angela D.

description: First time here I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with baby shrimp and my partner The New England Clam Chowder to be honest the Fettuccine was ok but not the best and the soup my partner had wasn't the best either it had a really strong lemony flavor that's all we got to say about this pace but hey price is good.
author: Jesenia H.

description: It was ok. Seating is very tight for average sized person so might be real tight for heavier folk. Lobster was fine. Servers were very accommodating and friendly.
author: Gary M.

description: Pretty good lobster bisque and clam chowder..decent prices compared to surroundings. Let you sample a couple of things before buying..good service.
author: Kurt S.

description:
I didn't even bother to write a review the first time I visited this place, but, after Friday's visit I had to. The first time we visited the food was terrible, (I thought it was because they were so busy), the service was ok, and the bathrooms were iffy. This time, September 16, 2017 was absolutely horrible, and we were insulted with a racist comment to top it all off. First the bathroom had suds emerging from the toilet bowl and all over the floor. I told an employee and his response was, "oh wow" and walked away. Then, we decided to check out Alioto's next door, but my dinner companions did not want to wait to be seated (it was after 10 at night). When we were seated AGAIN we lost our original booth and ended up with a smaller space; dinner companions wanted to move back to the original booth, obviously. The waiter comes over and my cousin (who is black) asked him if we could move. The waiter says, "Come on, you are there, then out there, now here, now you want to go back, MAKE UP YOUR MIND BOY!" I flipped a switch! I asked him who he was calling "BOY" and he told he "Him" and pointed to my cousin. He said to me, "He's not a boy, what is he?" I stated, "He's a MAN!" The waiter walked away, I guess he knew he messed up. 
Never again will I go to this restaurant, rude, totally inappropriate and disgusting.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
Playing hometown tourists and dropped in here after a trip to Alcatraz; that will not happen again. My partner never tasted a lobster tail so I encouraged her to order it and it was so over cooked that she had to saw it out with a knife and fork. I am a vegan but a former carnivore and KNOW this was an overpriced, terribly tasting experience for her. I asked for a linguine with basil, tomatoes and mushrooms, no cream, dairy... No animal products whatsoever. The waiter said, "what about seafood?" 

My partner's beer did not come out until I reminded the waiter, my salad came with shrimp on it; just a terrible, terrible experience. I am ashamed that this restaurant is one face of my hometown to tourists, especially this occasional hometown tourist. 

Blah!
author: Stacy L.

description: Totally enjoyed our visit to Nick's Lighthouse.  The waiter and rest of staff were very accommodating (and with 3 women and a 6 year-old that means a lot!)  Food was good.  I enjoyed the atmosphere.  Felt like "real" San Francisco.
author: Pamela K.

description: Not sure what's happened here at Fisherman's Wharf. The days of decent crab seems to have come and gone. For what you get, the crab is pretty pathetic. I ordered a whole crab here and what I got was the smallest dungeness crab I've ever had. Honestly I'm not convinced it was a whole crab to begin with. The legs included in my meal seemed to be a mix of only the rear most legs of the crab (since they were all small and had the fin ends on them), and got three claws, one SUPER small, one with a chunk missing, and another one that was intact. If this was a whole crab, how is there three claws??? My family and I dropped almost $300 here, way more than our meal was worth. I understand that you have to make money, but for what you're charging and what you're serving, the prices are out of this world.
author: Arvin P.

description: Great food with a fun ambiance of a little hole in the wall.  The seafood sampler was amazing and filling!
author: Christopher S.

description:
Visiting San Francisco so gave this restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf a try. I should've checked Yelp first before sitting down but it was too late when I finally realized. I tried to keep this review short but unable to describe how bad things had gone down in just a few words so please bear with me......

We each ordered a Boston clam chowder but total disappointment. They were bland, needed to add a bit of salt and pepper in order to enhance the so-called flavor. It was just thick, heavy-creamed liquid with some small pieces of celeries, 2 small pieces of potatoes, and listen to this.......four.....only 4 tiny cut up pieces of clams in the entire bowl of soup and they were so tiny, I had to fish them out! My husband's bowl has only two tiny pieces! Guess I was the lucky one!! Needless to say, I fished out whatever clams I can and put the chowder aside.

He ordered spicy garlic Dungeness crab, which was quite tasty, but the crab was very small for a Dungeness crab - so small that we even wondered if San Fran has a law against keeping crabs this size. However, it was fine because it actually tasted good so we thought things will be good from here but...........

I ordered a piece of grilled salmon, telling the waiter that I don't want my salmon to be over cooked, prefer "medium". However, My salmon ended up being wayyy undercooked! The outside looked fine but it was still raw in the center. I asked the waiter to have the kitchen cook it some more but when he brought it out the second time, still raw in the thickest cut! The waiter then asked the manager to come talk to me so I explained what happened and that I am not eating sushi. He offered to have the kitchen cook another piece for me or I can order something else but given what happened to both of the items I ordered, I lost confidence in their kitchen so I told him (in a very polite manner throughout the whole ordeal) that I just want to cancel the order. He was reluctant at first but still obliged at the end.

Unfortunately to my surprise, he charged me $7.00 for the small plate of house salad, that was supposed to come with each entree, because I had returned the salmon due to a fault on their end!! I spoke to our waiter (still keeping my kool) and he said it was his manager's decision. He then took our check, came back 2 min later and we found out he had put $7.00 inside the pocket. We were speechless with mixed emotions. We don't want or need to be pitied, just the principle of things. It was either the waiter understood and felt bad or he just wanted to get us out the door but either way, we paid and left. Totally ruined my mood =(.
author: Jenny M.

description: Food was ok. Service was bad. Lady was all up in my face and took forever to bring me my check. We had to ask another waiter for it. We wanted to bring food from their "to go area" which is in the front to our table inside and they said it was not allowed. But it's from the SAME restaurant though? Weeeeird! Never again.
author: Michelle M.

description:
It's obviously a tourist trap downtown, but I have to get a clam chowder bread bowl every time I am in San Francisco. For only $7.25 it's not as expensive as, let's say, the the half lobster $19. Finding "the best" place to get a bread bowl of is a matter of opinion, but I think they all share the same gigantic pot of chowder in the back because I cannot really find a difference.

Parking is usually outrageous, especially in the lots, pure robbery. I was lucky enough to find a meter for only $4/HR which saved my life. If you don't mind braving the chaos down, you can look for meters but realistically finding a spot it almost impossible. If you can, just take the trolley or get an Uber.
author: Robert H.

description:
Oysters are so good! Service was quick and they had hot sauce and cocktail sauce with lemons for the oysters. If you don't mind avoiding bums, this is the spot to get oysters under two dollars. 

I'm coming back for sure!
author: Monet C.

description:
Best lobster roll ever!! As we walked around the Wharf, all I wanted was a fresh lobster roll (not the cold ones in the market cases). Chef Nick was greeting customers with a lobster and crab to take pictures. I asked if he could make me a lobster roll. Chef Nick said "I'll take care of you. And you will love it!" True statement!

I've had lobster roll in other cities like Boston. Hands down Nick's Lobster Roll is at the top of my list. Fresh, warm, lobster served on fresh, buttered sourdough bread. Chef Nick even made me a delicious lobster tail, cheese, and veggie bake with the extra lobster meat. It was a little price but well worth it!!
author: Carolina A.

description: The Bimb the best place at the ward eat outside deli and fresh cooked crab or delintylse eat inside and get the same with hot platters pasta steaks seafood all worth it
author: Irma V.

description: This is for their outdoor stall only. The stall was pretty messy and it wasn't really cheap. But their spicy shrimp is something to come back for.
author: Di H.

description: The place is stinky and overpriced. The booths are tiny,but our waiter was sweet. I don't recommend this if you're looking for good seafood in San Fran.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Not that I'm especially proud of it, but I just ate an entire dungeness crab in about 5 minutes. It was the best crab I've ever had, by far. 

Minus one star for being a weeee bit pricey, but that's to be expected in a tourist hotspot. Worth it for the freshness and quick service. 

I recommend taking your order to go and parking it at a bench on one of the several nearby piers. What a great way to enjoy the view... Crab-stuffed.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Thank you, Arnulfo! You took such good care of us and you were so very attentive! You get 5 stars.

The food was delicious (4stars), a bit overpriced, but it's a tourist area so we expected it to be above average. The cup of lobster bisque was so so so lip-smackingly flavorful and I wish I had a bigger cup/bowl. The oysters were yummy but has bits of shell on top. The hubby made mmm-mmm sounds over his cioppino so he approved! The sole w/capers dish was good, too. Overall, I recommend and if I have a chance to return, I'll order a bigger lobster bisque
author: G. S.

description:
The hubby and I have been coming to this spot for six years. Let it be known, it is our go to spot for fresh seafood. And with our toddler now joining our clan, it's such an enjoyable experience every time we go.

Typically, I'll order a crab and half dozen oysters, hubby will order their deviled lobster and we'll order fresh shrimp and calamari with vinaigrette for the little one. We usually spend about $80 - $100 for everything, depending on the price/pound for the crab and lobster. But it is so worth it! And their team of hosts are always so full of life.
author: Natasha R.

description: Great food and FANTASTIC service.  From the waiter Billy Ray to the friendly and funny Chef!!  We were soooooo happy we came here! I posted photos of most of the food we ordered.  We came her during the day on a Friday and from the guys outside to everyone inside at the tables - it was a great experience.  Food was great and like I said the service and friendliness was just as good.  They also let you take funny photos with the crab and lobsters.  Maybe I'm super touristy but I don't care.  It was fun and worth it.
author: Taisiya S.

description: Do yourself a favor and keep walking past this disgusting place. The food is horrible! The clam chowder was cold and thick. We had the seafood platter, everything on it was chewy and rubbery. The food is on par with Long John Silvers but priced like a five star restaurant. We all felt sick on our way home from all the grease. One of the worst restaurants I've ever been to.
author: Tammy b.

description: I got the fish and chips. It was okay. The fact that the food was already prepared was very efficient and convenient. However, I wanted to try their crab sandwich but I just didn't like how the sandwich looked. Despite the fact that all the surrounding food vendors had similar setups like them, I was put off from trying the sandwiches. I went with the safe route of getting fish and chips. It was good but definitely not the best. I'm sure there are other places that offer similar dishes. I have yet to find a place in the bay with the best fish and chips.
author: Bernadette A.

description: My first crab and I really enjoyed it. We ate outside, which I think is a little less expensive than inside. It made for a more fun and memorable experience. The cook cooking the crabs outside was super helpful, friendly and entertaining. Overall, I would return again.
author: Charli G.

description:
First time I walked into the seafood area at the Fisherman's Wharf  I was overwhelmed with all the seafood eateries everywhere. Walking all the way at the end of the isle you hear a man asking if you want a table don't mind him just order your choice of seafood! 

The price is by lbs. so plan on spending some $$ on some fresh tasty seafood! They steam your seafood right in front of you! It you want a table just follow the man into the restaurant but I prefer sitting outside under the huge Fishermans Wharf sign. Enjoying the fresh air, and watching the tourist walk.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
This is a hole in the wall joint, but I have found and loved places like this. But not this one. 

The ambience is what you'd usually find in a tourist area, loud and crowded. But aside from what you'd expect, the waiters here are rude and don't care at all. I felt as if they feel that they'll get paid and a tip regardless and if someone doesn't like them, oh well...they'll be seating another round of people in 30 minutes or so. 

We all ordered the fish and chips. I ordered an additional dozen oysters on the half shell. The fish and chips combo was $13.99. Came with either a bowl of clam chowder or green salad and Cole slaw. I'm not crazy about fish and chips but I went with the flow because I wasn't paying and didn't want to make things difficult. But I was looking forward to my oysters at $25. While waiting for our food, we had to ask for water. We also had to ask for napkins. The napkins were linen and everyone had a table setting except my niece. She politely asked the waiter for a napkin, and the waiter pulled one from the unfolded pile and just dropped it on the table as he rushed off as if he was inconvenienced and had no time to make sure we had what we needed. We also observed that all the other tables were being served bread baskets with butter by bus boys once they sat down. We didn't get one until we asked for it which arrived 5 minutes before our food. Perhaps they didn't see us because we were a party of 8? Bread when arrived was warm, soft and pretty good. Not amazing but pretty good. We were the first table along the wall of the front entrance. Don't sit there! The place is already tiny enough and that area gets a lot of in and out traffic. The waiters are constantly squeezing two at a time, through the little walk space and their rears and body is way to close to you. One of the bus boys takes his breaks along the front entrance wall drinking a dark beverage out of a glass that has no ice and stows it there whenever he needs to go and serve someone, then returns and drinks leaning against the wall. I'm wondering if the beverage was an alcoholic one. Whatever, but his beverage was sitting on a ledge that was 12 inches away from my head. That is kind of an inappropriate place. Staff food and drinks should be stowed in the back and or somewhere not visible to customers. I was uncomfortable sitting and eating a meal at the bus boy break spot where they leave their drinks. Clam chowders and salads, whichever you chose finally came. I got the salad. The salad dressing was a balsamic vinegar with spices, burns, two cherry tomatoes, and a slice of red beet. The dressing was really strong and spicy. Kind of hot. I didn't care for the salad but I ate it because I needed something refreshing. I tasted my sons clam chowder, and I've had better clam chowder out of a can. The chowder was flavorless. The amount of clams was decent. Again, I've had better out of a can. Fish and chips arrive pretty quick, but my oysters never came. I quickly asked for them. My waiter seemed to have forgotten but quickly remembered my appetizer and pointed to them outside at the shell fish sidewalk setup and said, "oh, they are out there" Lol after a pause between us both I wondered if I was suppose to go and get them myself but he broke the awkward pause and said I'll go get them. Everyone started eating. I didn't dare try the coleslaw because coleslaw is not prepared the same everywhere. The fish used was not what any of us expected. We thought that we'd get thick, long pieces. Or maybe either thick or long. Instead it was hardly anything. Each piece was the length size of my pinky finger at the smallest and the length size of my middle finger at the longest. The average thickness was a thumb size to a thumb size and a half. There was more batter than fish. When I peeled the batter off I was left with fish shavings and a pile of thick batter. Not to mention, the fish had no flavor and neither did the batter. Not even salt. It was very bland. The oysters were not bad but I've had better and prettier for less than $25. But it was fine cause at least I had oysters to eat since there was no fish in our plates. 

Check arrived quick and it was $192.48. Gratuity was included (no wonder service wasn't that great). I also ordered one glass of Chardonnay and got my mom a Stella. 

Our waiter Jeremiah was alright. He wasn't great or anything special but just did the minimum to keep it moving. The dinner bill is what I expected for 8 people and what we ordered, but it wasn't worth it with the added 15% gratuity. I probably wouldn't come back here again. And I'd have to agree with the other posts about this place, that service isn't great, clam chowder is better from a can and now me adding fish and chips order is flavorless. I don't like giving negative reviews as I often like to give my experience to share on Yelp and allow readers to make their own decision on whether or not my review is negative or positive. Not recommended.
author: Nadine S.

description:
Touring through Fisherman's Wharf, there are plenty of different seafood options, many competing chowder vendors and baskets brimming with crab. Nick's Lighthouse doubles as both a food stand (their "to-go" option) as well as a dine in restaurant where they focus on high turnover to get as many tourists through as possible. However, their service is mired by unattentive servers and brash hosts.

We tried the dine in option, hoping to get out of the windy wharf and have a nice rest before our next tourist destination, but we waited several minutes without any attention (not even drinks). We ended up getting crab to go, questioned about whether or not we really bought the spicy garlic sauce (an extra $3) and spent another 10 minutes waiting as they whisked away our crab to dump their spicy oil all over it.

There are plenty of choices around the area; I'd rather have gone to Joe's Crab Shack nearby (assuming their crab was just as fresh and from the bay).
author: Jeff L.

description: Price is OK. Crab meat is not as fresh as you expect.
author: TC J.

description:
If you are visiting San Francisco, I advise you to STAY AWAY from this place. Very rude waiter, terrible food, and overall bad service. Would never ever return.

As we were walking out, two large rats scurried in front of us.
author: David H.

description: There was a table available right away, maybe that should have been a sign. We ordered 2 crab sandwiches, 2 shrimp and chips, a crab chowder in a bread bowl. The crab sandwich was basically crab salad on toasted bread and the crab chowder had no crab in it. Half of our table got their food and the other half got their food at least 15 minutes later. It was really expensive for less than mediocre food. Not recommended.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Don't let the 2 gentlemen in the front reel you in to this establishment. My family and I were drawn into this place with promise of quality seafood. We couldn't have been more wrong. The decor inside was that if an episode of kitchen nightmares. I half expected Ramsey himself to be spitting out the food and cursing the chef who cooked it.
* Bread. Stale.
*Clam Chowder. Bland and dense.
*Crab. Not seasoned.
* Lobster. Rubbery and watery.
*Clams. Gritty and chewy.
Overall; a pretty terrible meal. Would not eat again.
author: Matthew K.

description: we had cioppiono and platter. food is like leftover. the share is pretty small. absolutely not recommended.
author: Andrew C.

description: Nice little restaurant.  I just have a few small critics on what they need to improve on.  The staff is friendly but could use some training on hospitality.  When we walked in we were greeted but rather than being shown to our seats the host pointed to where we should sit.  Took a good 5 mins to be acknowledged and Service for water.  Our waiter was very nice but I feel he was all over the place.  I Decided to try the Crab Chowder in a bread bowl.  The chowder itself was delicious but honestly not enough was put into the bread bowl because the bowl absorbed all the chowder, they should consider Over Filling the bowl.  The bread bowl was wasted because there was no more soup, utterly disappointing. So for future reference it would be best to order the chowder in a regular bowl and get the bread on the side.
author: Denise P.

description:
WHOA BABY!!!

You must get the crab. Damn it is big and the flavor is nothing like i have ever tasted before. I am not being sarcastic either. 
It is a bit pricey but its totally worth it. 
Secondly, the garlic bread it is to die for. 

The staff there are so polite so attentive. I would definitely come back again.
author: Jannie M.

description: Lobster bisque was too salty. Steak and (australian) lobster combo was overcooked. Service was not great, either. Find somewhere else to go.
author: John T.

description:
So yes this place just screams tourist trap, and if that's the expectation. It's average, very average...and service isn't anything you come here for with any high expectations.

Problem is this place will get the traffic regardless of how awful this review is.

There was one thing that we ordered that they got wrong, never fixed it and never saw our waiter again.

For this service, should have just ordered from the street stands!
author: Derek A.

description: Definitely not worth the wait. We were seated immediately, waited for our waiter, had to ask for water.  The food came at different times. We were almost done by the time my wife's good came. I think the waiter forgot to order it. The food was just okay. Fresh, but very plain. Also took forever to get the check.
author: Dean A.

description:
My cousin told me a few time their food are good. So last Sunday I came here with the same cousin who told me about this place & friends after the beach. We were a big group of people so we got 3 tables near each other. After looking at the menu we all ordered our food. First the soup, & salad came out I got clam chowder in bread bowl, the chowder was good but to me it wasn't the best. So after awhile the meal came out everyone was eating their food & I was the last person to get my food. I ordered Half of lobster the waiter asked me if I wanted boil, grilled, with their spicy sauce? I said grilled & with their spicy sauce since my cousin its really good & I saw on yelp that it does look delicious. When I got my food it was a boil lobster with cocktail shrimps on top & I was not happy at all. But I did not want to send it back because everyone seems like they were half way done eating or done eating & I didn't want to wait even longer to get a new lobster & make everyone wait for me so I just ate the lobster the waiter brought out. There was no butter for the lobster & I forgot to asked for it so I ate it plain so it wasn't all that good.

Our waiter was busy & we can see that but my cousin asked the waiter for butter & he kinda gave her an attitude & its not like my cousin was rushing him, gave him an attitude or anything she just asked him. The waiter we had seems to be kinda rude/snobbish from the beginning & he got my order wrong too.

I gave it 2 stars for the food that I got & the waiter. If my lobster came out the way I wanted I would've gave it a higher star beside the waiter was being an ass. I'm the type of person even tho the food, or experience wasn't good ill come back twice or maybe third time just to make sure I really don't like it. So ill be coming back again to try something else beside the lobster & make sure I get what I order.
author: Bee S.

description: Less than mediocre. I had to send back the lobster bisque because it taste like Manhattan chowder. Didn't want to over spend on bad food, so I ordered a burger and it was bland as hell. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: J V.

description:
There are 3 or 4 other places that on the outside looks exactly like nicks. From the outside they all sell steamed crabs and bread bowls but a local told us that nicks is the best. The inside decor is homey and the place is quite small but I loved the vibe of this place. We got to sample the 3 different soups before we ordered. Make sure to ask for a sample!We ordered Dungeness crab cocktail, fried calamari, crab soup and Dungeness crab cakes. The fried calamari and crab cocktail were great and came out super quick. The crab cakes were not what I expected. If you are from the east coast you are used to small thick crab cakes but these crab cakes were very thin and just mediocre. I'm not sure
what happened but the waiter didn't bring out soup order which was a big reason we stopped here. I was pretty disappointed but it wasn't worth waiting over. Overall an okay experience but Im not sure if I would dine in again.
author: Amy K.

description:
Who comes to SF and doesn't get clam chowder, am I right?! I didn't have any particular place in mind when we stopped at Fisherman's Grotto but Nick's Lighthouse looked pretty good. So I got their Boston Clam Chowder with Crackers in a Bread Bowl. It was delicious! I love clam chowder in bread bowls :) Not the best clam chowder I've ever had, but it was still pretty enjoyable, and I just loved the experience of getting clam chowder in a bread bowl by Fisherman's Wharf. It was really filling though, so I ended up getting two meals out of it ;)

My friends and I got our food to-go so I cannot comment on the sit-down section of this place, but the outside part is always packed and quite busy. I was able to get my food really quickly and they have utensils and condiments on a counter if you need any.
author: Esther K.

description: We dined in and unfortunately we were starving by that time. Our server, I apologize because I didn't catch his name, but I did overhear he just came back from Florida, was the best. He had easy conversation, I didn't feel rushed, checked in at regular intervals, our food was served too hot to eat upon arrival, and our drinks were always full. We ordered the kids cheeseburger, kids spaghetti, combination shrimp/crab cocktail, lobster bisque soup, and shrimp Alfredo, our bill was about $80 .... the crab in my cocktail was amazing... The tiny shrimp inside my cocktail and Alfredo I didn't care for... The outside fried food in the stand was more my type, it looked delicious as well but I was cold and the kids wanted to sit. Overall it was a good experience for our first time
author: Janice R.

description:
Chowder should be just as good everywhere.... right?

We've been to Boudin's a million times and it was time for a change. I've noticed that people were walking into this hole in the wall between the aisle of people selling fresh seafood and clam chowder outside. We walked in and I really did feel like I was in a lighthouse. The ceilings were low and it was extremely dark inside. The theme definitely fit the environment of Fisherman's Wharf, especially with the cramped tables. We had the fried calamari, which I thought was pretty good and crunchy. I had the chowder bowl that was really bland and watery. My friend ordered the chowder bowl that tasted really stale and it did the chowder no justice. Someone had ordered fish and chips and it tasted extremely frozen and soggy. 

Near the end of our meal, the bus boy dropped some sauce and it splattered all over my leg. He quickly ran over to try to wipe it off my leg but it just made me uncomfortable. We never had our waters refilled (even when I asked) and it was overpriced for what it is. Sorry, I don't think I'll be coming back again.
author: Linda K.

description: Worst seafood ever!!! I ordered the crab sandwich and it was so bad! The crab had no taste, all I could taste was the burnt toast. My mom and sister ordered a bowl of clam chowder and that was even worse! Stay away!
author: Ellie B.

description: Not bad but not good either, the crab left much to be desired. Service was very attentive, filling drinks and checking in. Be careful with the add ons that the servers suggest, I was charged 5.95 just to add garlic to my Dungeness crab. Stick to the seafood stalls If value is your preference, the restaurant seemed opportunistic, nickel and diming.
author: Ron S.

description:
My family and I ate at the restaurant situated behind the carts out front. We ordered mahi mahi, lobster tail and steak, clam chowder in bread bowl, seafood stir fry, and fried calamari to share. 

The fried calamari was bland. I wonder if they seasoned the batter at all? The texture is fine but it was just bland. The mahi mahi was disgusting. I doubt that thing is fresh. The outside looks cooked but the inside was fishy and not cooked. The stir fry was so-so. But it would have been better if it was $8 bucks cheaper. The dish was not worth what we paid ( $31). The seafood stir-fry was bland, dry and the garlic pieces were burnt. The clam chowder was also so-so. I loooved the bread bowl but did not like the soup itself. The bread bowl was fresh, crispy on the outside soft on the inside. But the clam chowder was lacking. Could have used a bit more clams. 

Our server was very polite and checked on us often but not too much. Overall, I don't recommend eating in the restaurant. Too expensive for the quality of food you get.
author: Solenn R.

description: The space inside is a bit cramped, but they do a very good bread bowl and have good service.
author: Greg F.

description: This review is for the outside ordering area. This is my second visit to this particular location. We came because I had a craving for the crab chowder.  The chowder is good and well worth the buy.  The service was fine. The reason behind the docked points is the man behind the counter grabbed my bread bowl without ever changing his gloves. This wouldn't be a problem if not for the fact that he touched the previous customers cash before hand. I didn't eat the outside of the bowl because of this.
author: David K.

description: Great spot for tourists! You can eat outside (in the cold) or there is a restaurant inside (getting a place to sit can be tricky). The restaurant inside is small and can be twice the cost (or more) so do choose wisely before dining. There are restaurants on Pier 39 down the road with better food too if you're willing to walk down. Stick to their favorites. The 5 pound lobster is not on their menu but is very fresh and good to share amongst a larger group. The bread bowls (lobster bisque and clam chowder) are also decent. My suggestion - dine outside if possible.
author: Ananta S.

description:
Nick's is sort of a hole in the wall on the Wharf, and that's ok. It wasn't too crowded, but I chose to sit at the bar. The bartender was excellent at conversation, Marvin was his name I believe, and made me feel at home. 

He explained the kitchen is really just a final cook spot as the real kitchen is across the road. The workers have to haul the dishes and food back and forth to wash and prep. Crazy! It's small and very kitschy. He gave me all the history on the place and was entertaining. 

I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was tasty. Nothing remarkable, but just good. Creamy and fresh tasting with a lot of clams. Marvin was really the highlight of this place.
author: Leslie D.

description: Pretty bad. The food was bland and very basic. We had the clam chowder and crab sandwich. It was very disappointing. The restaurant, I imagine, has not been updated in decades. Which would not really matter, but it looks so dingy and unkempt. Made me think that is how they take take of the food. The bathroom. Well, don't go there.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Very very small and cramped but the waitress was a sweetie. 
Their sour dough bread was awesome as well as their crab chowder. I had the crab salad and it was very good but if you come here and don't get the crab chowder you are certainly missing out on their best dish. 
This place is very very pricey and almost not worth it. I think in general, the restaurants in this are are taking advantage of tourists.
author: Allison F.

description:
his is a tiny little restaurant.  I only ordered an appetizer, the combination cocktail - bay shrimp and Dungeness crab meat.  The presentation was very nice but don't be fooled, the cup it is served in is filled with lettuce and topped with the crab and shrimp.  The flavor was fine but truly not worth the cost.
A Blue Moon, Coors light and the app was 29.63,  This is the cost in the area but I expected better flavor on the app........disappointed.
author: Sharon N.

description:
I was in town for the weekend with family and bought tickets to go on the SF boat cruise and since the cruise hadn't start for another hour and half, I wanted to grab some fresh seafood while we wait. This place was nearby and decided to settle here for the seafood that's because the man was outside holding a giant lobster entertaining the tourists and we stop to look and realize we are on a time crunch so we ahead went inside the restaurant. It was around 11am and hardly anyone showed up yet so we got our tables quick. Our server was really nice and made a great recommendation which was the "Imperial Platter". It was big enough to feed a group of people. There were three of us and we couldn't finish it. She even gave us all free small clam chowder to go with our order and it was delicious.
About 20 mins later, the place got jam packed and noticed people outside waiting to be seated and our server stop being attentive. It seemed like our server was the only one on the floor and maybe three buss boy. We ate quick and we had 20 mins left to get in line for our cruise. We did got our server's attention and ask for a box to go and our check and also said we're in a hurry to leave but she disappeared for awhile. Two different buss boy came by our table though. One was cleaning up our table and the other just kept checking up on us and we repeatedly told him we need the check and box to go but he kept coming back to ask us if we're doing okay, lol. By the time our server came back with our box and check, we had already missed the cruise for our time slot. (Luckily, the crew allowed us to go on the next time slot) 
Overall the food and customer service I can say was exceptional but this place does get really busy so service will be slow.
author: Mariyah I.

description: Excellent food and service. Lump crab was fresh and delicious. Crab chowder was amazing. Prices are fair. Antonia was an exceptional waitress and funny!! Would come again!
author: John S.

description:
Do NOT come here!
This place is extremely disgusting and very over priced 
The shrimp sandwich tasted like mayo and celery with very hard bread,the lobster bisque was alright, looked like puree, and the clam chowder was also mediocre at best. 
This is one of those places that looks like nothing has been cleaned since it opened, feels like a cockroach is going to pop out 
Service was ok, nothing good or bad to say
author: Luis E M.

description:
Crab season started so we had to celebrate at Fisherman's Wharf.
Packed restaurant so service was spotty as waiters were constantly busy but friendly when we did get their attention.
Got seated reasonably quickly though as we were lucky a booth opened up.
Ordered the dungeness crab and deep fried platter. All good. Crab was expensive as hell but was moist and tender and a decent size.
author: Michael C.

description:
There's a reason this place gets only 3 stars. And I'm talking about that outside line up and get your fried food area, not the restaurant. While I was standing in line I noticed one of the managers come out and yell at all his workers a couple times. That makes you feel good huh? I bet it makes him feel good, it certainly doesn't make his staff feel good. So how's that for classy.

I prefer not to dine in establishments that treat employees badly, it's just a thing. But beyond all that the calamari and french fries the clam chowder are all mediocre, especially in comparison to whats immediately around the area. So just because the lines are long at the other places and you won't have to wait as long here, it's a signal that should be a warning. 

When you do grab the food venture down the waterfront and find a nice bench to picnic on.
author: Ben M.

description: Just stumbled into this place for dinner after getting lost our first night in San Francisco and so glad we did.  Just ordered fish and chips and it was so fresh and tasted amazing! Staff is very friendly.  Great service, great food! Thumbs up!
author: Carolyn H.

description:
Stopped in looking for good seafood. My son had clam chowder in a bread bowl with fish and chips. The fish was amazing! It was flaky and mild...yum. He really enjoyed the clam chowder. I opted for the rainbow trout topped with shrimp. Wow! Delicious!! Perfectly prepared and served with rice and veggies. 

We had a very good server who was attentive and kind. 

Highly recommend for something off the beaten path.
author: Angela G.

description:
Server topped up our Sprite with water...Twice.  Saffron rice served with Salmon was made using old saffron or food dye.  The color was there but there was no taste or bouquet of saffron at all.  Salmon itself was good although a little overcooked for me, I really think it should be served medium rare and had asked for it to be served that way but it came well done.  Meals were expensive for what you got and nothing was what I would call fantastic.

Table was tiny you certainly wouldn't want to come with more than three people.
author: Megan B.

description:
We ordered the Imperial plate in the appetizer section, which came with lobster, crab, prawns, ceviche-style calamari, mini shrimp, oysters, and 4 cups of soup. We also ordered fried calamari and linguini with white wine sauce and clams. They wouldn't let us substitute the ceviche with the fried calamari. 

Imperial Plate
-Clams were SO salty, could not eat (all of us spit it out). 
-Lobster was overcooked. 
-Crab was fine. 
-Oysters looked dry even though they were in the shell, we were too scared to eat it in fear of getting sick. 
-Mini shrimps had no flavor.
-Prawns were overcooked. 
-Soups (lobster bisque and clam chowder) were average. 

Fried Calamari
-So bland and soggy. 

Linguini
-Grit and dirt from the clams were in the whole dish, so we kept getting surprised by the crunchy bites. 

OVERALL: Do not eat here. You might get sick, and the food isn't worth it to risk food poisoning.
author: Melissa K.

description: Tourist trap like my friend says !!!  We went there to have a lunch ,when they were having "specials"  which wasn't good . We had a pasta with "shrimps"and "scallops " with Alfredo sauce and lobster bisque soup in the bread bowl . Alfredo sauce was disgusting and shrimps and scallops were very tiny and tasteless. I didn't see any lobster in the soup +too much bread. Paid for it $50 including drink and tips . Will never go again.
author: Gaukhar T.

description:
We've been coming to Nicks for about 6 years now. Not much has changed other than the prices. I read some of the comments on here and I'm a bit surprised. I like that it feels like a hole in the wall and that it's a bit crammy... Its SAN FRANCISCO!!! And they're right on the water! There's no room, they'd have to build up ^^^ at this point! 

Service: We've always had really friendly service. I think that "English" is not the 1st language for some of their employees (which only adds to the experience) and some people perceive that as "rude"...  

Food: We've tried everything from their bowls to their seafood platters and daily specials. Everything has been pretty good. My favorites would have to be the "linguini and mussels", a lobster stuffed cannelloni and a huge assorted sautéed seafood platter. 
      *I wouldn't have the "fish&chips" again (too 
         many other things to choose from) 
    
        *Pictures are posted! 

Price: a bit pricey but you could always order the daily specials... 

We lived in central ca and now live in SoCal and every time we find ourselves in SF, we say "we're going to try something new" and we always end up at Nicks!
author: Gracie V.

description: Horrible clam chowder!! Horrible. I only went here because my go to, Sabellas (next door), sold out of bread bowls and I really had a craving for it. I got three to go($23 for the 3 bread bowls). The bread bowls weren't even cut open for my chowder!! And I wasn't given a knife to do it myself... I got to my hotel and cut my bread bowl open with a spoon. When I opened my chowder cup to pour it, the surrounding of the chowder cup had all the chowders grease like piled up. It was soooo greasy. I poured it in anyway since I was super craving it and my first spoon full was so sour! SOUR clam chowder. Disgusting. I literally just had the spoonful and threw it away. Nastiest clam chowder my family and I have ever had. Waste of $23. Greasy sour nasty chowder. Never again.
author: Karen R.

description: Very cramp seating which left me limping on my way out but really fresh and light clam chowder which I enjoyed since I don't like heavy creams. The wait staff were very entertaining when serving, specially when showing off the large lobsters for photos. Bathroom is super tiny and could use some remodeling. Food is literally taken out of the tanks or displays straight into the kitchen and then to your table. My fried clams could use a lighter batter or better frying techniques.
author: Wai Y.

description: Was decent. If you walk in there with two or more people, I'd recommend the seafood platter. Be prepared to spend $120.00 though but you will get 1-lobster fished out of their tank and boiled, 1-pretty big crab, about 8 jumbo shrimp cooked, 3ea of raw oysters and raw crab and a pile of bay shrimp and cooked calamari. If you're into seafood you won't be disappointed and the staff is fast and helpful. ONLY issue... if you go during a busy time and the restaurant is busy, the space is very crowded and tight. You might be rubbing elbows with your neighbor and feeling the juices from their crab splash on you when they crack their crab claws ENJOY!!!
author: Chuck A.

description:
Service was fast, portions were good and the prices were reasonable, but the taste.... was pretty mediocre to say the least. I felt like I had better clam chowder from a can... The bread was a bit cold and stale. I suppose understandably so because it was sold from an outdoor vendor, but I was still disappointed. My boyfriend's crab sandwich was awfully mayonnaise-heavy and I couldn't taste much of the crab at all. 

Sadly, I would not choose to come here again.
author: Yoe Jin W.

description:
December 23rd: 
We had Noooo idea were to eat clam chowder, What place was the best, and ultimately what restaurant has the most to offer. 

Babe said nicks since we were starving. 
Sat down inside, decided to dine in. Makes sense, why stand and eat? 


Clam chowder bowl: 5 
Calamari: (boyfriends fav) 5
Garlic bread: 5
Service: 3.5 (it was busy, totally understand) 
The server forgot our waters, but we did have anchor stem. The moment we asked we got it within that minute. Very attentive. 



I wish I can rave on with every detail but to be simple and just, our time at nicks was worth the prices, not big, huge portions but we were content and full. Everything tastes amazing. So we will def come back here.
author: Vianka A.

description:
Was in town for the weekend and accidentally walked inside the restaurant to eat. Our waiter kept calling us Lady, the free bread was extremely hard and burnt. Not seeing anything close to the menu outside I asked if I could grab a cheesebuger off the kids menu even though it had an age limit. Waiter said "i will do anything for you lady". My friend wanted to order an appetizer and  our waiter pressured her into the mussels even though she didnt like them elsewhere stating they were the prize of the place. Well they were covered in tomatoes and nothing else. They were gross, telling our waiter he replied back rudely stating "well why did you order them?"  Reminding him he pushed her he said she could order anything else and price would be adjusted. She got a mini shrimp cocktail that was cheaper. 

Food was gross. Burger was over cooked to the point of being inedible. When we got our bill the mussels were still on it and out "kids burger" was more than the menu price. We spoke with a manager (who reeked of cigarette smoke) he said he would get the mussels taken off but said his waiter was not authorized to give us the kids burger. That he was not able to change the price. Had I known I was going to be paying $10 for a hockey puck I would have stayed with the salad. 

The manager went over to the waiter and was quietly reprimanding him. The waiter came straight over starting his argument with us with "Lady...". He had the audacity to argue about how he never heard I asked about the kids burger nor would he have let me. He also said if you cant afford it ill give you money towards it. On our way out we asked the
Same manager why he sent his waiter to come argue with us and he just said I am sorry for that. No customer service and the food was not worth the prices. I would NOT suggest eating there.
author: Lindsey R.

description: I'd give 0 star if I can! Horrible service n the server assumed us won't tip her so she charged us 15% at lunch without even tell us. Our bill was $79.85 but she crossed the total amount n added 15% for herself. Sorry, not gonna happen. I tipped her nothing. Horrible service = no tip.
author: Sean G.

description: We were staying in the area and decided to pick up food for dinner in our room.  With all the vendors to choose from, somehow we seem to always gravitate towards Nick's.  The dungeness crab was REALLY good; the chowder, calamari and shrimp were very fresh as well.  We liked it so much that we got food from there twice in 4 days...highly recommended!
author: Shawn T.

description: This place was awful.  We ordered a fried and a cold combo plate.  My fried plate boasted a variety, as in combo.  Sadly, it was 90 percent calamari.  Our bread was burned and don't even think you will get a refill on your drink.  My husbands food looked a little better but the shrimp tasted like rubber and his clams were gritty.  The whole experience was a disappointment.  We had dinner at Franciscans the night before and it was stellar! The cup of soup was very small and the salad was  bagged blend with canned beans.  The only reason we came here was to sit down but after paying the 70$ ( before tip) bill we went outside and had crab from a street vender with a long line.  I would never eat here again or recommend it to anyone.  Two stars is really being generous.
author: Kiley H.

description: Since I'm visiting San Francisco, I obviously went to the tourist spots. This restaurant is crowded, very tight space and I could barely move my arms when I was seated at the booth. I had the crab chowder on a sourdough bread bowl and I was pretty disappointed...
author: H K.

description:
My family friends came from China to SF for their honey moon. They ate here on 9/29/2015 and the server, Vincent, wrote in a tip on their check without them knowing. When they asked about it, he did not explain that he had added a tip for them. They kept the check because it didn't feel right to them, even though they couldn't communicate with Vincent properly. They showed me their check (I even have a photo on my phone now), and I was completely appalled to hear this story. 

Never in my life have I seen such blatant dishonesty from a server. I understand servers generally don't like foreigners or tourists because they don't tip. But that is absolutely not an excuse to add a tip to someone's check without telling them. This is completely unprofessional and inappropriate behavior. 

The silver lining is that I called the manager tonight and told him about the situation. He promised to call me back tomorrow so we could both talk to Vincent about this mishap and decide how best to proceed. Let's just hope that he follows through. I will update with how tomorrow goes.
author: Nicole Z.

description: It's always packed every time I walk by, so we decided to give it a try. I ordered a crab sandwich and lobster bisque for afternoon snack. Sitting outside, having the sea food, we had a good time with the bird and enjoyed the Bay area's view! The food are overall good, the bread might be a little bit stale.  ps: I prefer the crab sandwich to the shrimp one ~
author: Peizhi Z.

description:
I don't think it's worth writing much of a review given that 99.99% of all patrons of Nick's Lighthouse are tourists who likely aren't reading Yelp.  But let me just say that if you want quality sea food, you probably don't want to get it from the side of the street, sitting out in Costco cups in a glass case.  

We ordered Clam Chowder and a calamari cocktail.  Both were awful.  There were no clams (or other seafood) in the Chowder, and the calamari was rubbery and flavorless.

I'd highly recommend passing, no matter how hungry you are.  If you really want food in Fisherman's Wharf, go to In-and-Out.  It's fast food, but it's good fast food, and definitely a Bay Area specialty.
author: Greg B.

description:
My friend and I spent the past weekend in the bay area, one of the things she wanted to do was get a sourdough break bowl with clam chowder so its Friday night and we decided on Nicks Lighthouse at Fisherman's Wharf, I'm not really into clams, but the bread bowl sounded amazing. I love love love sourdough bread! 

I ordered the crab chowder in the bread bowl, I was expecting tasty pieces of crab surrounded by this warm creamy heaven, and well what I got was more of corn chowder with minimal crab in it. Now I happen to like corn chowder, so flavor wise it was good, and the bread was amazing! Omg I love bread!  But for crab chowder, I was disappointed, wanted to tasty some yummy crab meat!   

Everyone at Nicks was polite and friendly our server even came with humor, so if I was back in the area, I would stop Nicks, just wouldn't order the chowder.
author: Monica O.

description:
I was visiting the city and thought to stop by the bay. For some reason the server thought that he can put the tip himself saying that it is a service charge. 
That was not a service charge,  that was your tip

Really not impressed , soups were awful
author: Albert P.

description:
We were strolling the wharf on the 4th of July and decided we wanted fast seafood for lunch.

We got Nick's lighthouse to go and had the popcorn shrimp, crab sandwich and lobster bisque (shared).

I thought everything was very good and satisfying. 

The price is what you expect to pay for seafood on the bay. 

We would eat this again. :)
author: April T.

description: Being a tourist, you have to visit fisherman's wharf and try some seafood, especially if you're visiting from a land-locked state like I was. We settled on Nick's Lighthouse because we saw that they were steaming live crab and you can't get fresher seafood than that. Since the weather was really nice, we decided to take our food to go and enjoy the street performers so I can't comment on the dining room. Our whole Dungeness crab was about $18 and I loved every bit of it. The cook cracked each piece for us so we had no difficulty getting any of the meat out. Yum!
author: Monica V.

description: The area is full outside seafood vendors. My friends and I stopped by Nicks. Nicks has inside seating and a kitchen outside. We noticed the staff making a beautiful seafood platter. I inquired about the price and was told if I take it to go it's cheaper then seating inside. This was a weekend getaway and I decided to "splurge" and eat inside. Well... the service was slow. The sea food was mediocre and not presentable. The seafood platter was $125. Not impressed. We were leaving and my aunts glasses fell behind the furniture. She asked one of the employees to help her grab them. The employee said NO!! DONT GO NOT WORTH THE TIME OR MONEY!
author: marina m.

description: Had crab sandwich. Bread tasted good but was very tough. Crab filling was bland and under seasoned
author: Brendan N.

description: If you just order something simple and stand there and eat, like most people do. It's a OK place, as you wouldn't be too picky for street food. I would not recommend to sit down inside and eat. The long line made us want to come in and have a try, but not as good as we expected. The clam chowder is as good as many places here, good but nothing special. We ordered Saute seafood and Mahi Mahi. The Mahi Mahi is pretty oily, and that's not my favorite way of Mahi Mahi. The saute seafood is too dry and salty. We didn't finish the whole plate. Not a place worth for such long waiting time.
author: Cecily W.

description:
Pretty average taste. 

I ordered fish n chips. It came with lobster bisque. 
The fish n chips were mediocre. The fish was bland. 

Lobster bisque was actually quite good. But did not include any lobster pieces. 


I would recommend going elsewhere on the pier.
author: Matthew L.

description: The food was pretty expensive. However their crab chowder was great! And their fried zucchini was delicious as well. However the fish and chips was not the best. The service there was acceptable but not the best. The venue was very clean though and very well presented.
author: Celia L.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF  - Great for Locals and visitors.  Chowder is yummy fish and chips are always good..  and you have to get in Antonia's section.  She is fun, efficient and really makes the experience a sf treat
author: Donna L.

description:
WORST SERVICE!!! We were browsing around Fisherman's Wharf on vacation and of course, wanted to get some seafood. Saw reviews and this came up first on Yelp's list in the area, which I have no idea why they would be first. The food is probably good but we wouldn't know because we decided to sit down in their restaurant instead of ordering from the fast food window out front. 

We were seated pretty quickly but were at our table for about 15 minutes and no one ever came by. We were starving at this point after a whole day of biking around the city so decided to at least wait 5 more min. STILL, no one came so we decided to leave and grab food from another place. 

What really tipped us over the edge was on our way out, a group of the servers were standing in front of the doorway and we said "Excuse me" three times and no one moved. REALLY?! Finally my boyfriend yelled "EXCUSE ME" and one of the servers looked at us and said sarcastically, " Well, Excuse me!". SO RUDE!!! 

We were glad to take our business elsewhere!!
author: Kristine B.

description:
I spent my weekend in San Fran, and while visiting fishermans wharf i stopped here for some clam chowder. I ordered and not evening five minutes had passed and my food was brought to me! Not sure if it was a good thing, bc i was hungry...or a bad thing bc, who knows how long the food could have been just waiting.
I went a second time the following day and had a salad, my suggestion would be to just stick with the fish.
Besides that, waiters were great, & the fish was good :)
author: Sandra C.

description:
Visiting Pier 39 can work up quite an appetite and one has quite the array of restaurants to choose from. I'm so glad we chose this one.

We were welcomed in by an authentically smiling host who sat us at a cozy booth/

The atmosphere has a family-style casual feel with close booths and dim lighting. It was also a tad stuffy but that feeling dissipated once we got comfortable. 

We ordered garlic fries which were very good. The side salad was a basic small plate with some iceberg lettuce thrown on top. The best part was the crab linguini. It had a perfect blend of spices. There was ample crab meat on it and the portion was large. I highly recommend this dish.

Another plus was when I asked the waitress which soup she would recommend, she proceeded to bring out all three soups in little cups in order to let us taste them. (The clam chowder is the best IMO).

Overall a good place. I will go there again when I have visitors to show the Pier.
author: J D.

description:
Played tourist over the weekend and came here for dinner on Saturday. We came on the early side and the place was fairly full, but we didn't have to wait for a table. 

Tried the fried calamari, chowder in a bread bowl, and the crab sandwich. They were all pretty good, but the chowder was definitely a win! I thought it was better than Boudin's chowder in a bread bowl. The crab sandwich was nothing fancy and on the smaller side. Service was good and the decorations created a cozy environment.
author: Josh L.

description:
We ordered the oysters.. and its good tho.. my husband like it! Then we order steamed dungenes crab, taste great too..
Price are worth when all the flavor match with my tongue.. 
Overall, good!
Recomended!
author: Ini C.

description: Service was ok. Don't order the steak, it's not very good. The crab was good. Great location but we won't come back.
author: MarcCrystal C.

description: Overpriced for what you get and fish and chips were average. If you order in the front and not eat inside, it's cheaper. I wanted to eat here for awhile but it wasn't worth the wait.
author: L S.

description:
If you want fresh seafood at the Wharf, this pretty decent. I got the lobster bisque bowl and my boyfriend had the clam chowder bowl. The lobster bisque was basically tomato soup with like one, finely shredded piece of lobster (maybe).

The clam chowder bowl, on the other hand, was spot on. MASSIVE chunks of clam mixed with garlic and creamy goodness in a badass bread bowl. Seriously. Don't fuck around with anything else - get the clam chowder.

My only complaint is that they are super slow, even when there isn't a line. They seem pretty snobby and it's rather off-putting. They took so long to give us our food, that by the time we signed for it, we were starving and grabbed the food and left.
