We left so fast that we didn't realize that they didn't give us our card back and it was a huge pain in the ass to get it back...same long wait, with douchey counter guys.

I'd skip this place and go straight to Alioto's for real service and quality food.
author: Molly M.

description: The shrimp cocktail was good until I discovered that they cheat you by filling the bowl with lettuce and then put the shrimp on top. So I paid eleven dollars for seven shrimp. Then I went to complain about it and they said they rip everybody of so get over it. Then the lady from the stand next for said that's just how they operate. So sad that they take advantage of the tourists so I hope everyone reads this and goes next door
author: Jerry K.

description: Friendly,  tasty, affordable  $150 for 3 and that includes beers.  Crab chowder and the fettuccine with saffron and scallops was phenomenal.  All the wait staff was great.
author: Tim R.

description:
Be aware of pricing before you eat here. We passed up Fog Harbor and The Crab House because we felt the prices were too high; little did we know that the market price of $15/lb. for crab outside was only for to-go orders. In our defense, when I asked our waitress if the price outside was also available for meals inside, she assured me that "All of the food outside is the same as we serve inside." How naive that we assumed that she meant the prices. 

Two steamed crabs (1.5 lbs. each) with garlic butter sauce (add $3, she didn't tell us that part) ran us around $80. To be fair, it was good, but seeing the bill at the end left us with a bad taste in our mouths. A 15% gratuity was added, even though we were only a party of 4. Essentially, we felt like naive tourists that got completely taken advantage of. We spoke to the manager and explained the situation; unfortunately, he stated that he could not discount our meal, but that he could remove the gratuity. It was better than nothing, and so we just left, vowing to bee more vigilant in the future. 

Hopefully, this review can help other visitors to the area to know what they are getting themselves into. Just be aware and ask about everything!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Do not eat at this place. It dose not meet health standards.  Found hair in chowder.  Server replaced with another bowl. Then found a bug in salad. See photo. Sever denied it was a bug.  I called manager. He said it was not a bug. And offer no apologies. Tourists scam place.
author: Charles C.

description:
For the outside stand: 

So far I've tried 2 things off their menu:

Crab sandwich: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-zbfFXqxIU2tgRju6n9ziw?select=9jJAuksMytwFrXm2bBCfhg

This sammie is loaded with mostly crab and the usual filler.  Just think of a chicken salad.  I know people love sourdough bread and they want it with anything on the wharf, but I didn't think it was a good match for the sandwich.  The bread was just too crusty that the crab squeezed out the other end while eating.  - 3 stars

I got to try the lobster chowder too, but it's just like any other chowder bowl you could get in that area. 

3 stars for ease of ordering, location, and good eats.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Go to the crab stand, buy an entire crab and tell them to cook it in their spicy garlic sauce, and experience the most explosive food orgasm you have ever had in your entire life.  If you don't want to sit in their dark restaurant, go across the way to the circular chowder restaurant with private outdoor seating, get a beer and enjoy outside seating, the bay breeze, and the best crab in the world.

The crab meat was soo juicy and sweet.  Their spicy garlic sauce is so mind blowingly good without overwhelming the crab.  I'm not even overexagerating, its so good you'll probably lose your memory.  Nothing that happened prior to eating this will matter, its like a re-birth.  The first time I tried this, My girlfriend and I each got our own crab (around $30) and after we paid, we noticed this family of FOUR sharing one crab and we thought "shit...maybe we shouldve shared," but boy was I glad we didn't share because we both destroyed our individual crabs.  I'm not even embarrased because I know you're probably thinking I'm a hungry sasquatch right now, but if you haven't tried it, YOU DON'T UNDERSTAND.

It is a MUST if you're at the wharf, this is good for breakfast, brunch, lunch, mid afternoon snack, linner, dinner, AND dessert.  thank me later.
author: Mimi T.

description: I got portofino, spinach pasta was a little over cooked but was really delicious!! Appetizer Calamari was cooked to perfection!!!!!! Crab sandwich was really good as well. Little dirty and crowded... but so is every other restaurant in San Francisco. Had little touches you only find at authentic Italian restaurants out east ( nj ny) Brought me back... Would definitely go back next time we are in town!
author: Adrienne D.

description: As SF tourists for the day we wanted to go to a touristy place for lunch.  Nick's met our expectations for that... There were lunch specials which made it easier on our choices and on the wallet.  Clam chowder, lobster bisque, fish and chips, mussels, shrimp & scallops, calamari were all super delicious.  Free Bread was on the slightly burnt side though.  Everyone though enjoyed the meal.
author: Le C.

description: This is the best clam chowder on the strip.  I've never been in the restaurant, because I know how Fisherman's Warf works.  You go inside, pay 3x more for your food, and it's EXACTLY the same stuff.  So, stand outside, try to find a place on the metal surfaces surrounding the street stand, make sure to kick and wave as the birds come to eat your bread bowl, and enjoy Nick's clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Best chowder you'll get at Fisherman's Warf.
author: Rich L.

description: Its really a 2.5/5. The fish and chips were aight with the tar tar sauce but as soon as you touched it the batter comes off, it also want really crunchy at all. No matter how much lemon you add you could never really taste it. The crab sandwich was subpar at most. The sandwich did nooot have a good bread to stuffing ratio. It was a simple and classic crab sandwich and although those may be plain they can taste pretty amazing, thats what makes em classic. But this sandwich, though be classic with a simple bun and crab mixture, was not very amazing at all. The bread was overwhelming a very tasteless and watery crab mixture. The crab looked kind of fake, as if it came out of a can. The mixture was mixed with some pieces of celery and maybe some green onions but it tasted like that was literally it. No mayo no garlic no ginger or butter no black pepper. Maybe even no salt. It was a big watery crabby mess. It didnt help that the two pieces of bread that sandwiched it were crunchy but wayyy tooo tough and maybe a bit overdone. It was soft only about halfway through each piece of bread. But at least the customer service was nice enough. They gave us recommendations, helped clear the small table, following what we said like they were orders "yes sir" "absolutely sir" "of course"
author: Daniel P.

description: I have been here three times but my first review. All three visits are worthy of two stars. The food is very bland and at times flavorless especially for the price. If this were not in a high tourist area, I am certain it would be out of business.
author: Louis M.

description:
The tables are small and uncomfortable.
The service is rude.
The food is over priced.
author: Daniel S.

description: The worst food I've ever had! Bread was burnt, crab is watery/nasty. My brothers hamburger looked & tasted like it came from Costco frozen section. Even the tea tasted weird. As we left the restaurant we noticed the water the live crabs were in & you couldn't even see the crabs. Really wished I'd seen that sooner! When we told the manager he was rude and actually went through our food to see what was eaten and not eaten to decide what to charge us. All I know is if I end up in the ER I'm going to send him the bill. I'd really like to give this place a negative 5 star but the app won't let me.
author: Jackie F.

description: never again!!!!! had a hair in my claim chowder! over all food was bad food, bad service! don't waste your money!
author: Monica F.

description:
I'd give this place a 2.5. They were really nice but to be honest I felt a bit gypped from my crab sandwich experience. For 15, I'll shell for real crab, but when there's hardly any on my measly piece of bread and I take a bite and taste mostly bread...then it basically means I payed 15 bucks for bread, two small slices of tomatoes, some lettuce, and fries. 

Not okay. But again I give props to service here!
author: Tiffanie T.

description: Kind of a disappointment.  We had fond memories of this place but our recent visit was not that great.  The filet of sole sandwich was just a warmed thin piece of sole that was supposed to be grilled.  Sandwich came on good sourdough bread but with no condiments.  Very bland. Wife had a decent bay shrimp salad that could have come from a Safeway.  They charged for each soda with no refills included. Would have been nice to know before we had two each. $14 for four small sodas. I'd avoid this place in the future.
author: Mike R.

description: This place is ridiculous! The food was not good at all, but besides the food not being good our server inflated the tip and included an extra 15 dollars charge to my CC. I called the restaurant to try to get a refund for that amount and it was a nightmare! The General Manager was very unprofessional and ill-mannered and did not apologize for any of the inconvenience this has caused me. He began by asking me if I had worked at a restaurant before and I replied that I have, then he continued to state that I should understand that things like this happen and that they are going to refund me (without providing any confirmation of the refund) and what more do I want. Furthermore, he stated that it's not the end of the world and it's not like I got ran over by a food truck. WOW this guy is the last person that should manage a restaurant. So If you want to avoid nasty food and a nasty attitude DON'T GO HERE!!!!!!  I ended up having to file fraudulent CC charges through my bank because Nick's Lighthouse did not want to refund the inflated tip amount. What a hassle, at least if the food was good it may have been worth it, but unfortunately its should be called Nasty Lighthouse which accurately reflects the personnel's attitude and food.
author: Mamoru S.

description:
Ida and I were showing some women from Detroit around San Francisco and they wanted to go to the Wharf.  When we got to the wharf one of them wanted crab legs.  She somehow thought you could get large crab legs at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.  She was very disappointed and we did not know what to do so we let her pick out the restaurant.  Low and behold, she chose Nick's Lighthouse. 

 Eduardo seated us in a booth and shortly after Edilbert introduced himself as our waiter.  Being the tired, hungry, confused tourists that we were, we kept mistakenly calling Edilbert, Eduardo until he finally let us know he was not Eduardo and so we settled on calling him Ed.

Anyway, Ed was a very remarkable waiter that was not easily flustered by demanding out of town tourists.  Even when the women at our table complained that they could not find any lobster in their lobster bisque, he just replaced it with some kind of crab chowder.

I have a heart problem which prevents me from eating things with a lot of sodium so I settled for a crab sandwich and some unsalted fries.  Unfortunately, it was not crab season so my crab was tasteless.  Fortunately, I am on a low sodium diet so I am use to bland.  Maybe I will give them another try during crab season.

Overall, service was great and you really do get the wharf atmosphere.
author: Joe K.

description:
After my group of friends from Michigan had a full day of sight seeing in San Francisco, we found ourselves at Fisherman's Wharf feeling the pangs of hunger and weary from all the walking we did all day long.  One of our companions had this strong desire to eat crab legs.  According to my boyfriend, crab isn't in season at this time, so she would have to settle for fresh frozen Dungeness.  She didn't seem to believe him and started asking employees that stood outside at some of the seafood restaurants.  When she realized her California dream wouldn't come true, we let her pick a place to eat at so she would settle down and let us all find a spot to just eat and relax. 

Nick's Lighthouse was the chosen eatery.  Eduardo, who was standing outside guided us through the crowded and noisy restaurant.  We were lucky to find two adjacent tables that sat side by side - four of us at one table, and three at the other.  We also had different servers.   Menus and water were served quickly as we tried to seat ourselves in the most cramped seating arrangements I have ever had to endure.  Our stomachs were pretty much touching the tables, as I tried to place my purse, camera and jacket snuggly to the side of me.  I guess the goal is to try and fit as many patrons in as they can!  Maybe because this is a seafood restaurant, they took the term "packed like sardines" too literally! 

Our waiter Edilbert was great, he made our somewhat tense dining experience more bearable.  Since I wasn't that hungry, I ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Had I known we were going to get complimentary sourdough bread already, I would have just ordered my clam chowder in a regular bowl.  The sourdough was delicious, but it was just too much bread for me.  I really hated wasting the rest of the bread.  My boyfriend got a crab sandwich while my sister and girlfriend got lobster bisque.  The chowder was very good, but the lobster bisque apparently lacked flavor, including the lobster portion of the soup.  My girlfriend complained to Edilbert, and he kindly exchanged their soups for crab bisque which contained chunks of crab.  Everyone at our table enjoyed our meals.  The rest of our party at the other table didn't seem quite as satisfied, and seemed to keep quietly to them selves.  Although I did notice they were giving their waitress a hard time.  I guess if they were Yelper's we would hear all about it! 

When we were ready to leave, it took some maneuvering to get out of our booth.  Then we decided to use the rest rooms before leaving, and found ourselves in a very narrow hallway waiting to use a single cramped restroom for the women.  When all was said and done, it was a relief to get away from the noisy crowds of people within the small spaces, back outside to the open air again!  I began to notice a common theme in San Francisco, and remembered the quote: "it's a nice place to visit, but I wouldn't want to live there!"
author: Ida H.

description: Food is okay, but eat outside since the price goes up if you dine in and they state it's the same price but it's not.. Tourists trap!!!
author: Edwin L.

description:
Service was spotty in the beginning but got a lot better. We were seated quickly and then ended up waiting for a bit. After a good wait with no server greeting or offering us anything to drink, I asked politely for some assistance. The server I asked was very friendly, apologized right away, and said he could help us immediately. 

We ordered the crab chowder in a bread bowl and fish and chips. The crab chowder wasn't bad but I couldn't taste or see the crab. However, the sourdough bread bowl was delicious being soaked with the chowder. The fish and chips were my favorite and also the best I ever had. The cod was lightly battered and fried. You could taste the crisp and lightness of the fish and batter. Very tasty!!

Other than the fish and chips nothing really stood out for me. May visit again if I am in town or may adventure out to another place.
author: Vicki C.

description:
Calamari was the worst Id ever had and it was more expensive then other places close by. Chewy and old. Like yesterday's food saved for today.
Server had to get Mgr in order to refund our money. 
Avoid.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Not sure why Yelp has an overall review of 3 stars. We've been going to Nicks for over 20 years and the food is still fantastic authentic Italian seafood and still prepared the same as when I first went there in the 90's. My favorite is the bouillabaisse, which is kind of pricey, but it is literally good to the last drop of sauce. If you like an old school Italian restaurant, where both the customers and employees have been there for years, you can't miss with Nicks.
author: Todd Y.

description: Food was incredibly mediocre & bland. The Kids fish and chips were FROZEN & disgusting. Pasta dishes were watery. Service was fine.
author: Marc G.

description: Never dissapointed when I come here. The lobster is absolutely delicious every time! Service is great and not a long wait! I'll be back!
author: Stefanie P.

description:
This review is for the market stand (not the sit down restaurant), but I have to assume that the food is the same either way.  To be honest, I only tried one item - the Clam Chowder.  I opted for the pint, not a bread bowl.  Being from Boston, MA I would like to believe I know what clam chowder is supposed to be, and what it is not supposed to be.  The only thing the Chowder that Nick's version has in common with what I believe chowder to be is that is was creamy, and had potatoes in it.  The similarities end there, there were virtually NO CLAMS in the entire pint (I tasted maybe 3-4 small pieces of clam), and worse yet had little to no seafood/clam taste.  

For $9.52 for a bowl of soup, it is highway robbery.  I didn't mind paying the money when I assumed I would get a halfway edible bowl of soup.  I would up eating a little less than half and tossing the rest -- it just wasn't worth eating.  

I have had a few chowder's in my life that I would consider truly awful, this is right at/near the top of the list.  Perhaps their seafood is better than the soup ... but based on this, I wouldn't necessarily bet on it if they are doing anything to the seafood other than boiling/steaming it.

Highly disappointed.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Prawns and garlic fries the best cheap meal I had in pier 39.
The skinny
I was on the hunt for some good food on the cheap I found a little section in the fisherman warf that had plenty of options I came upon this gem after I noticed the garlic fries I decided to take a chance now I'm from the desert and know nothing about seafood so with that being said this was great for me prawns were nice ang big and tasty and garlic fries had a ton of garlic just like I love it. I also ordered a drink which they refill once for free so save money and share with your date :-) just a tip the place next door to them has an amazing sauce but I didn't try the food. 
The bad 
Parking sucks ass in this area so u just can't run out and pick up, also the new girl who was there messed up my order twice but I just had to correct her a few times which she didn't appreciate.
author: Alex C.

description: Great place to have seafood. The soup is a must. I recommend the lobster with bread. Also the fried options are very good. Fresh, tasty and good priced.
author: Juan Camilo C.

description: So sos nothing special over priced tourist place, outside stands are more appealing and a bit cheaper that sit down dinner...
author: Jimmy S.

description: The clam chowder in bread bowl at Nick's lighthouse was a huge disappointment. The food didn't taste good and the service was terrible. The waiter dropped the lid of the bread bowl on the floor and he pretended nothing happened. When another waiting was pouring water into our cups, it landed on the floor instead and splashed onto our shoes. Wouldn't recommend coming here.
author: p h.

description:
I used to live in the area so I really avoid tourist traps. Eating seafood on the sidewalk is not an option, my daughter was tired and we sat down for lunch.

Better than expected. Had lunch special, $14 bay shrimp and scallop fettuccine and comes with cup of chowder. Not bad if you're in the area but not something I would go out of my way to dine.
author: Michelle D.

description: So stumbled upon this place with my family and had to wait 20 mins for available table which was told the wait was 10 mins and honestly we were better off eating at jack in the box first time didnt know it would be so cramp and tiny plus our drinks took forever to come out and the customer service was just horrible we ask for bread twice from girl and got ignored  and when we recieve it  , it was burnt. My food was okay I was expecting a little more my boyfriend clam chowder bread bowl was hard and he got sick the very next day and my father n law fish in chips were cold , small and hard and his food came last and took awhile to come out and I would expect their to be a little more better service considering there was 7 of us. Everything just took so long and the waiters werent attentive and the food wasnt all that great and for the price theyre charging isnt worth it . seriously didnt deserve no tip but we did anyways. Never going back.
author: Emi L.

description: I only tried their crab stand because they had locals telling us to eat with them and they shared their food with us! So we had to buy a whole crab. For 25$! It was so good. Wow just wow they're amazing. The guys at stand were nice too. Better service than the place next door
author: Jennifer T.

description: Excellent traditional restaurant with incredible fresh seafood. The service was outstanding, attentive and gave great suggestions on menu items...would recommend as shoes the ambience and seafood of San Francisco. Aldo their clam chowder was outstanding and one of the best I have tasted...
author: Vince C.

description:
Shitty food service sucked   What can I say just move on

The crab bowl was a seafood potato soup no crab to speak of. The bread was 4 stars very good. 

The rest was terrible they treat you like tourist they thrive on it. So you eat there get burned spend 80 bucks on shitty food then never come back

Please don't feed them
author: Allen B.

description:
A lot of the reviews here aren't the best. We found this out AFTER being lured in by their worker guy outside.

After reading the ehh reviews I knew not to order their pastas. So I played it safe and got a red snapper sandwich and my man got the lobster. Our daughter ordered the cheese ravioli in meat sauce. Little son just ate fries, lol.

Since we were all scared and had minimal expectations on food, it all tasted good! YES! 

Pretty sure we'll never be back here but am glad this was an example of negative YELP reviews being misleading. Yes the establishment isn't the best with award winning food but the food really wasn't that bad either!
author: R H.

description: Our group enjoyed the lobster bisque and clam chowder first. They were both excellent. The bisque was less creamy than I prefer but still very authentic and delicious. I got the scallops. They were perfect with grilled broccoli and rice. The sauce was perfect. Nice portion size as well. The linguini marinara was excellent as well. They loaded the pasta dish with Little shrimps. The fettuccini de zafferano with scallops and prawns was seasoned well and delightful. Great attentive service with a nice atmosphere.
author: Katrina R.

description: Love the trout, so very moist. Nick's clam chowder is the best in town, add a little lemon juice and hot sauce Mmm Mmm Good :)
author: Ina S.

description:
I have tried out most of the stands in the wharf area and honestly none of them really stand out that much, but they are a solid option if you want some quick, cheap, and fresh seafood.  

On my last visit to Nick's Lighthouse, I ordered a crab sandwich.  The things was stuffed with crab salad and the bread tasted really fresh too.  It's nothing fancy, but it tasted decent and sure filled me up for  less than $10.  The best part about ordering from these stands is that you get your food right away, no waiting for a table, waiting to order or for the food to arrive.
author: Samantha L.

description: Sooo let me tell you all about Nick's!!!! I was walking around the Wharf in Sf and me, my boyfriend, and his mom initially came to get shots and oysters. The oysters were very good with the spicy cocktail sauce. But the crab caught my eye. We left and went to the movies but i was still thinking about the crab so we came back so I could get some and boyyyy im glad we did. I got the garlic crab is it was bomb.com. Cant wait to come back for more
author: Milani A.

description: Mixed feelings on this restaurant. Lunch specials were nice for smaller portions and lower prices. Crab chowder was delicious. Pasta with shrimp and scallops was average. Service was not great at all...we were seated back by the kitchen/waitress stand and while we waited forever for our check we had to listen to the servers have a debate over who would get to leave first for the day.  Next time I would probably order a crab chowder at the to go stand outside and not waste my time inside with the service.
author: Emily H.

description:
The food here is amazing if you have the money to spend. I like that it's high end great flavor without the high end attire and snooty feel. During our stay near the wharf we ate here twice. Once for dinner and another time at lunch. We loved the garlic butter Manila Clam appetizer but as I'm not a fan of deep fried seafood other than fish
And chips and calamari I wouldn't recommend the fried seafood platter. My husband enjoyed it much more than I. He liked guessing what each fry coated morsel would be where as I would rather have my seafood cooked in a nice sauce or drenched in butter like we had at lunch one day. Ordered a full Dungeness crab then asked for it to be cooked on garlic butter. So delicious!
The chowder here is better than Boudin too I believe but Boudin is like a fishermans
Wharf landmark so we had to try it.
Try Nicks, you will enjoy!
author: Sallie H.

description: Went here on a Friday around 3pm. Luckily the line was pretty short and fast moving. My friend and I got the clam chowder and calamari and chips. Nothing to complain about the clam chowder, it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. The calamari, on the other hand, was perfection. Lightly battered and so crispy. The curly fries that it came with were whatevers, I've had better.
author: Michelle S.

description: Food was ok but service needs some work.  I had to wait for 10 mins for someone to greet me, 2 server staff just keep looking at me and smiling at me instead of asking me if im ready to order.  Once i got my food, i was dissapointed as well.  My bread bowl clam chowder is all bread with a little portion of soup inside.   I got the crabmeat and shrimp combination and at first i thought that the cup was filled with shrimp and crabmeat, but it was only on top, the rest are all lettuce.  I don't remember ordering a salad, the portion had a little portion of shrimp and little portion of crabmeat.
author: Chris A.

description: Unless you are really tired, eat outside.  This restaurant is very cramp inside.  The service could be hit or miss, depends on who is serving you.  The lobster bisque was not good at all.  The crab chowder is best in a sourdough bread bowl.  The whole dungeness crab is very tasty, hard to screw up.  My best advise is to eat outside.
author: Jose P.

description:
I just want to say, if you are here for the dungeoness crabs, you are definitely at the RIGHT place!

I came with my friend who loves and have been craving for dungeoness crab for a long time. From the time before she got pregnant, to after she got pregnant and we finally got to come here when her baby turned one. And this is ONLY place she wants to go to satisfy that craving.

Since it had been years since she came to Fishermen's' wharf, all she could remember was the man behind the counter prepping the crabs. I thought to myself What was the likelihood that the same man is still working here? As luck would have it, she spot THE guy, which is how we found this restaurant. 

I wish I took photos of the crabs but it was so good, my hands just would not stop. LoL 
Who knew steamed crabs could taste so good?
author: Carina L.

description: Wowsers Rockafellar oysters .. to die for and normally I'm hesitant about ordering Lemon drops but super good. Actually this place will not disappoint !!!
author: 721 Members F.

description: Their ciopinno is really, incredibly, good.
author: Gavin M.

description:
We were quite let down by our experience here. Reviews had been encouraging and we were eager for another good seafood meal before leaving SF. I had the crab chowder which was free with my order of the special shrimp and scallop pasta alfredo ($16.95). This was marked as an appetiser.
My dining companion had lobster bisque and a main dish of shrimp (large ones we would call prawns at home) with garlic sauce, cauliflower and rice. We also ordered bread but it never arrived or was mentioned again.
I enjoyed my chowder, it had good flavour and consistency. The lobster bisque was light on flavour and a little on the runny side even for bisque.
The shrimp and garlic sauce dish was underwhelming, it had been so well sold in the menu. It consisted of 5 shrimp, sauce rice and cauliflower and the amount of food was little for the price (about $26 with complimentary bisque).
My pasta alfredo was far more satisfying, with a great amount of pasta and sauce, enough shrimps and an interesting but pleasant addition of lightly cooked tomato. The scallops rumoured to be included were on the scarce side but the dish was still very good. More food that my companions main order.
The service was very casual and as our break request was completely overlooked I'll drop my review score. I'm also dropping score because of the sub standard meal my companion had which was pricey for how basic it was.
If you eat here, the chowder in bread bowls would be a good choice, or stick to the specials menu.
author: Anthea W.

description: Terrible service. Didn't receive two of the items we ordered then they left them on the bill and try to charge us for um then we tried to get him to take it off the bill which was a huge hassle. My Clam Chowder Bowl was pretty much a potato bowl with maybe one piece of clam and it also we ordered the crab bowl and it was absolutely no crabs to be found in it. I would not recommend Nick's Lighthouse to anyone
author: Mike B.

description:
Best crab sandwich in San Francisco.  If you are not fond of a 'crab salad' type of crab hoagie on sourdough then ask for plain crab sandwich on a toasted sourdough roll.  Lemon and drawn butter and a little pepper and your flavorful meal is ready to eat.  The Atmosphere in the restaurant is a trip through time to an original crab/fish monger the way San Francisco is in black and white photos .  Prepare for a feast.  
The wait staff are friendly and uncharacteristically friendly, even at the peak of the service.  Ed absolutely made my evening meal, one to remember.
author: Raymond C.

description: Best little place on the wharf for a Romantic crab dinner for 2. Service was great, food was delicious. Looking forward to going back again soon.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Good food!
The clam chowder bread bowl and shrimp cocktail were good. My wife had the oysters and clams and rated them "meh +!"
Service was great and the place was totally packed!
The bathroom was the size of a matchbox!
author: Terry R.

description:
Stopped here for lunch on our walk around the wharf - cause my friend loves this place. I liked it - but maybe expected more from the hype. 

Our order: 
The Spicy Garlicky Dungeness Crab - totally worth every penny! Make sure you get it spicy! I don't know why, the spice makes it awesome! We shared a plate and it was great! 

Half dozen Oysters - This was all me. Oysters for my first time was pretty good. I have a feeling that I might be able to find better somewhere else, but they were still delicious and super yummy with the house sauces! Makes me want some now! 

Calamari - decent enough. Not anything fantastic but it was good. We were craving the Calamari, so we got it. I think you could do without it. 

Lobster Bisque - was actually pretty good! Wish we would have just ordered a full bowl of the bisque and left the calamari in the kitchen.

The food was yummy and satisfying - just not mind-blowing. 

Why they don't have 4 stars is because of the awkward seating area. We sat near the window,  but right next to the restrooms. The booth moved every time anyone shifted in their set, and I felt like I was playing on a rocker with the dude behind me. Awkward and took away from the experience of my meal.

They also have a simple wine selection. All the basics but not many options for just one glass orders.
author: Nahid D.

description: Had the crab chowder and crab cakes.  Not exactly worthwhile.  Crab cakes were overdone and had no flavor and the crab chowder was Medicore.   There are much better in the area.
author: Amber L.

description:
A review of the oysters only.

I've stopped by Nick's Lighthouse a few times while in the Fisherman's Wharf neighbourhood. Each time I have popped by this establishment, I have ordered oysters from the stall outside, which fare at $1.75 per piece. 

Most recently, I partook in their Blue Point Oysters which were fresh and shucked to order. While their prices are a bit inflated (especially the dungeness crab), the price for a few fresh oysters is acceptable. 

Recommendations:
-Forgo the indoor restaurant and seating 
-Come by for a seafood snack, order from the stall, and eat by the water. 

Verdict:
The oysters have a good cost-value ratio.
author: Laila A.

description:
Lucky find.  We tried the sauteed sampler and the fish and chips.  All seafood was cooked to perfection.  The clam chowder is delicious. The fish with the fish and chips was perfect.  The french fries were no good.  

Our waitress was terrific.  She was very attentive and always prediciting our every need.

The food is probably overall 3-3.5 stars.  Service was a 5.  The prices compared to the surrounding restaurants were quite reasonable.
author: Lizi C.

description: Food is a hit and miss...I got a halibut fish sandwich and it was not good and neither were their French fries. My friend got a crab cake and that was good it was packed with flavor. Also their chowder was good too. So this place is a hit and miss
author: Cristian P.

description:
Crab chowder. Need I say more? OK a bit more. The clam chowder and lobster bisque are also good.

It's small, but good service and good food.

Hack: Get the garden salad with Dungeness crab and 1000 Island dressing for a less expensive louie.
author: Anastasia M.

description:
Food was decent. The crab was quite supple and tasty, and they cooked it very well to where removing the shells was easy. The sautéed seafood platter was decent as well, nothing really particularly special except it being a tourist trap. 

Now here's the bad part. My stomach felt very weird that night, and my I've heard people having food poisoning experiences from here. The crab was tasty, but most likely UNCLEAN. I also do not like the service and management; I understand it's a busy place, but the manager was very gruff and brash with customers. I don't like how they also include tip into your bill, for any size of party. That just screams pretentiousness to me, which already doesn't help the general image of the place. You would have to pay me to go back again.
author: Vincent K.

description: Very uncomfortable tables, sub par and expensive food. Had fish and chips and found it to be without flavor. Also tried the lobster bisque which lacked flavor and was gritty. It is all very expensive, understandable given its location, but not the food quality.
author: Robert W.

description: Best lobster bisque, clam chowder, crap sandwhich ever!!!!!! . You definitely get your dollars wort. Parking across the lot has gone up from 25 to 45 maybe because it was the holiday season .
author: Kain E.

description: Food from the outside may look good but step inside at night and its crowded. Service is really bad and the place is SUPER LOUD. The food is not as good as it looks, the clam chowder here is horrible looks more like chicken soup with small pieces of crab and its watered down. Will not eat here again.
author: Anthony H.

description: If I were to eat seafood along the pier, I would come here for their clam chowder in a bread bowl and fried shrimp. In the clam chowder there was to much celery in my opinion, but otherwise it was OK and the marinated calamari was bomb. My son had the fried shrimp which he said was awesome but while until he was attacked by 2 seagulls who wanted to share his shrimp.
author: Laura M.

description: Great service! Great lobster bisque. Meals were delicious! Thanks Lemar and crew!
author: gary s.

description:
Although the space inside is a bit tight, the food is outstanding, as well as the service. This is my favorite "hole-in-the-wall" seafood place in SF. It's in the most touristy area that you can get, but oddly enough, the prices aren't crazy and the clam chowder is to die for. 

Any time I head to Fisherman's Wharf, I head down. Waaaayyy better than Boudin's.
author: Matthew R.

description: Zero stars for the sheer fact that some idiot owner sneaks a "government mandate" surcharge onto the bill to cover employee health benefits. Sneaky. Tacky. No class. Don't politicize your beef with the president's policies on my bill! Good employers provide health insurance and other benefits. Period. With that said, this is going to be brief. Entrees average. Crab chowder yummy. Salad awful. Bread good. Service good. Dining room cramped. Restroom? Good lord, it's no bigger than the one on an airplane! Will we be back? Nah.
author: Mary C.

description:
Brought my gf's to try my usual haunt in SF. It's my "I need some garlic and Crab in my life" spot lol. I had a half crab with the girls and it was as good as I remember (albeit pricier, the half crab is now $18.99 plus $3 more for spices - it does go by market value FYI)! 

We had the Garlic and Spices version and it was finger licking good lol. We devoured a lot of sourdough as well (thanks to our fearless waitress for replacing without comment lol) and a cup of creamy clam chowder. 

We left with lighter wallets and full bellies but loved it. FYI, as my gf "Pam S." mentioned in her post, it is a tourist area. It's jammed packed with people and prices are usually hiked up but worth it if you are craving a hearty, "get your hands dirty" meal lol. If not, pay double at one of the nice places in town for 2 legs ;P

Happy travels!
author: Jeanette H.

description: Enrique was our server and awesome host!  He made us feel welcome into this hidden gem of a restaurant in fishermans wharf.  Honestly we chose it because my hubs name is Nick and we figured we'd give it a shot!  Glad we did, calamari was fresh and so good along with our clam chowder and linguine.  Give it a try!  It's a dive but one of the originals!
author: Rosie M.

description:
They've been in business a long time, so I suspect that they are doing something right, other than drawing in tourist.I might have enjoyed the old SF ambiance  if we weren't jammed in a corner table. On the plus side, the server was charming.

The calamari S and I shared was nicely prepared, however, the portion was small and there weren't many tentacles. S was disappointed with his clam chowder and said it was just okay, but I think he did not even think it was okay. On the other hand my crab chowder with corn was really good. The French bread was warm and fresh.

We also had desserts S's, cheese cake was dry and tasteless, my tiramisu was really good. It was severed in a bowl with a bit of fresh cream and powdered coco on the top.  This rich dessert was the highlight of the meal.
author: Terry T.

description: I went to Nick's on Saturday night with a couple of my friends and ordered crab. The food was pretty good and the drinks  also. However, the service was excellent I would've given this restaurant five stars had the food been excellent but I gave it four stars simply because the service I got was unbelievable, the guys name is Joab and if you go to Nick's make sure you get him as your server because he will serve you right. Try the crab and the shrimp it's yummy!
author: Judy A.

description:
The girls and I came here because everyone craved Crab... I wanted Crab too until I got there and decided I wanted a Mimosa more and got the fish and chips instead LOL 

Everyone ordered half an order of Crab and I believe they all ordered Spicy Butter sauce THEY were tickled pink with their selection. I on the other hand was not ={ the Fish and Chips did not have much flavor but the fries and the slaw were THE BOMB! The Lobster Bisque had a weird taste... and now hear me out! I KNOW that I am from Boston and that I also have been a Director of Catering for over 20 years (so can I tend to be picky) but there was something 'odd' about that Lobster Bisque. This is a busy restaurant located right in the center of action at Fishermans Wharf very fast paced and tight quarters for dining. Our service the young lady kept on top of us for refills of bread (that would be sourdough of course) and my friends Iced Tea was strong and refreshing.

Will I go back? meh maybe to try that crab out which was moderately priced and my fish & chips was only 3 pieces but keep in mind. You are in the Mecca of Tourist Traps. I usually avoid Fisherman's Wharf because I feel it is bombarded with Tourist. After living in Southern California for most of my life and choosing to spend my vacations (often 4 times a year) in San Francisco... I'm not sure if I am still considered a 'tourist' I'd much rather eat where the locals eat BUT if this is your first time in town. GO FOR IT!

Respectfully Reviewed
author: Pam S.

description:
After visiting and sampling two wharf stands, Nick's is the one to get chowder at. I felt like Goldilocks trying to get one that was just right, nonetheless it was still not extraordinary.

Stood in line for the Crab Chowder in a Sourdough bread bowl, one of the things I love about visiting SF. The Crab Chowder tasted very different, it's somewhat cheesy but the fresh crab bits in the chowder itself was enough to convince me to finish the darn thing. Bread bowls? Do you actually eat it? From what I've seen on the wharf, HELL yeah you do or you could just feed it to the seagulls - or not unless you enjoy the attention from both birds to humans.

For $7.25 a bowl, yeah it's pretty steep for a pretty average quality chowder but hey at least you know where NOT to go!
author: Janet N.

description:
I really hate giving a bad review to a restaurant but my last visit really left me a little angry.
First off, I actually like coming to Nick's lighthouse for the whole ambience it has. Small restaurant, small booths, very cozy feel. 
We came in for lunch two weeks ago. My friend and I were in the mood for a seafood fiesta! We were hungry and wanted everything! So we started with 1 dozen oysters, then 2 clam chowder bread bowls, the cheese bread, crab cocktail, tiger shrimp cocktail, fried seafood platter and a crab pasta. Yes.. We eat like piggies. Overall the food was ok. I've had better else where but once again, I like the ambience of this place. 
Now this is where things go down hill. Our server Olga, was just not very friendly. She didn't really seem like she cares too much about our table. After taking our order she just came and dropped off food without saying what it was or anything, Just drop off and go.  Rarely check on us to see how we were doing. The busboys/water boy were pretty friendly. Actually the other servers were quit lively with their tables. 
Now here the worst part, the bill.  We look at the bill and there at the bottom, a hand written extra charge. Hmm what is this? No description, just a written amount added to the printed check(look at picture). I asked the gentleman server was this a tip? He says yes. I am now surprised, a tip is added for a party of 2?! His explanation was... Well we get a lot of tourist, so we just suggest it.  Ok? So You just add a tip for small tables also? He says we aren't obligated to give it, smiles and leaves. Seriously? This was the first time I have ever seen this. I asked the tables around us who got their bills and none of them had the written tip. So why us? Our neighbors joked that maybe it's because we had a large bill. I work in the food industry. This is not something we would ever do. And because I'm in the industry I still give her the 15% tip she suggested. Although... I would have gave her more. Even with the lack of attention.   I almost didn't want to give her a tip at all. This really irritated me. 

So Nicks lighthouse, this will be the last time I visit your restaurant. And I will no longer recommend my friends to come here either. This isn't good business practice. Even if you get a lot of tourist. These guest spend hard earned money to come visit our great city. Stop ripping them off!
author: Stan Y.

description: There were 5 of us and the only seat that appeared to be available were the ones right next to the door trapped in a corner between the exit and wine barrel the waiters used to throw dirty napkins in while folding clean ones on top.  We shoved ourselves and our bags in the corner and the kids order the cheeseburger meal, hamburger meal, shrimp pasta and pasta.  I ordered a side of garlic fried potatoes, garlic bread and a cup of clam chowder.  As we waited for our food, the smoke from people smoking outside drifted into our dining space.  When I asked if they had to keep the door open, the waiter said he had to keep at least one door open...while the other waiter proceeded to fold the clean napkins with his butt facing directly to my left just 2' away from my elbow.  My thighs may be thick but the draft from the door still made me shiver and grumpy.  When the bread came, we grabbed it like starving hyenas only to find out the butter provided was colder than the air outside, unable to spread onto the sourdough, chewy dinner bread.  So...as we waited for the rest of our food, I noticed the thickness of the sticky, clumpy looking dust bunnies that gathered on the ceiling panels, around the ceiling vents and frosted on the decor all around the room.  When the garlic fried potatoes aka garlic fried came, it was a small serving for the $5.95 I paid (Harvey's had a bigger portion that looked fresher for the same price).  We feasted on it and my nephew even ate the chunks of garlic and scallions. The clam chowder was then served in a cup and it was ok but small for the $6.95 price, nothing worth bragging.  The appetizer garlic bread was proportionally small, super oily and salty and looked like it sat in the oven too long.  The aftermath of chewing that bread felt like chewing the same gum for 2 hours, and not the Bubblicious kind but the Trident kind that comes in tiny cubes that runs out of flavor in 3 minutes.  Finally, when I was done with appeasing my stomach, I had to use the restroom.  OMG! There was only room for 1 person to stand and wait in the aisle for either bathrooms so I waited in walking traffic between customers, waiters and others that had to pee.  Once inside, it was just big enough to sit on the toilet and stand to wash my hands...luckily I'm petite but a thicker version but still fit in there.  It was finally over.  We paid which included the 15% gratuity the waiter graciously included for us for the service/butt traffic that crossed us several time while eating our meal ("butt traffic" meaning people having to turn to their side either facing their crotch or butt to move along the walkway by our table).  I won't be returning there.
author: Somphane H.

description:
I came here to get a pint of clam chowder since I was around and craving it. I came to the street side of the restaurant for a quick grab and go kind of thing. It's also one of the cheaper spots to get some clam chowder with a local flavor.

The guy there was super nice, which was awesome! He was joking around and I found that pretty funny. But to be honest, the clam chowder wasn't my cup of tea. It was a lot different from the usual clam chowder. It was more on the veggie side and it tasted more like vegetable soup than clam chowder. I guess it's the ingredients that make it different and a local flavor. 

I do like how the clam chowder was thick. Those are the best! There were real clams, which was super awesome. It's rare to see something like that now! There were definitely a lot more veggies, which is the reason for the veggie-tasting clam chowder.

I am not sure if I'll come back again since I am not too fond of their clam chowder. I like the typical clam chowder and this is probably not my cup of tea. But it is a nice and decent place to try something new!
author: Wendy Y.

description:
We had a pretty decent meal here.  The restaurant is behind their street vendor stand so you actually have to go behind their counter and find the establishment.  Once inside we were seated right away.

The service was fast and friendly but for the prices they charged I would expect a little more attention.  They were busy but not overwhelmingly busy.  

We ordered a seafood pasta dish and it was a very big portion and was creamy and tasty with lots of seafood chunks in it.  We enjoyed it and it was a big enough meal to split.  

We also ordered the crab cocktail.  I had been craving a crab cocktail for two days and finally settled on getting one at this place.  I am glad that I bhose Nick's to be the one.  They gave plenty of juicy, fresh, sweet crab.  It was devine.  The cocktail sauce was also really great with just the right amount of zing to it.  

Overall, we had a pretty decent experience here.  I would definitely come back and visit the front outdoor market but I doubt we would come back to the dining establishment in the back.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Live Dungeness crab at Fisherman's wharf served with lemons and melted butter seemed like the perfect snack for my girlfriend and I during our last visit to San Fran...and it was.  The sunny weather and nearby music w/dancing hobos only made the experience better.  We were lucky enough to locate a nearby picnic table as the outdoor "seating" at Nick's consists of two narrow tables with standing room only and a max capacity of about 6.  Market Price for us on a 1 lb. crab was about $15.
author: James H.

description:
great fresh Dungeness crab but overpriced. kind of a tourist trap. what do you expect? it's fisherman's wharf.

The crab is done just the way I like it... not overly seasoned--just fresh and hot. dip it in melted butter or cocktail sauce yourself.

outside of the crab, there's really nothing remarkable.  I've had the clam chowder and the lobster bisque.  Both quite sub par.

atmosphere is not great. chairs are lumpy and uncomfortable and the place is pretty cramped and crowded. but it's nice to eat the crab while it's hot (vs takeout), and lumpy booths are better than sitting outside in the wind fending off aggressive seagulls.

you can get crab right next door for cheaper (and worse atmosphere) but I haven't tried.
author: Jimming C.

description:
My friend and I stopped by Nick's Lighthouse (food cart outside of the restaurant) while walking in front of the Fisherman's Wharf. Even though we had lunch just 10 min before we got there, we felt the urge to just check out why all the street food carts there were super crowded with long lines for these seafood....

so we randomly picked one vendor to purchase, and it happened to Nick's Light House. The food was served in a very large portion; We got 3 crab cakes (which were sold all 3 together for around $10..no choice to just get one piece) and shrimp popcorn $6. After haggling and getting all the ketchup and other condiments behind the cart, we had to go find a place to stand just to eat.

And...what a huge let down...the food was extremely bland..even with the condiments...nothing memorable. The crab cakes tasted oily and a bit like a curry dough...After the first bite, we definitely regretted paying for both the crab cakes and the shrimp popcorn (we actually ended up throwing half of these away....)..and even more so...we regretted taking in more calories than we needed from just checking it out...

Not sure if the food from other nearby vendors is any better (since they all have long waiting line), but we would definitely not recommend anything Nick's Lighthouse ever.
author: Joop V.

description: If it wasn't for Francis we would not have eaten here as there are plenty of places like it on pier 5. The smoked salmon fettucini with white cream sauce was delicious. The clam chowder was yummy too! Servers were super friendly and personable.
author: Ruby K.

description: Food was terrible, not hot temperature and the restaurant was dirty. The clams where bad and how in hell do you mess up a clam chowder soup in SanFrancisco? Worst place!  Thanks to the huge rat, I was out in a heart beat! Sick place!
author: Cynthia P.

description:
Okay, I know this is totally touristy of me, but I blame my family.

A few weeks ago, my cousins and aunt came up to visit.  I did what any normal SF resident would do: I sent them on a Ride the Ducks tour and met them for dinner afterwards.

With my two younger cousins in tow, they were all starving after the tour (despite a large dim sum lunch beforehand) and decided to wander around Fisherman's Wharf before dinner, stopping in the first restaurant with a table for 6.  None of them remember the restaurant, but all of them said they ate fresh, delicious seafood with gusto.

Which is what got my mother started on this whole seafood thing; when she came up to visit a couple weeks later, her only request was to have seafood at Fisherman's Wharf.  It didn't matter which restaurant, but she wanted seafood.

Fine.

After a few withering looks at my mother, I agreed to take her to the heart of the action and we walked down Taylor, looking inside the restaurants to see if there were any open tables.  It was Thursday around 2:30 PM, so I was surprised to see most of the restaurants super crowded; one even said they only had bar seating.

So we saw some open tables at Nick's and walked in.  My mother requested "fresh seafood, like lobsters, crabs and oysters" and our waiter suggested the Imperial Platter ($110), which included one lobster, one crab, a bunch of shrimp, oysters, clams, and he'd throw in either soup or salad for us.

Since I don't eat much seafood or shellfish (I'm actually allergic to lobster and oysters), I can't comment on the price of the whole platter, but it was seriously enormous to the point where I was questioning if we would actually be able to finish it all, even though we didn't order anything else.

I received the shrimp louie salad as my starter, and my mom got the clam chowder, which she really enjoyed.  My salad wasn't bad either, especially when they brought out a hunk of crusty sourdough for me to dip in the remainder of my Italian dressing.  Then came the platter, and between the two of us, we managed to finish the whole thing: I polished off the shrimp and crab (which was gigantic and had plenty of meat in the legs and body), and my mom ate the HUGE lobster and the clams/oysters.  Everything was really fresh and delicious.

An actual enjoyable meal in Fisherman's Wharf?  Who knew.
author: Tori S.

description:
Great place to get fresh crab during the season! Just eat it right there, by the cooking kettle, with a beer! Simple yet amazing!

The cooking staff is very friendly and knowledgeable too. It's a must stop!
author: Andre N.

description: Small little joint near the piers. Ordered three dozen blue point oysters and 1/4 of them were milky (couldn't enjoy the oysters). Waitress only came out to bring the initial drinks, the food and the bill. Make sure to inspect your oysters.
author: Johnni N.

description:
If you want a decent alternative to Boudin's then this is a good choice. 

Be prepared to stand in line awhile. Very tourist heavy area. The place needs a little updating but it seems busy enough that I understand there would be no time for that. I had the Boston Clam Chowder bread bowl. It was pretty good. My fiancé had the Lobster Bisque bread bowl and that was pretty good as well. You pay extra for dining in. The dining area is cramped a bit but they have a good system of getting the food to the customer efficiently.

I give only a 3 Star because it is pretty average. Nothing blew my mind. And they are in a heavy tourist area so I know my opinion won't change their business. Check out the place.
author: Jay O.

description: The crab and lobster bisque was really good. The half crab came with a spicy lemon base. The lobster bisque had some type of cheese our whole table liked.
author: Ebahi E.

description:
best clam corn chowder I have ever had... even though I paid $6.50 for a cup of it!!!
This small charming little restaurant is right behind all the outdoor vendors who sell their fresh crab and clam chowder. 

this restaurant has a certain old charm about it though. It kind of looks like your grandparents house. it's old and antique and the table furnishings are all old fashioned. there is no high class ambiance. You feel comfortable wearing any type of clothes in this environment. I saw SO MANY TYPES of people at this joint!

one thing that needs improvement is their  melted mozzarella garlic bread. It seems as if they just took the cheese and plastered it on top of their bread and microwaved it. BRAVO NICKS! you got me....

fyi, if you parked in the multi-parking structure in pier 39, this restaurant DOES NOT validate your ticket. this establishment only validates the people who park across the street from them.
author: Philip M.

description:
Vibe - food stand
Price- affordable 
Service- fast
Parking- free for 1-3 hours pending purchase
Greeting- hawking friendly
Bathroom: in restaurant

The prices are best from the stand rather than the restaurant

Food
Due genesis crab salad on a Boudin sour dough roll $8. Indigenous to SF. This place has the best bread. Big fresh crab salad. Not too much mayo.

Mini shrimp in a cup $5. Amazing too. So fresh they taste like they jumped out of the bay and into the cup. 

I always eat here when in SF. It's a quintessential SF food experience. Like eating bagels in NY. 

WIGB? Yes
author: Hungry K.

description:
I'm going to make this SHORT and SWEET:

I LOVE THEIR CRAB CHOWDER. Try it, and you will never go back to boring clam chowder.

BOOM. You're welcome.
author: MiaBenz C.

description:
No leg room! I've never been in such a cramped restaurant. I'm a 5'4 girl and I had trouble getting in and out of the booth. Also, not being able to see my actual seat since the table and table cover were covering it, I sat on something really slimy and gross that I didn't want to find out what it was. Um, wipe your seats down please! My waitress even saw me get up and start wiping whatever it was off my pants and making quite a fuss out of it...and she walked right by me. No questions, no concerns. Also, when I tried waiving her down to take my order she just kind of waved me away and said she'd come back, but I had to waive her down once more. And at the end when we got our check, she pointed out a paper to us in a condescending tone, "This shows you how to tip in America". HELLO if you would maybe pay attention while talking to your customers, you would notice that I spoke perfect English? I don't know if she was being racist because she was giving exceptional service to the caucasion couple in front of me.

Besides the lacking customer service, the food is pretty decent:
Lobster bisque in bread bowl - They actually give you the stuffing of the breadbowl whereas some places do not. I've only hd lobster bisque twice in my life and unlike my first time, it was delicious!
Linguine marinara - served with red peppers and cocktail shrimo, really good! definitely recommend.
Sadly, their Boston clam chowder disappointed. I got it on the side of my linguine marinara and there was not ONE piece of clam in it! Flavor was a bit bland as well. Oh well, try their lobster bisque, but get it from the sidewalk stand in front. Not a pleasant dining experience.
author: Linna N.

description: My wife enjoyed her clams. The place really needs a renovation, though. The staff was pleasant and the location is cool.
author: Emily M.

description: I was there on 05/05/2016 , we had two clam powder on bread bowls, the morning was a bit chill so the warmth of the bowl hit the spot. Parking across the street is free for 2 hours if you purchase more than 15.00 dollar you must show receipt.
author: Don J.

description: Right on the Fisherman's Warf decided to get a Grilled Halibut Sandwich and try some local beer. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable and the food was really good and would highly recommend trying this place out again. The prices are very reasonable as well.
author: Randy J.

description: One of the worst meals I've had in SF in 4 years living here. Didn't think you could ruin crab sandwhich until I ordered it here.
author: Odayme Q.

description:
Not impressed.
Went there with some friends upon their request.
Had a rough time getting seats, and we had to split our party of 7 into two different booths.
The food was bland on a good day, and the presentation was crumby, the staff needs a little touch up also.
Good tourist trap IMHO, but for locals to eat, i would look some where else.
author: Mark S.

description: Ordered half a dozen of clams and oyster they did not taste good, not fresh at all. I was very disappointed! Also there's a $10 minimum so you can't even order a cup of clam chowder because it's under $10 for one person what if that's all I want!!!?! Should have stuck with Bubba Gump or Boudin you can never go wrong with those 2 places!!
author: Mari C.

description:
ILLEGALLY SELF TIPPING WAITER!!!!

WARNING!!! CHECK YOUR RECEIPTS

I am appalled and have never heard or seen a place do such a thing. I cant believe this place is still in business.

I was here over the weekend and we ordered about $150 worth of food. The waiter, AN OLDER FILIPINO MAN was rude and giving very poor service.

After all that, He had the nerve to write down in pencil on our check, $17.68 for the tip, ON HIS OWN WILL.

When we went to complain to his manager, he took the receipt right away, hushed us and chalantly fixed it all in a seamless motion without hesitation as if he's done it many times before.


Please take my note seriously and check your receipt.

The food wasn't bad and the setting was ok, I'd give the place a 3.8/5 if there were waiters STEALING slyly from you
author: Wolfgang N.

description:
A little dirty but great crab rolls.
They have cold crab rolls with a fluffy white buttery bun. The guys were funny and made crab jokes and make a fun costumer atmosphere.
author: Prusha S.

description: Wish we hadn't gone to this restaurant. Our server was great but the rest of the service not so much. The food was very over priced and not as good as expected. Got the lobster and it was very tough and had a funky taste. Also tried the fish as chips they were good but the ketchup tasted like very very off...
author: Sarah R.

description:
This review is primarily for the chowder bread bowls:

2.5/5 stars. I ordered the Lobster Bisque bread bowl, but wasn't impressed. I expected more substance to it. It was soupy, needs more spices, and wasn't fresh. I also tasted my friends' crab chowder and the clam chowder. Both were okay, but between the 3, I would go crab chowder with the because it tasted more natural with chunks of crab and also because it is more appropriately spiced. The clam chowder is also okay with less texture to it. Lobster bisque was a disappointment. Large bread bowls are ~$8 for the lobster and ~$9 for the clam/crab

The chowder I had in Seattle was a lot more fresh and creamy than at Nick's Lighthouse. My biggest problem with this place is the freshness of the chowder. You would think being situated in Fisherman's Wharf that they'd have better chowder? Guess not. I'll try other places before coming here again.

SERVICE [4/5 stars]: I found a small strand of hair in my bread bowl. I notified my waiter and he began to poke around it as if he didn't believe me. However, he didn't ask me any further questions and quickly got me a new one. I think the service here is pretty good--I really liked that he didn't ask questions; but it did bother me that he had to inspect it as if he doubted my judgment. As for the hair topic, while it is gross, I do understand it happens sometimes and therefore am rating this based more on execution and how they resolve the problem, which I thought was fantastic. Extra star for that.
author: Henry T.

description: Absolutely amazing crabs! We also had lobster bisque & the clam chowder.. Everything was superb, fresh & made to order. The cocktails were great as well. The staff was very courteous & attentive to the customers. They made this one of the best dining experiences I've had in the Bay. Don't be fooled by the touristy atmosphere at Fishermans Wharfs.. This is good eating.
author: Monica R.

description: I'm from the New England region. When I went up for a trip to SF with my wife and her family who are from there, it was the best seafood I've ever had. Yeah the wait was long, but it was defiantly worth it and will continue to make it my number one place to go when in the Bay Area.
author: Eric C.

description: We came here as a last resort because we couldn't decide on what to eat. I was craving pasta so I just ordered the Alfredo pasta with no chicken and it was like eating butter and Alfredo sauce. Super bland flavor. Also, the garlic bread I ordered was soaked in oil, stale, and not fresh whatsoever. I'll say that the garlic fries were the best thing about our experience. But everything else from the food, and dining experience was horrible! The place makes me feel disgusted to eat there. The seats are grimy, and the ceiling needs a major dusting. I hate to be so negative but the list keeps going. There was the smell of cigarette smoke coming through the door, we asked the waiter if he can close the door, and they said they had to keep at least one door open.  Another downside, was that the walk ways were sooo narrow, the waiters had to walk sideways right next to our table and my poor mother was at the end, having to be about a foot away from their butts. This place needs a huuuuge pick me up and even a visit by Gordon Ramsay too if possible.
author: Johanna F.

description:
There are so many of these places lined up in a row that it's difficult to know which one to choose. I guess that's what Yelp is for. We just kind of wandered in to Nick's Lighthouse and my first impression was that it was cramped and the decor is kind of silly. There's plastic bunches of grapes everywhere and some aviation stuff... it seemed like there was no real theme.  

We sat in a booth, which I quickly discovered had a posture-correcting back cushion. Not intentionally, I'm sure, but the small booths and firm cushions don't allow for any slumping so don't get too full.

I ordered the Boston Clam Chowder, which was thick, had plenty of clams and big chunks of potato. The green salad with dungeness crab was basic as far as salads go but the crab was so fresh and delicious that the salad didn't need dressing.

Service was fine but seemed to pick up once the check was dropped at our table - one of my pet peeves.

The food would be a 4 or 5 for me but the interior, the mediocre service, and the carnival barker trying to lure people into the place bump it down. With the amount of tourist business this place probably sees, I don't imagine any of that will change.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Went to nicks tonight. Place was packed, we were seated quickly, staff friendly. First negative- the booth was so tiny that the table was pressing on our tummies. Sourdough came w dinner- just ok. We ordered oysters on the half shell-good. The clam chowder was excellent. My bf ordered fried sampler- was disappointed that it was mostly calamari. I ordered fried prawns-good.  Over all food and service were good. 

Side note, i went to use restroom after dinner. It was like going to a third world country. Could not even use it!
author: Shawn G.

description:
DELICIOUS DUNGEONNESS CRAB!!!

I love this place. You wait outside and order with the person that you want a dungeonness crab, and you can watch the worker in the booth next to him (same company) steam him and prepare him for you. You can also ask for butter to slather on the crab. I eat it right there on the tiny counter space so that its fresh. There are seating options elsewhere but we wanted to devour our crab immediately. 

OMGASM. such delicious dungeonness crab!! and this is my favourite type of seafood in the world. I highly highly recommend coming here and trying their dungeonness crab! I love the quickness and speediness and freshness of the whole operation. 

It does run a bit pricey though. We paid around $34 for our krabby. :\ But I don't think you can find prices lower than this (unless you visit NYC Flushing Asian supermarkets). Good place to go if you're a tourist or even if you're just in the area craving for some  crab!
author: Christine L.

description: Picked this little gem randomly of the many restaurants on the wharf to eat and wasn't the least bit disappointed. My BF and I were talked our way in by the guys at the front by letting us pick our crab for $35 with salad and bread. The service was quick, the food was fresh and delicious and our server (I think I remember his name was Billy Ray) was super attentive and friendly.   We had to move to another table during our visit, but they gave us complementary fried calamari for being understanding. I would pick this place ANY DAY over any of the "fancy" restaurants like Fog Harbor... The overall experience was much better!
author: Sam S.

description:
My friends and I walked from Pier 1 to past Pier 39 to find this great place. There were a bunch of seafood stands but for some reason why place jumped out. 

We came up, the four of us girls, ordered one crab and the guy chopped away, steamed and it came out smelling soo good. Came up to pay, it was around $12 so so. We stood there, the four of us girls, eating away on the side street like there's no tomorrow. It was so juicy and delicious. Finished that thing in 7 minutes or so. 

Still hungry of course, walked to the other stands but nothing captured us so we came back and ordered another crab, an ordered of fried shrimps, and a bread bowl of chowder. 

This place is pretty great if you're looking for a casual good seafood place that won't burn your wallet like other seafood restaurants.
author: Nikki N.

description:
I legitimately feel like this restaurant and all of Pier 39 is a tourist trap... 

Although this is one of the few restaurants at the pier which can seat you and accommodate large groups (for example my party of 8), I still feel that San Francisco still has much more to offer. I honestly would not have come here if it weren't for the fact that my family wanted to eat that fresh San Francisco crab...We got the chowder, some crabs + scallops, ravioli. Not entirely sure on the exact dishes but they all kind of blend together anyway.

Anyway, my verdict. The food here is too salty, slow service, very small space. Not good for groups, better for small dates. But when possible, make a reservation for something slightly more expensive yet more worth your money. Two stars not because it was a terrible experience, but because in SF, I have more options before I resort to this one.
author: Jolene L.

description: Whether you are a bay area native, or a tourist to SF, you must come here once! This is a must try, and is really delicious! I don't care to sit inisde, just grab the food from counter and sit outside and enjoy the bay! I love the clam chowder! Delicious!
author: Andrew M.

description:
The food was okay, however if your right here on fishermans wharf and you wanna load up on calories from a bread bowl, you'll probably want to go else where.
Its a sub par bread bowl and in about four spoonfuls you'll be hitting bread bowl bottom.
Our waitress was very subdued, which ironically worked because the table across of us was an older over privellaged man who was being an ass to his waiter, then across of us were a group of middle aged giggle bag women who wanted dressing on the side of there salad, but all shared the deep fried ginormous seafood platter, (yeah, i know) so it was nice that our waitress wasnt over the top fake and toned it down a little.
author: Ella A.

description: Worst service they're could be. I was ignored & treated like my business was no good. Plus the chef Javier disrespected me & tried to say that I could not afford the food from his restaurant. Also I tried to speak to their manager Francis & I was told that I would just be a waste of time to him. Overall they're employees lacked any kind of professionalism they thought they had what so ever. I'll never eat there again.
author: Cesar G.

description:
I have to say that had we gotten the male waiter, they could have gotten a 4 or 5 stars.  However, our waitress was not as friendly.  We came in because we say the crabs outside and wanted to dine there.  The booth sitting is extremely uncomfortable.  Really made for only skinny people.  We weren't big people but it was tight.  I felt like I was in grade school and had to sit straight and high.  

I ordered 1/2 dozen oysters.  They were pretty good.  I would have like them a little more chilled. They were not cold but warm.  Made me worry but I didn't get sick so that's a plus.   We also ordered the garlic crab which was pretty good.  Nothing super special but when in SF, we had to get some seafood.  We also ordered the claim chowder which was good.  The lobster bisque was a bit salty.  

Overall, we had a good time amongst ourselves and our waitress seldom came by to check in on us.  I would give the place 2 stars but it would be unfair to the chef.
author: Dominique T.

description:
We ended up at Nick's Lighthouse by being flagged inside by a guy on the sidewalk trying to drum up business. It was lunch time and kind of crowded, but that was fine.  

I will preface my review by saying I HATE SEAFOOD! It was the other 5 people in my party that made me eat here and I could not protest being at Fisherman's Wharf! :)  Therefore, I ordered a kids grilled cheese and fries and it was fine. My husband had linguine and clams that he said was good, and the lobster bisque was good too. Nothing special, but not bad in his opinion.

Service was alright. She was kind of awkward and didn't appear too familiar with things, but she muddled through. We would definitely try another restaurant on our next visit.
author: Kursten O.

description: Food wasn't too shabby, although there are much more place nearby that are way better. Expected the clam chowder to be good as like most chowders in San Fran, but this one was quiet "unique". The shrimp cocktail would've been better if they didnt serve bay shrimp which was not mention. Overall you could've got a better deal from in-n-out across the corner
author: David E.

description: Stopped by the outdoor kiosk for a quick seafood treat! They have a great selection of seafood sandwiches, seafood cocktails and chowder. They also had decent beers in the can... They even put your beer in a paper bag so you can properly enjoy it on the waterfront with the street performers and seagulls! I has the shrimp and crab cocktail which was generously stuffed with yummy fresh seafood! My BF had the chowder bowl and loved it!
author: Christina M.

description:
First of all, if the over-excited young spokesperson for Nick's out front with the live lobster in hand thinks people come into the restaurant because HE draws them in, he is SADLY mistaken. He is cheesy and too pushy, as all the restaurant front-of-house people in that area are. Are they making commission or something?? Anyways my friend and I only went in because the menu appealed to us the best out of the rest on that strip at the time. 

We both got a lunch special Fish n Chips, with clam chowder. The chowder is really good I must say; I like my chowders to be thick, not watery, so if Nick's keeps up the consistency with the clam chowder I will be back for more and more. The Fish was standard but not horrible, fries good of course. Tarter sauce was yuummmm for dayssss, sonnn. ok, not that dramatic-worthy but still good because some places are so bleh with the tartar sauce.

Now on to why I'm giving two stars: naturally, because of the service. Our waitress was the nonchalant, boring, uninterested person who really didn't seem to like her job. I am SO SICK of being served by people like that. Here it is I can't find a good job as a waiter because I don't "have the 3+ years experience" on paper, yet alot of these "good" restaurants give the very crappy waitstaff a chance just because they have the "experience". It pisses me off. Our waitress never came back to our table during the meal, PASSED BY US LOOKING at us but did not stop at our table to check on us (she was not busy. At all. The other tables she had she halfway tended to as well them disappeared somewhere), and gave me short, snippy attitude-like answers when I asked a few questions in beginning. Had to flag her down for more drink.

The look of the restaurant is no where near superb, then again it's Fisherman's Wharf do you expect to sit in plush cotton or silk booths??  

I may only return because of lunch specials and clam chowder, but really should not return because of their stupid rules about not sharing (some $10 min order, then $2 if you SHARE an entree?? Tf?!).. I definitely was not about to leave waitress any tip and I'm still a little annoyed my overly-nice friend left one even though he agreed with me. 

P.S. - I will still continue to look for top notch restaurant work I need to prove that with a little training and repetition I would be a much better service employee than half these ungrateful brats out there.
author: Marquis A.

description: The crab chowder is pretty good. Ask for a sample! More exciting than "boring old clam chowder" lol. The only downside is the price, $9 for a pint! But it's expected being in this touristy part of town.
author: Monica B.

description:
Nick's is the one place that we always go when we are in San Francisco. Food quality is excellent. The staff here is the best and will do anything to make sure your visit is great. 
Nick's is a special place for my family. The first time we were here our flight got delayed, and every place on the wharf was closed or closing. Nick's took us in and served us dinner when they found out that it was my daughters birthday they brought her out a piece of cheesecake and all the staff sang to her.
author: Marie B.

description: I love being able to see the crab boiling in front of me when I go here. Even better when you order with garlic butter & a side of clam chowder.
