Can't leave San Francisco without stopping here first even though they can get pretty busy with all the tourists, I think it's worth the wait (which for me has never been long)
author: Jazveline D.

description: All these one star reviews baffle me.  I had the best Clam Chowder here.  My wife had crab and it was great too.  The bread was fresh and delicious.  People complaining about price in a tourist trap location seem naive.  The place is dumpy but who cares.  Will eat here again for sure.
author: Scott S.

description: Bad service!! The woman on the front was not helpful at all. She even rolled her eyes when we asked for a bag since we ordered to go. the food is horrible! I wont even give any stars here! Don't come here. Save yourself from disappointment!
author: Ian S.

description:
Dropped in here after a day of touring up the piers along the Embarcadero.  Inside it is modestly sized, but has a very warm inviting and relaxinh atmosphere.  Service was exceptionally friendly and prompt.
Ordered Dinner, which came with soup or salad, we opted for the clam chowder, and we both enjoyed it.  It was appropriately seasoned and we'll balanced, being neither bland nor too salty.
We like seafood, especially chilled, so we started with the full dozen blue tip oysters.  They were fresh and met all expectations.  
For the main course we ordered  the full crab and the chilled seafood platter.  The full crab was beyond excellent, and the crab legs, calamari, prawns, and clams on the platter were very fresh and the items which were seasoned such as the Calamari were done so very moderatley and lightly, which I prefer.
As far as a seafood restaurant, I think this is a pretty good place.  The food and service was excellent for the price, everything met or exceeded expectations.  I notice some of the reviews are very negative, but that was not our experience at all.  If you want to enjoy straight traditional seafood that is very fresh and tasty this place should meet with your expectations.
author: Benjamin E.

description:
As I walked down Fisherman's Wharf, in awe of all the fresh crab and moving lobsters for display.. I was having trouble deciding which stand to have a crab from. But then I remembered my friend was here a few weeks ago and she had a bomb crab that looked sooo yummy! I knew I had to have it. So I had to find out where she got it from.. One thing lead to another and I ended up at nick's lighthouse. My bf and I got to Fisherman's wharf a little late so it was a little too dark to eat out in the streets.. So we decided to go into their restaurant and eat. The place was small but their food is what matters. And their crab was just amazing! The crab was packed with meat and each piece was just so plump and juicy sweet! The bf and I like normal ordered with our eyes... We have been saving our stomach for a crab from Fisherman's wharf for quit sometime now. So we when finally were here we each wanted our own! (Bad idea) it was too much! I couldn't finish mine but oh well.. It was so worth it! 

I got the Dungeness Crab cooked in a Spicy Garlic Sauce. The crab was just cooked the right amount where they did not dry out the meat at all.. I didn't even touch the side of butter they gave us because the meat itself was just so sweet and flavorful. The spicy garlic sauce made it just perfect! It did not overpower the crab where I could still taste the sweetness of the crab meat which was so great! I let my bf try it and he loved it! He ordered the regular Dungeness Crab but steamed only. He was in heaven! He loved it! But he did say he liked mine more and that he should have just ordered what I had. But it's okay, he loved his steamed crab as well. Next time, we are definitely going to share! 

**Come here if you are looking for a steam crab cooked in spicy garlic sauce**
** sit inside, it's just so much cleaner and nicer than eating in the streets ** 
** get your ticket validated so you don't have to pay for parking! **
author: Lynn T.

description:
Clam Chowder tasted like CANNED soup, lacked the thick/creamy texture I was looking for. 

Bloody Mary also tasted like PRE-MADE (lacked spiciness)!

Lobster bisque was too pureed/runny, missing the lobster chunks, and/or the creamy-ness. 

Spicy Garlic Crab looked like "house special" crab (if you're chinese/vietnamese, you'd know what I mean), this dish was surprisingly decent. Later the waitress came by and told us that she had requested for the chef to make it mild!?!? What the heck? I ordered this dish mainly because it had the word "SPICY" in it. I like to spicy food, so I thought I try something different then the usual crab dipping in melted butter. A bit disappointing. I would have enjoyed it a lot more if this dish was actually spicy!
author: Juliee D.

description:
In one word - DISAPPOINTING.

($7.75) Three Crab Cakes - IMITATION CRAB!!!
($5.75) Lobster Bisque Bread Bowl  - NO LOBSTER FLAVOR!!! Tastes only like creamy tomato soup.
author: Donald P.

description:
Not a fan of this place.  The only reason why we came in was because there was a mob of people outside grabbing crab from the stands.  If it wasn't cold outside, I would have been ok with waiting in line for the stands but we came in here. 

Not a Fan.

Dinner:

Crab Bisque Bowl- Where's the crab? Felt like I ordered a corn chowder.... Not cool

Fish and chips-  Extremely greasy and no flavor.  The fries was the best part.

Spicy Garlic Crab (half order) -  I got like two legs. Where is the rest of my crab?!?  well I tasted the garlic but no spice.  

The meal was a huge disappointment.  I highly recommend not coming here.  Over price for barely any seafood.  We went back to the stands :)
author: Ying F.

description: Crab chowder was great! Wished it had a little more chunks of crab, it was more of a purée but it was still delicious! Also got a bay shrimp/crab salad which was nice and refreshing! Great place to go to get your seafood fix when you're at the warf! Cute little Italian feel on the inside too.
author: Alexandra F.

description:
Went to Nick's Lighthouse with some friends from California - Ida H and Joe K are both YELPERS and Ida's sister Bonnie.  3 other women from Michigan went with us.  One of my friends wanted Crab Legs - the ones from Maine, but this was California and they had Dungenous Crabs which have the short legs!  She was a little disappointed about this, but oh well, what are you going to do????

Anyway, ordered some Lobster Bisque, which did not have any chunks of lobster in it - I've always had lobster chunks in my Lobster Bisque, so we complained to the waiter and he accommodated us with some crab soup which did have chunks of crab and it was delicious!  The food was good, the company was awesome!  

Would I go back?  Probably not because there are just too many restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf!!!!
author: Debbie Z.

description:
I've been dining in here for a few years now but tonight was different. 

I ordered some Fish & Chips and my girlfriend ordered some Shrimp Alfredo. For some reason when our waitress served the Fish & Chips it was really dry. I ask another waiter to take my fish & chips because I won't eat it and to take it off my tab. 

Our waitress comes back all pissed off and told us "we should have talked to the manager." Manager comes back and said he can't do anything about taking off the Fish & Chips. I barely touched it.

Oh well, it was good while it lasted coming here but never again coming back here ever.
author: Francis C.

description:
Your local Whole Foods has better lobster bisque for 7.99 for enough to serve 4... if you don't believe me, meet me in San Jose and I'll prove you wrong.

The people who are working at the stands will try to sucker you in. If you're buying seafood at the stand, it doesn't really get any better than that so go ahead and buy all the crab and cherry stone clams you can bring home, but why would you pay really good money to sit in a shack with your friend(s) and ovehear some really disturbing conversation between the waiter(s) whilst being served fresh seafood which is actually partially prepared at said stands?

While I was having dinner I overheard a guy talking about motorboating a chick named Ginger, complaining about his cell phone bill, and some other nonsense which I don't care to mention

Price is actually the same as the other restaurants on Pier 39.... so you can get off the public transport sooner and eat at a table that gives you room to stretch without punching the guy 2 tables down.

The crab is good. Get the crab. Cherry stone clams are good. But I mean... they're served raw so credit goes to the clams.

I had a 20 dollar linguine with bits of dungie crab in it... ehh.. I'm still burping up the taste of butter at 3AM.

I had fun though thankfully I was among good friends
author: Christopher T.

description: Guys. The crab chowder is not worth the hype. You can barely taste the crab in the soup and it's not filling. Crab cakes, on the other hand, is delicious.
author: Nicole Q.

description: My friend and I got an order of the raw oysters and I did not think it was that good. It didn't taste that fresh and the server was not that nice either when we told her that we only wanted to order some oysters. Didn't get to try there other food, but I don't think I would be back there again.
author: Trüc T.

description: Delicious lobster bisque, garlic fries and butter rice!!!! I had to call for the staff a few times so service was average, cleanliness wasn't the best, place looks a little run down but all part of the vibe, family friendly
author: Grace S.

description: Esteban was wonderful and very helpful, despite how busy it was he shown pure attentiveness to our table. I love crab cakes and I was quite pleased with my order. The trout was quite surprising as well because I expected both plates to be over cooked and dry. Of course one can never go wrong with an appetizer platter of calamari and garlic fries =)
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
This restaurant was dirty, dingy, cramped and awful.  We were seated at a booth right by the bar, where apparently, the employees eat and speak loudly to the man doing the books at the other side of the counter.  It was distracting and rude and we felt boxed in by the employee sitting there.  I could hear the man behind the bar complaining to the on break employee that business was slow and he wasn't making any money.  Not really something to be talking about with customers in earshot.

I ordered the Crab and shrimp stuffed caneloni and my husband ordered the smoked salmon linguini.  While waiting for our meal we had a cup of lobster bisque with sourdough bread.  The bread was blackened/burnt.  The soup was super salty and tasted like it came from a can.  I did not detect any lobster in my soup.  I've made lobster bisque and I can attest this soup was not homemade or fresh.

While waiting for our meal I noticed the lights and grapes on the ceiling had layers of dust caked on them, the wooden walls were filthy and peeling, the booths were dirty and torn and the cramped tiny restaurant had a dingy smell of filth.  When was the last time anyone cleaned the carpets or dusted? Yuck.

Our food came out suspiciously quick, as if it had been premade and sitting under a warmer.  My cannellonis looked delicious, but tasted like nothing.  There was no seasoning at all, the two small cannellonis were bland.  One bite tasted like rotten food, so I spit it out.  Disgusting.  There was a side of broccoli which also had no seasoning whatsoever.

My husband's salmon linguini had more flavor, thanks to the salmon.  It was more edible than mine but was definitely not memorable and not worth the price.  I only ate one bite of my food but my waitress didn't even bother to ask if I liked my food.

Awful place that I would not waste my time/money on again.  Just thinking about the experience makes me lose my appetite.  I had high hopes for Nick's, but next time, I'll be smart and go get some yummy Boudin.  They are clean and I've never been disappointed with their fresh, savory food.
author: Lora P.

description:
Great crab sandwiches - did not have too much mayo  :)  
Service was excellent as well. Very casual dining.
author: Alan N.

description:
This place was okay. My aunts were walking by and the workers there pulled them in, and in they went.. I was walking in a different direction so I didn't even know until they already got sat. When I sat down and checked Yelp, I wanted to leave right away but we had a party of 15.. and it's a bit difficult to get all 15 to leave.. so we stayed and ordered.

We got sat at 2 different tables next to each other. The restaurant was very small so we were ALL cramped in there. Very uncomfortable. 

Here was what my table ordered:
Calamari was okay. Tiny portions..
Clam Chowder - ehh! not impressed. 
2 crabs - came not hot!! it seemed like it was sitting there for a while. 

We didn't order much because we wanted to save our appetite to eat somewhere else. 
I was soo depressed after eating here. Should have just ate at the other crab stands outside the restaurants. TOTAL FAIL.
author: Thuy L.

description:
Pretty tasty food. But they really need to work on their customer service. Me and my bf were walking around fishermans wharf looking for food when this place caught my eye. Because out of all the other seafood places, this one looked the most fresh. 
 Anyways, I wanted lobster and all they had were the big ones so we ended up choosing that one. We were just gonna eat outside but seeing the restaurant is connected and it would be less messy, we decided to eat our order inside. We had a older server (a Filipino old man) who wrote down the lobster and half dozen oysters we ordered. He gave us bread and soup, but forgot about our waters. So we asked the busboy for water and he gave us attitude. 
 Our waiter was not there helping us out the majority of time, the only thing he really did was give us soup and the food. He didn't check up on us and wasn't the friendliest. After we finished our food, we asked for our check. 
 The check came to a total of 215.00 for the lobster and etc. No big deal because it's San Francisco and when you're eating at a tourist attraction, of course it'll be much pricier. However, we saw on the second receipt a service charge of 28.00 was written which I guess was the tip he wanted us to give him. I was not going to give this man that much tip. He didn't provide the best service and was expecting to be given that much tip for giving us bread and soup. I at least gave him a four dollar tip for bringing the soup to us. He stood there and didn't want us to leave. He kept on telling us that's the service charge. But the thing is, we didn't know there was going to be a service charge and he definitely did not deserve the tip! So we kept on telling him that was all we were going to give and he sighed really loud letting us know he's annoyed and walked away. 
 WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. Like I said before, If he was there the majority of the time we were eating to make sure we were doing okay, then yeah I would give him that tip. But, he didn't do anything really and was expecting the tip to be handed to him. I'm pretty sure that's not the way it works here. The food is good, the service is HORRIBLE, and they definitely need to work on the layout too. They're trying to be a high class restaurant by the wharf, but the inside of the restaurant was not the cleanest and their servers are definitely sketchy. Lesson of the day is always make sure you check the receipt so they don't charge you something without telling you.
author: Karebear W.

description:
Delicious. Don't eat a crab standing up;  it'll take a while and your legs will get tired.

The oysters were worth it! Got ten and ate them real fast! Considering the size; It was worth itt
author: James L.

description:
Im going to make this review short and sweet.

Crab Chowder in a bread bowl was ok.  There was too much corn in it, and not much crab.

Calamari and fries, was crispy.  It made the amount of money I spent not go to waste.

The left over bread you have from the crab chowder, you can give to the birds at the dock.  They love the bread and they will love u for it.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I always eat on the grotto over on fisherman's grotto whenever I pay a visit to one of the biggest tourist spots at home in San Francisco. I've never been in one of the restaurants, but i love grabbing some oysters and some lobster bisque outside!

I don't mind standing there and eating everything by hand, I show all my friends who come to visit the beautiful bay area how fun and tasty everything is when you stand and eat right outside where you can smell the bay where all our food was caught.

Something to try: Raw clams on the shells!

Been coming here for years now...and no matter how long i'm away from home I always come back to say Hi.

PS. I tried half clam chowder and half lobster bisque once...interesting mix, if you're adventurous go for it!
author: Janelle H.

description:
I was in the mood for clam chowder & crab.  Nick's Lighthouse seemed to be a busy walk up restaurant.  We figured since it was right off the bay and had fresh crab out on display, we'd take our chances.  We were very disappointed with our $89 meal :( . We asked the waiter what did he recommend here and he told us "CLAM CHOWDER!"  Sorry to say but Campbell's soup makes better clam chowder.  I ordered the spicy cracked crab and it tasted as if it was just doused in Tabasco... No flavor at all... But the Tabasco was very overwhelming.  Even though T he waiters were very sweet, it's not a place that I would recommend to any tourist.
We only took 2 bites of our food and we were done.  Not good at all. I felt like would could have gone across the street to "Joe's Crab-shack" and would have been somewhat satisfied with our meal.  My Hunni said the only thing that was tasty at Nick's was the glass of Coke he drank.
Waste of money.
author: Le M.

description:
Our server was great and really nice.

The food was pretty bland. Nothing exciting. The restaurant is also very small and hard to get around. I ran into someone and had to wait til I had an opening to leave.
author: Laura W.

description:
Good service 5/5. Good location .. I guess 5/5
The only thing I didnt like was the taste. I got bread bowl clam chowder, and it was too much of potato taste. I wish they added more of other ingredients and less of potatoes.
author: Yumi K.

description:
We parked right across the street which included Free Parking for 3 hours IF you dine at the Fisherman Wharf's restaurants or Free 1 hour parking for eating at a crabstand. We were thinking, oh what a deal...

Well, not really. The restaurants have a minimum of how much you have to spend in order to validate your tix. All we wanted was to eat some clam chowder soup and we had already spent over an hour walking along Pier 39. So, we decided to eat here at Nick's. 

Food: The clam chowder soup bread bowl is smaller than Sabella's (next dor), but had more veggies. The soup was still so-so. I ordered a Calamari pasta which was actually pretty good. Plenty of calamari pieces and the sauce was tomato based which was tasty. The garlic fries had real garlic and was average. 

The service was average and so was the food. Next time, I'll just grab a bowl of soup from a crabstand and park elsewhere.
author: Wana L.

description: Don't bother.  There are reasons why the restaurants surrounding this place are busy while it remains fairly vacant.  Service was so bad I could not get served and had to walk out.  I have no idea how the food is, because no one came to my table after 15 mins. And this was at 7:45 on a weeknight when only two other couples were there.  Poor service -- even for the wharf area.
author: Erick R.

description: My friend and I wen to Nick Lighthouse today for lunch. The waiter was nice. The food were tasty. I had clam chowder with spicy shrimp pasta and my friend had salad with bay shrimp scallop pasta. Mine was good. The shrimp were big. But my friend bay shrimp and scallop were really small. And my friend thought her pasta was a little bit hard. My pasta was soft.
author: Ruilin Y.

description:
Me and my cousin wandered into Nick's because the daily specials caught our eye.  Not to mention it was freezing cold outside and it was a better alternative than getting something from one of the food carts and standing outside.

I ordered the fish and chips special and my cousin ordered a scallop and shrimp pasta dish.  I have to say that the fish and chips were delicious!  None of that icky thick batter that always ends up getting soggy.  Portion size was also pretty good.

My cousin's pasta dish was okay, the scallops were a bit overcooked and chewy and it was a bit overpriced.  Could be the reason why she recommended it instead of the special which was cheaper. Who knows.

But overall I enjoyed my fish and chips, it's basically similar to what they serve outside on the food carts but we ate it inside instead.  But like most SF restaurants, it was pretty small and cramped inside but service was fast and we were in and out fairly quickly.
author: Heidi L.

description: Everything was great! Our server was funny and on top of it. Fish and chips was great, hamburger was great. Fried oysters pro boy was ok, not amazing. Overall if you're on Fisherman's Wharf stop by for a drink. We weren't blown away by the clam chowder, but the fact that they serve both Coke and Mr. Pibb was a big hit with the guys.
author: Annette P.

description: The clam chowder was terrible. The dungeoness crabs were good but way overpriced.
author: Mala H.

description: I would give zero stars if possible. Everyone's meal was inedible. Everyone order either the clam chowder of lobster bisque. I had the lobster bisque, it tasted like canned ravioli sauce with a dozen packages of salt thrown in. I didnt get a single piece of lobster and couldnt choke down any more despite being extremely hungry. The clam chowder had clumps of flour and spoiled potatoes in it, not creamy whatsoever and didnt have any meat in it either. This is a huge tourist trap. The waiters are extremely hard to understand and neglect you. The place is extremely cramped and messy.
author: Erica B.

description: Ordered the steamed dungeness crab outside at the cart and sat at the bar and they even brought it to me.  Also ordered an anchor steam for 4.50.  The restaurant was pretty busy the night I came, I guess I got lucky to find a seat at the 3-seat bar.  The crab was excellent and I'd recommend to come here for this one dish.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
The service always perfect! 
My husband has been going here since he was a weeee young one! 
The sourdough, and dinner salad just a perfect beginning! 
We get a dozen oysters in half shell too(to go with my merlo and his Anchor Steam). 
We come here every chance we get! A must stop when in the city! 
If there's a wait to get it, get a snack out front! You can watch them cracking fresh crab, oysters clams, all that and suck down a few! 
We always get the linguine with dungeness crab sauce. You can choose tomato or Alfredo sauce. We get tomato, its light and let's you really taste all that crab!!! Oh, and it goes so well with the wine! 
One day we may get that Imperial platter !
author: Kathy B.

description:
Stopped for dinner upon arrival to San Francisco, totally at random since I considered all the other places next to it.

The place is so cool! Nice decor, view of docked fishing boats on the pier where the restaurant sits, the booths are a bit cramped so NBA players allowed. JK

Our food was delicious! I would certainly come back again on my next trip to San Francisco.

Oh! and the kiosks outside from each restaurant? Including Nick's? If you are ever on such a hurry that you can't sit your butt down then by all means! Get your food on the run but if I ever see you eating clam chowder on a sour dough bread bowl running about, we are gonna talk about time management and relaxation techniques, bud!
author: Tones T.

description:
Unfortunately I have to give this place a single star. I would love to give this place a better rating, but I would be doing all my fellow yelpers a disservice.  

I was a little hesitant to dine here because, in the beginning, there are men in front of the restaurant saying, "table for two; we have one more table left," when clearly there are multiple tables available. 

We started with half a dozen of raw oysters which were alright. I ordered the steamed Manila clams and my friend ordered a fettuccine dish with calamari, scallops and shrimp (I believe that was all). Our server said that my Manila clams would be in a buttery, white wine sauce which is supposed to be "really good!". Both dishes came out in a red tomato-y sauce. I tasted both sauces and they were exactly the same! The one and only difference was that mine was a bit saltier, even after my friend added salt and pepper to our watered down tomato based sauce. My friend's, though it was pasta, came out with sauce that resembled soup. I probably should have said something because we both HATED our dishes. It was bland and bland. Cant believe my server lied.. :( And expensive. Both were more than $20. We were totally better off heading to Joe's Crab Shack. 

I wanted to like this dinky little place, but with food (and service) like that I can't. 

P.s.
The couple behind us were ballsy enough to say something. I couldn't because I, well, wasn't ballsy enough. I hate to complain about food people take pride in. Honestly, save yourself the money and time. Just don't. Restaurant impossible needs to hit this place up!
author: Janine S.

description: Remember how I said it was not crispy .. Scratch that! Justin and Maria re ordered the crispy calamari and garlic fries for me!! Thank you!! Very good stuff!!
author: Ramona D.

description: I'm not local, I happened to pass by the strip of lobster/crabs restaurant and ordered calamari with fries to complement my lobster roll. Food is not fresh at all. Fries r hard, calamari is so powdery. No good at all. Tried the crab chowder, no good either. I would not recommend
author: Mii H.

description: Big fan of this place... I have been to the kiosk a few times, this was my first time inside and I think the Clam Chowder is the best I have tried in the area.
author: Frank C.

description: Poor service. We got no water from the time we sat down to the time we left the place. Their crab chowder is mediocre. Overpriced.
author: Thanh T.

description:
First time trying San Francisco street food. Ordered the Crab Chowder, fish and calamari with garlic fries. $24.
 

Kinda pricey but the order takers were straight up hood guys. Lol they were chill and polite though. I'm all down for that.
author: Paul L.

description:
I come to this place and order the best pasta dish I have ever had on fishermans warft. They have a morning special with spicy linguine and large prawns. This is by far one dish I will forever crave when I'm in the mode for seafood. 
I wish there clam cowder was a littler better, hence the four stars. But for being such a small place I give them so much credit. 
Their bread is decent, the portions are perfect and the service here is great. The prices are very decent compared to what you would be paying at the surrounding restaurants.
author: Melody C.

description:
Pros: 

Fast service. 
They accommodate strollers even though the place is really small. 

Cons: 

- We got the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl and Cioppino (which came with a cup of lobster bisque). We got two dishes and our bill ran nearly $50. It was way overpriced.
- Everything was really salty especially the Cioppino.
- The clam chowder tasted like something right out of the Campbell soup can. I think honestly that the Campbell soup can probably had more clams than this one did.. Same goes for the Lobster Bisque. 
- The Cioppino was so small in portion, we couldn't believe it. 

Overall: I came out really disappointed and dismayed that I took some guests here to this restaurant to show what Pier 39 clam chowder was all about..
author: Liz W.

description: We had a good experience here before so thought we would stop in for dinner.  1st ordered jumbo shrimp cocktail got bay shrimp ok no big deal.  Also got crab cakes they were good. I am not a big seafood fan,but my husband is. He ordered the fettuccini with calamari and fresh tomato sauce. I knew better (being in a sea food place) but ordered chicken parmesan.  They brought my husbands entree and then we waited and waited my entree did not come out  my husband began eating 10 min later the waiter said my entree would be out soon.  My husband pretty much fininished his entree when mine was served and what a dissapointment mine was.  A frozen breaded chicken patty with tomato sauce and melted cheese.  Again my bad who orders chicken parm at a seafood rest.  I would not have an issue with the mediocre  chicken parm were we able to eat our meal together eating in shifts sucked as this was my husbands birthday dinner. Oh well live and learn. When in a seafood joint order seafood.  We complained about the timing and were told not the waiters issue but the kitchen. In their defense they asked what they could do to make it right  I declined told them just wanted ti voice my dissatisfaction.  I am pretty sure we wont be back
author: C S.

description: Great place. Waiter was very nice to us and helped us wit decision about the dish. We never had seafood and he gently recommended us what we should try and how to eat it :) steamed clams were delicious.
author: Szymon G.

description:
2 stars because it's very touristy, so it's not the best food the city has to offer (swan or anchor has better oysters, for example); nothing special about the clam chowder, or the fried calamari, or the crab. 

still an ok place to take out of town friends if you don't want to get back to your car to drive to anchor over in castro.

service just sucks, they kept on showing everyone they have big ass 3 lb lobsters, but who cares? they kept on taking them out of the tank back and forth;  if i dont get headaches from this crap, i'm sure the lobsters will. but this is not why service sucks, it's cuz of the usual suspects like slow ordering service, food did not come out quick (took about over 10 minutes to shuck 12 oysters? gimme a break), slow water refills, they also put the side of cocktail sauce on the slanted edge of the plate, so that some of it spills all over the place (attention to detail not there).

i rather just go to anchor oyster bar
author: Jacky K C.

description:
Don't be fooled by its location...save your money! My boyfriend and I were visiting SF last weekend and made the wrong assumption that every place on Fishermans Wharf would be good. Boy were we wrong. It was the worst, and I repeat WORST clam chowder I have ever had. It tasted like it came straight out of a can. My boyfriend got the fried oyster sandwich which was just eh. We've had much better. And the meal wasn't cheap either.

If you want great seafood go to Hog Island Oyster in the Ferry Building. The oysters and clam chowder are SO FRESH and delicious!!!
author: Tyler S.

description:
I had a terrible experience the last time but was great before that, So I tried it again and Angel was our waitress, she knocked it out of the park, she is a great server, the bartender also nailed my Vodka Collins perfect,  the fish and chips was a little over cooked but the coleslaw is the bomb, I am glad to say I will be back next time Im in SF.
Greg
author: Greg H.

description: Pricing is not bad for this joint.  Awesome lobster bisque, awesome garlic fries, & delicious shrimp. Very yummy indeed.
author: Francisco S.

description:
I feel like I wasted another good meal somewhere in San Francisco :(, but it was around 2 pm and we hadn't even had breakfast, we were desperate! 

My claustrophobia defenitly came out at this place, it was super dupper tiny, I almost didn't fit in the booth.  I ordered their lunch special which was the Alfredo shimp pasta with a salad.  The dressing was homemade and DELICIOUS, but I was not impressed with thier pasta.  RedLobster's pasta is 20 times better than this one, but I was hungry and I ate it all.  

Customer service by our waitress was ehh okay.  I asked her for a glass of water and she never came back with it... in fact she never came back again.  I had to ask another waitress.  

Bah... I'm just sad that I missed out eating somewhere worthwhile!  Live and Learn :).
author: A M.

description: Been here years ago when the place was not cramped! Otherwise the crab chowder was off da chain! Garlic fries were a little salty but still good
author: Lisa H.

description:
My wife & I don't understand why this place doesn't have an overall rating of 4.

The service, half crab in spicy garlic sauce, and crab sandwich were great. 

Yes, the place is rather old but that's what adds to the experience. 

A definite do when at the wharf!
author: Hector M.

description:
Nicks Lighthouse, San Francisco, CA
contributes by Bradley Burkett

Bradley's bucket list includes Nick's Lighthouse in San Francisco.

"One my all-time favorite restaurants is Nick's on the Warf on pier 39.
About 25 years ago I stumbled across it with an old friend one night.
We just wanted some great fresh crab. What we found was so much more.

Walking through the fog past all the vendors and the smell of the sea we walked into Nick's with no expectation other than hunger for crab. We ordered a couple Caesar salads, Lobster Bisque and fresh Whole Crab with a bevy of butter to dip into on the side. There is nothing like chewy crusty sour dough bread, slathered with a little butter, paired with the briny sweetness of Dungeness crab with a spritz of lemon on it.    They boil crab continuously and it smells great as you approach the restaurant.  
The sautéed filet of sole is my absolute favorite preparation:  capers, butter and lemon - the sour tartness with the fresh fish would be one of my favorite tastes.

Keep in mind Mark and I had worked together for over 10 years opening up restaurant's throughout the country. This was and is one of the best meals I have ever eaten. Great attentive unpretentious service, not a 5 star restaurant though a 5 star experience with a good friend, that's all you need.

Since then I have introduced countless friends and family to a small jewel in San Francisco.
I look forward to my next visit and will continue to... "
 

The environs:  great walking area just don't trip on the tacky tourists - this spot has authentic roots even though its surrounded by tackfest.  Great to walk along the wharf.  Best to get there on foot on bike.  Parking will run almost $40 for the day.  Cutest place to stay in the Wharf area is the Kimpton Argonaut hotel.  Charming and stylish in a sea of corporate sameness.  My favorite time to visit the wharf is before Easter.  The area blooms with an amazing display of tulips, all along the water.  I used to make a special trip down on my bike after work to view these beauties with the backdrop of the bay and the bridge, fresh air blowing in my face.  Two more favorite to do's in the area:  visit the gorgeous frog and mermaid sculpture in Ghirardelli Square one of my mother and grand mothers favorites, and stop in and see the chocolate making process in the Ghirardelli restaurant.  Smell the giant vat of chocolate being "conched" (refined).
author: Bradley B.

description:
being a seattlite - i can't honestly say that anything from nick's lighthouse is "spectacular" its seafood... kinda difficult to mess anything up when all you have to do is toss it in a steamer, boiler, oven and serve it with butter and lemons. 
and yes i know its seafood - and yes i know its SF bay - and yes i know its right smack dab in the middle of tourist central... but $30 for a steamed dungeness crab?!?! doesn't taste any different than any other crab i've had for half the price. i'd much rather steam one at home for $15 and save myself another $15. 
shrimp louie salad for $15... some greens and two hand fulls of bay shrimp thrown on top. 

i guess what you're paying for is the service - tho not terrible - far from great/memorable. and the view - or lack there of.

on a recent visit there i also so a bird fly by and poop... right into the boiler. pretty gross so i'm probably never coming back.
author: Nam N.

description: The crab roll was like 50% bread. They're more expensive than their neighbors and give less meat. Rip off
author: Anthony C.

description: Got there early for a crab lunch and we had the pleasure of meeting the executive chef who was outside picking out a selection of hand picked crab at the steaming pot for the main kitchen inside the restaurant. Since they were not quite opened he took our order. He recommended that we try his special crab preparation which we did. Spicy garlic crab. It was off the hook delicious! Savory rich Vera Cruz ish garlic sauce with a slight hint of Jalapeño. The sweetest and most savory crab we have eaten yet. Love the personalized private chef service too especially in such a touristy  part of town. Go a see Javier the exec chef you won't regret it.
author: Joe H.

description: This place must stay in business just because of location.  Food was less than ok.  Order was not right and my son's order came out when everyone was done eating.  Don't waste your money and keep walking.
author: Curtis H.

description: Nick's gets four stars because it's my favorite place in San Fran, it's nostalgic for me and has a special place in my heart. You can choose any street side stand or restaurant, why Nicks? I think it cries out old San Fran Wharf! Space is limited in this area and you can feel it here. It has the feel of a small ship dining area, especially with the water view right off the back window. The bathrooms are smaller than tiny, not chubby people friendly and generally not very clean but again, it's more of a warm fuzzy feeling I get when I go to Nicks. My dad and I hit the place up whenever we're in down. Must haves: steamed crab, clam chowder, & oysters on the half shell.
author: Vannessa W.

description:
I was on a day long family outing in SF and there were 6 of us going down Fisherman's Wharf sampling all the different restaurants. This place convinced us to come in and sit down as as they had a friendly guy out the front and they were the only ones that had this Crab Chowder (which I must admit, was quite tasty, at least for the fact that it was different from all the clam chowder that every other restaurant in FW has).

So we sat down at a booth and to start, only three of us ordered the crab chowder and a few beers. The redheaded waitress said to us, "Sorry, you haven't ordered enough food. We can only serve you if you order a minimum of $10 per person."

I'm not usually one to make a scene but this pissed me off so much that I asked to speak to her manager because the restaurant was half empty. She refused to allow me to speak with her manager, who was actually the guy out the front giving out the free samples and inviting people inside. She replied "My manager is very strict about this." So in disbelief we had no other choice and stood up and left.

What despicable service. On the way out, I spoke to this "manager" and he was shocked and apologised profusely and invited us to come back in. 

Sorry Nick, but I just hate being served by people who hate their jobs.
author: Hany P.

description:
The rows of seafood stands make this the perfect place to stop by and pick up fresh fish for dinner or grab a seafood snack when you're walking around the pier. 

I got the popcorn shrimp and it was yummy. Fried but not greasy. Good marinara sauce. Nice sized portion.
author: Allie E.

description: We ate inside at a table and Alfredo was our waiter! He was so awesome! Even pulled out a love lobster for my son to look at! We had soup, crab cakes and chicken parm!
author: Brit K.

description:
This wasn't my choice, but my hubby was so anxious to eat some "chow-dah" that when the door hustler pointed towards the door, we where whisked inside.  I should have gone with my gut instinct and said NO!  But I didn't.  The inside is just TINY...small...miniscule.  

But, we weren't eating the walls and the decore... so I focused on the food.  We were greeted with a generous basket of sourdough bread which would have been wonderful, if it hadn't been burnt.  Bleh.

Our waitress, while attentive was also very boring...snore.  Kinda like the decor.

Hubby ordered the cod fish and chips.  The portion was fine and the fish was good, but the tarter sauce tasted too tangy, too much lemon.

Brianna S. ordered the Chower in the breadbowl and she enjoyed her selection.

I ordered the oyster Po Boy.  It wasn't even close to what you get at Spengers.  This one was on a sourdough roll, which also was a wee bit overcooked.  There wasn't anything exciting...just fried oysters in a roll.  It was served with fries and coleslaw.  I was really hungry but only managed half the sandwich.  Hubby finished it off, after I advised that I wasn't going to take it home.

Even if the guys outside who were very personable and lively started working inside, the atmosphere and the food would need a visit from Gordon Ramsey to jump start it's heart because it just felt like cardiac arrest.

On the good side, they validate!
author: Bee D.

description:
Both my mom & dad are from San Francisco, and when we come up to visit we ALWAYS go to Nick's.  These Yelp reviews don't do it justice at all. Yes, the place is small and you have to squish. GET OVER IT! It's San Francisco. The food isn't super fancy, it is simple and given to you fisherman wharf style but on a plate. This is the place to go- it beats Boudins and the other restaurants any day. 
The clam chowder- FULL OF FLAVOR. Thick, hot, and chunks of clams.
Calamari- My favorite. So crispy, and you get a very generous amount.
Crab- It's a must! Get it. End of Story.
LAZY MAN CIOPPINO- THE BEST THING YOU CAN GET!!! The broth is so good, and the seafood is fresh and so amazing. I recommend you get the sour dough bread and dip it in. 
The waiters are attentive, and bring out the food quickly. I've never had an issue. I am always so polite to them, they deal with hundreds, thousands of tourists everyday and NO ONE likes a rude guest, so don't be one and you should be fine. Enjoy.
author: Sara C.

description: The shrimp cocktail and crab cakes are a must try and the prices are very reasonable for fresh seafood.  I will return!
author: Pat W.

description:
Nick's is always my go-to place for clam chowder when I'm in SF! It is definitely my favorite in the Pier 39 area! Prices are reasonable and you can either sit down or take your food to go! 

Come here for amazing clam chowder bread bowls and an assortment of seafood choices the next time you're in the area!
author: Kayla J.

description: That fucking stoner chick, sucks ass. It wasnt even that busy, and if you cant be a functional pot head, maybe you shouldnt be a pot head. And most skeevy stoners are alright, full functioning stoners, but not this one.
author: Kevin E.

description:
This was our first meal after arriving in SF for a long weekend of food and fun in the most awesomest city on the planet!  Unfortunately, it was just O-K.

I ordered the crab chowder in a bread bowl, and my BF ordered the clam chowder. The crab chowder was flavorful enough, but lacking any significant evidence of crab. Most of the crab in the chowder seemed like it was those tiny shredded flakes of the leftovers that they would normally stuff into a sandwich.  My BF seemed satisfied with his clam chowder, but didn't rave on about it.

My main issue with this place, and with chowder bread bowls in general, is there is never enough soup to thoroughly enjoy all of the bread.  So I ordered a 2nd bowl, and this time I went with the clam chowder.  It was good, but I've had better in Monterey.

Our server seemed rushed and uninterested in us, or in the tip we might leave him. When I ordered the 2nd bowl of soup so I could enjoy the rest of my bread, he pointed out the tear in my bread bowl and said the soup would all pour out.  I assured him I was aware of the tear and would add additional soup at a slow rate, so as not to make a mess.  He just gave me a snort laugh and said "Okay."  I ended up feeling like he just wanted to turn the table, get us out, and get the next feeders in the booth.

Just an okay experience.
author: Sherry M.

description:
Bill came out $45 for ONLY dozen of oysters. PLUS they included 15% of tip. So bad!! 
I would NEVER come back here!!
author: Stacy Y.

description: Came at 9pm. Chowder had obviously run out during the day so they padded it out with water. Extremely watery. Precisely NO fish. At all. Potato had been stewed all day so had become blocks of mush that contributed to an arguably terrible experience. However bread was fresh and tasted nice.
author: Pollyanna J.

description: Awesome. Super busy with the crowd for super bowl weekend, but the staff was awesome. Ask for our understanding on how busy they were and it was not a problem for us. We ordered crab and raw oysters and our was fantastic. Planning to return tomorrow.
author: Lisa D.

description: This review is for the restaurant, the clam chowder and seafood linguini were delicious. Both were creamy and freshly made. The accompanying sourdough bread is always good. However, the service could be better. I ordered a glass of water and wasn't given one until I reminded the waitress. My husband ordered a refill on his coke and was given a diet one instead. We were also given the wrong entrée and when we informed the waitress of this she dismissed us and told us that the one she served us was better. She was right but still I could have been handled differently.  Despite this most recent experience we will continue to come because the food is good.
author: Modesta U.

description:
Came on a weekend with the family and ate inside the restaurant instead of trying out the food stand.  Service was nice and good, although the seating space inside was a bit crowded, esp so for family with a young baby that pushes a stroller.  

We tried bouillabaisse (the shell-less version of cioppino), boston clam chowder in bread bowl, and two items from the special menu: seafood pasta and spicy garlic crab. The bouillabaisse was too light in flavor but had good ingredients.  The clam chowder bread bowl was good, but I wish they toasted the bread.  Seafood pasta was creamy and nice, the spicy garlic crab caught me by surprise that I did not expect it to be that spicy, but the flavors blended in pretty even and good, and the sauce made the meat moist.  I did find it a bit too spicy to my liking.  The lobster bisque soup that went with the entrees were good, great flavor, of which I rank the best among all the items.
author: LeeLee C.

description: Tried their clam chowder bread bowl.  I got it right when it was fresh after waiting about 15 minutes. I was pretty excited, but once I ate it, it was pretty whatever.. It was kind if bland and I didn't even try to eat all the bread because it was a bit chewy. So I pretty much just ate the clam chowder . I guess getting the bread bowl was just for the experience because I was visiting SF. Next time I would probably try a crab bread bowl or go to Bouldin for a bread bowl. My friend got the calamari, it was $9 , bit it looked poppin ,so I would probably try that next time too, it was a lot if you get it when it's fresh and not just the crumbs cus my other friend got it late and one-third of it as just crumbs.
author: Bryant D.

description: I've been going to this place for over 10 years and it never disappoints. Got a 3 star Yelp review and the reviews are all over the place. Most of the negative reviews came from customers eating in the sit down part of the restaurant, whereas I always stand outside and eat at the counter. It's cramped inside and apparently they include tip no matter what size party. But everyone agrees that their crab is phenomenal. Also, the negative reviews come from people who order salmon, chicken parmesan, and sandwiches. Why would you order those things at a crab place?  That's like ordering chicken at a steakhouse. Anyways, best crab ever and I always make an effort to come here when I'm in town.
author: Joe B.

description: Best Cioppino I've ever had. My boyfriend had the spicy linguini marinara pasta with shrimp and we couldn't stop eating
author: Natalie F.

description: Ewwww... They ridiculed and made fun of the crab & lobster they were selling out in front of the restaurant while the creatures were still alive (very disrespectful)  and gave zero attention to constructive criticism of their obvious quantity over quality approach to tourist intensive dining. Loud crashing plates and bus station clatter not withstanding. Skip it and go someplace where they care. Gross.
author: Genie T.

description:
Pros:  Even though it may look very busy, does not take away how fast you'll be seated.  You're treated like family.

Food is VERY fresh, come on it's on the Wharf... It better be fresh!
author: Andrea M.

description: I ate at Nick's Lighthouse on Monday, January 18th, 2016 and got Severe Food Poisoning from the chilled crab and had to be hospitalized for two days. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!
author: Russ B.

description: Fast and attentive service! Very good lobster bisque. Had the fish and chips. Excellent everything.
author: Me G.

description: The service was the worst I've had in the whole city. Once we got there we were seated right away. It became quickly apparent that this establishment tries very hard to fight more people than they can fit. The seats and tables are incredibly small and we waited in our cramped seats for 20 minutes until a waiter finally came around to ask for our order. The food was ok, nothing extraordinary. I would not come again.
author: G R.

description:
One of the coolest features of Fishermen's Wharf is the sidewalk stands.  

Several of the restaurants actually operate the stands outside their doors, and Nick's is one of them.  On this particular Saturday I was set for a "walk-away cocktail," and I perused the reefers in front of several restaurants.  In front of Nick's I found a perfect crab and shrimp combination cup.  It was heaped high above the lip of the cup, and was served with cocktail sauce and a napkin for $11.39.  

I was only mildly surprised to find that most of the crab and shrimp was the part showing above the lip of the cup, the bulk of it being filled with iceberg lettuce.  Oh well.  I went ahead and enjoyed the crab and shrimp, as it did satisfy my craving.  Then I left the lettuce in the recycling bin with the cup.
author: David D.

description: Had the Crab chowder which wasn't overly salty... It was very satisfying and wholesome after a long drafty day at the Warf. The warm and cozy atmosphere was very much welcomed!  I found the service to be prompt,  polite,  attentive,  and curteous. Not an altogether bad experience... Felt like I received a good taste of Bay Area seafood.
author: Jiki R.

description: Love the farmer's market crab atmosphere they have going on down here. I haven't been to the Pier 39 area in years and my has it changed. I tried the Lobster Bisque in a bread bowl... wasn't the best bisque I've had by far... but for a street vendor (even thought the restaurant is behind the side walk counter) and for $5.50, can't really complain. Great for a walking snack!
author: Kimberly W.

description: Great food and service!  Staff was very friendly and the food was delish! Prices were surprisingly reasonable as well.
author: Sky T.

description: Don (an owner) took really good care of us.  We went crabbing on the "Lovely Martha" fishing vessel and had limits for my niece and I (12). Don cooked and cleaned and cracked all 12 of them buggers for us.
author: Ellen G.

description:
So we've been to boston and tried their boston clam chowder and it was awesome. So after eating the real deal and trying something from Nick's, Nick's just couldn't compare. The soup had a gd texture but sadly it was rather tasteless. 

Fried calamari: was gd but not fantastic. 

Oysters: was very fresh and definitely worth the money

Steamed crabs: were fresh and sweet but i just didn't enjoy them.

Overall, service was good but i won't be back because the food really isn't anything out of the ordinary.
author: Sharmaine T.

description:
Damn that was good!  I'm talking about the crab legs with Garlic  and the clam chowder all for $19 bucks!!  Oh yea and you can't forget the sourdough bread they give you and we ordered a lot!  I left heavier, but I was happy.  :)  
I can't wait to go back and may be this time get a whole crab instead of half.  
oink, oink.
author: Nikki G.

description:
This review is for the restaurant, not the cart outside.

Amazing lobster! Picked one out of the tank and boy did we enjoy it. Spiced very nicely with fresh garlic and a nice garlicky rice pilaf. This was not your average steamed lobster, the garlic they cooked it with made it absolutely delicious. Butter on the side. Clam chowder was perfect, oysters were fresh and tasty! 

Service was ok. 

No ipa beers here, I had to go next door and smuggle it in.
author: Comyar S.

description:
Clam, crab or lobster chowder. Excellent street food and the best in San Fran. The service at this particular vendor was comparatively the best amongst the 5 or 6 vendors along the chowder strip of Fisherman's Wharf. When in San Fran you have to try the chowder, and here you can see the fresh haul of the morning as it is getting prepared.

For best results pair with a local Anchor Steam beer.
author: Matthew W.

description: worst crab  chowder. i waz very dissapointed.  go to chowder house across the st. so much better flavor for $2 more!
author: Raja D.

description:
While cruising around the Wharf, we found Nick's after rejecting a number of more expensive ($30+ per entree) Wharf restaurants.  Nick's is old and really crowded, but the prices weren't bad, comparatively speaking.  I had their linguini and mussels with garlic butter special which was good.  I also enjoyed the bay shrimp salad that came with the meal and the two were only about $14.  Seemed very old San Francisco.  

Fried calamari didn't look that great.  Looked very fried and greasy.  

Nick's also has the walk-up crab and shrimp station too for those who want to just eat while standing or walking around the Wharf.  

Service was fine.  I'd eat here again.
author: Doctor G.

description:
Having lived in the city for 7 years, I realized that I'd never done the dungeness season at Fisherman's Wharf thing, so I rode my bike out there on a Sunday afternoon to see what I could find.

I settled on Nick's cart in the covered arcade because I liked the looks of the bread they were using for their sandwiches, and also because they told me to ignore the other carts and eat at theirs instead.

Their bread has a hard, tacky, amber colored crust, like you might find at a bakery.  The guy who lured me in assured me that everyone had a different crab salad recipe, and that they were all made fresh daily, so I can't compare Nick's to anybody else's yet.

Overall, I have to say I liked the sandwich. It maybe could've used some more salt or seasoning I guess.  It was $7.61.

 I ate it while walking down the block towards the piers, as there wasn't any comfortable place to sit and eat nearby.  I kind of feel like eating on foot is part of the whole Wharf experience though, so that didn't really bother me.  

I really have to come back to the Wharf before the season ends to get another crab sandwich at a different cart though.

On a side note, if you bike down to the Wharf, you may notice that there aren't any bike loops on the street to lock your bike to.  I found some in a parking garage on Leavenworth and Beach.
author: Gopal R.

description:
Best place ever! Period. Came with my mom and aunt and will be coming back all the time! 

Service is fantastic. House wine was on the house. Ordered two whole crabs and they only charged for one. Kept coming back to refill wine and water glasses even though it was really crowded. 

Now for food. Ordered clams for appetizer and it was just amazing. The sauce they put it in was heaven! Also ordered a pasta with clams and calamari in it and a fried platter of fish French fries calamari oysters. Fried foods are amazing! Didn't try the clam chowder because we had way too much on our table for just the three of us. Lots of yummy left overs for the next day. 

Nick is the man!
author: Matthew G.

description: Great customer service. According to yelp reviews there are other places in San Fran with delicious clam chowder...but the clam chowder here is amazing. We had some sort of fish burger that was just alright. This place definitely satisfied my craving for some good clam chowder.
author: Pau N Ed B.

description:
Very friendly staff!! :) 

I would definitely come back here when I'm around town. They offer delicious San Francisco Clam chowder in a bread bowl! YUM! They also have the Crab chowder and huge lobsters! 

The price is okay. It's a good experience to eat while standing & seeing the people strollin' around the Downtown SF @ night. It's not elegant, but sure is unforgettable!
author: Gennie M.

description: I think this place has the best crab so far on the pier. This is our second time coming here and the crab dont disappoint each time. We order two crab on spicy and the other one reg for the kids. I love how the spicy flavor merries together and you can taste a hint of beer in between it was so yummy with lemon squeezed all over too. We also got a mix fried platter combo that came with fries fried shrimp popcorn shrimp fried fish calamaris but it wasnt from here it was from china station just a few steps away. The staff here was friendly but i caught one of them picking his nose then he went and got a lobster thank god he wasnt the one handling our food. Not too mention he licked his dirty lil fingers after he picked his nose too. I found that disgusting lmao my sister and I was laughing at him. Besides all that this place is on the pier it gets pretty packed here if you dont want to stand on the side to eat you can opt to dine inside. We did the outside since we were sightseeing and headed to the goldengate bridge after. The line do get pretty long here but they have the best spicy crab and garlic butter crab.
author: Mary S.

description: Worst eating experience I've had in SF. Terrible service on a crowded Valentine's day dinner.
author: Johana M.

description:
This place was strike 2 after Chowder Hut. It seems like the greatest idea to be eating clam chowder in a fresh sourdough breadbowl in San Francisco. That is until you taste the clam chowder and notice that there are hardly any clams in the clam chowder. I understand that this place is only in business because of the amount of tourists in the area. I tried the clam chowder, lobster chowder, and the crab chowder. Each of the before mentioned chowders were missing the clam, lobster, and crab (respectively). Do yourself a favor and go to Boudin. 

Also, we attempted to eat inside the restaurant. We waited for about 15 minutes and were not attended by the servers.

In conclusion GREAT location, crappy food, and crappy service. GO TO BOUDIN.
author: Salvador S.

description: The fish and chips were NOT fresh, and really were terrible. The calamari was much better. Clam chowder was ok, but not great.  Just DON'T get the fish and chips.
author: Grant R.

description: We were walking around Fisherman's wharf, along the area with all the great outside stands and market, boiling fresh dungeness crab.  Quite frankly all these restaurants seemed great, I bet each would offer a great meal.  Nick's for whatever reason seemed to have the longest line, that was really our only differentiating factor.  Nick's also offered a crab chowder, so we figured why not.  The seating here is not very comfortable, the table is very small and everyone is packed as tightly as possible. We tried the crab chowder and their lobster bisque.  Both were excellent, the crab had nice chunks of crab meat and potatoes.  For entree we tried the classic cioppino, the tomato sauce had the right mixture of alcohol, cream, and acidity.  The stew contained wild scallops, salmon, jumbo shrimp, and mussels.  It was a very solid dish.  Afterwards we had the chili half cracked crab, which was very good as well.  Served with house bread which is definitely great with the cioppino, I would give this place another try.
author: Christopher F.

description:
My first and only meal on my Bay area trip! Let me just say right off the bat, the food here is fantastic all-around. No complaints whatsoever. The chowder (clam and crab) are smooth, creamy, and tasty. The shrimp sandwich and fries were filling and also quite decadent.

But enough about that. The service here was terrible enough to drop my rating on this restaurant all the way down to a two. The waiter was extremely arrogant and I swear to the almighty that he AND the kitchen messed up every single chowder order and treated us in a caustic manner when we asked for an exchange. Crab for a Clam and Clam for a Crab.

I hope we get a different waiter next time, because I loved the food here. Absolutely loved it.
author: Steevens A.

description:
This place was awesome! Not many Vegan options at all, but they're Garlic French Fries were off the chain. So Good. 

I had such a great experience here, mostly all thanks to Sue, my waitress. She was on top of her game and made me feel so welcome. Definitely a beautiful soul. 

Loved the vibe of this place as well, total fishing vibe. With big open windows that look out to the marina. 

Great Margaritas!
author: Erika P.

description: We just eat here. We go twice a year, always fun and good. I think they have new booths,they were nice. Service has always been friendly. My wife had clam chowder in bread bowl. Very nice. I had ciappino   , lazy man, wow, a ton of good seafood it was fresh not too much tomatoe sauce or salt. Also got sourdough bread, yum.  High five again
author: Jim B.

description: We were seated and then we waited for fifteen minutes. Waiters would pass by and not even acknowledge us. Horrible service. We're not tourists but decided to do the tourist thing. How wrong we were to vend go to this place. We did hear two waiters argue about a lost credit card. At that point, we left.
author: Carlos D.

description:
We only had to wait about 10 mins top to get a table, but once we were seated that's when the real waiting started.  Took forever for our waiter to come by to take our drink order.  My husband ordered the fish and chips which were delicious, I unfortunately ordered the crab sandwich - it was so beautiful when it came to the table, a great big sandwich on fresh and warm sourdough  loaded with crab, unfortunately it was so bland, turns out it was just loaded with chopped celery and green onions, that's all you could taste.  

My message to the chef  please taste one of these sandwiches yourself, I'm sure you would be as disappointed as I was! But great job on the fish and chips, they  were very light and delicious!  Oh, also I think your cole slaw could use a little work too, how about using champagne vinegar, I think it would give it more pizzaz.
author: Michele W.

description:
yummyyyyy. if you go down to fishersman wharf there are 9 places that sell pretty much all the same thing. we kept walking back and forth to decide which one to eat at. nick's decided to give us a sample of a leg as advertisement. so we decided to eat there. then they also offered to pour some spicy sauce over our crab. that spicy sauce was soooooo delicious. it totally made the crab perfect. spicy with a kick of garlic. yummmmm! 

we also ordered the clam chowder in the sour dough bread. their soup was better than i think spot 2... run by chinese people - no offense to my asians, but nick's totally makes way better clam chowder. i think nick's prices were a little bit higher, but i think totally worth it because it tastes so much better. 

oh also, one thing to note. they charge almost double the price if you sit inside. so if the weather permits, just eat outside. they'll set up a spot for you. 

now i want to go back and order another spicy crab!
author: Juliet K.

description:
First time at fishermans wharf and sad I had to come to this place!!!

God awful food. I doubt these people have repeat customers.

The service started off great but the waiters started making a lot of mistakes. The personality was there, but the lack of follow up was disappointing.

The bread bowl was great but the bread overpowered the soup. They need to dig a little deeper into that bowl!!!
author: Kandice K.

description: This place is buzzing and the seafood is fresh. We grabbed a clam chowder and a dunges crab and ate on the wharf - definitely a great flavour and experience.
author: Ananth S.

description:
If you know what you are getting into before you step into this place, you will have a much better time. Nicks is: a) a fisherman's wharf tourist restaurant b) old school c) more expensive because of where it's located. 
If you are ok with all of that, than the food is decent. 
bread - boudin - can't go wrong with that. Ask for it warm.
clam chowder - too sour for my taste but my wife really liked it.
entrees:
1) Chicken Parm - one of our party doesn't like seafood. She seemed to like it, and it came with a huge side portion of spaghetti.
2) New York steak and Tiger shrimp - pretty tasty - the steak is served with a garlic/chive oil. 
3) Linguine Portofino (Clams/Mussels/Shrimp) - again not too shabby, and big portions of seafood.
4) Broiled Mahi Mahi - a bit too fishy for my tasty, even tho the waiter said it was the fresh catch of the day.

Bill was $110 included tip. Not unreasonable. Probably wouldn't be a destination restaurant but if you were like, showing out of town guests the wharf area, you could do a lot worst.

Service was friendly, although I had to remind the waiter several times for things like water, bread and extra bowls. He was nice tho.

Lastly, the place is arranged in such a way to pack as many booths/seats as possible. So the booths are very, very, small. If you are a big person, you will feel cramped in the booths (I sure was).
author: Dom L.

description:
Great food with friendly service!!

We wanted to grab lunch at Fisherman's Wharf but weren't quite sure where. After walking around a bit we approached Nick's Lighthouse and were drawn in by the friendly, personalized greeting. We thought we'd give it a try.

We were immediately seated and serviced. Our server was great. She greeted us in a very welcoming, warm, and sincere manner - which carried through the entire time we were there. She was attentive and honest with her recommendations, which we really appreciated. Her smile and friendliness was contagious.

We ordered the half dozen oysters, linguine with clams, and shrimp skewer lunch special (also included was a choice of chowder or salad and bread) - everything was absolutely DELICIOUS and FRESH!! We ate everything and wanted more, but were too stuffed. We will definitely come here again.
author: M N.

description: The food is delicious but pricey. Having said that, I have to say the service was very good. The tiny bathroom needed more attention.
author: O D.

description:
others seems to have bad sit-down experiences but i thought my stand-up experience was the contrary.  

after one endless day of biking from fisherman wharf to the golden gate bridge and back with our rented bikes i swore i burnt off the regular sized boudin sourdough bowl i had just inhaled for lunch... and was hungry for some deep fried item to tame my angry empty stomach.  bf and i walked around the wharf and shopped around a bit for the right seafood stand (since there were so many right next to each other), we decided on nick's.  

while we were waiting in line the owner handed us fried mahi mahi cakes and they were so deliciously amazing that i def recommend anyone to get nxt time.  however, we stuck with the prawns and chips.  the prawns are not heavily breaded and was not overly greasy.  laying under the prawns were not only fries, but seasoned fries, AND seasoned curly fries.  triple bonus points.  

though pretty pricey (i mean, it is a touristy area), but the stomach was definitely happy.  

no sitting area outside of the shop, so good luck eating while standing because you'll never know what those seagulls around you are plotting against your tray of fried items.
author: Alice C.

description:
We went here for dinner yesterday for dinner.  Crowded!  Lots of competition with the neighboring restaurants.  (We were 3rd in line to be seated, and the 2 parties ahead of us were persuaded by the restaurant next door to try their food.

Nick's was well worth the wait.  Great customer service and fresh seafood.  Not to mention good specials that come with either a cup of soup or a salad.  

The music was very random (from psychadelic to funk, then r&b.  

This was my 2nd time here, and I'd definitely come again!
author: Jessica D.

description: Terrible tables! The food was tasteless and had no substance. They need to play around with spices and flavor because there was basically cardboard on my dinner plate. All in all it is over rated and the prices are for people who like to think they are rich and have no taste for food. Like seriously! CARDBOARD!!!
author: Brandon R.

description:
My final stop on my self styled four stop lunch tour of the outdoor stands of Taylor Street.

Had the fried calamari and chips. The calamari was dry and the curly fries were soggy.
author: Gregory C.

description: After freezing our butts off on one of those double decker buses, my bf and I were in the mood for something simple and easy. I had the lobster bisque bread bowl. He had the fish and chips. It wasn't the best meal we had on our trip but it fit the bill for what we were looking for. The service was great. Our server was all business while his coworkers goofed around.
author: Nadia G.

description:
Ewww this place is cramp and disgusting. Was suckered into coming in and we ordered clams, oysters and clam chowder. Bleh...never again. It felt like they rush you in and then rush you back out. The restaurant did not have a table to accommodate 7 so we sat in two tables and they just took down the partition between us. Well my friend took the kids to the bathroom and the workers just cleared the one table without checking if we were done and sat other patrons. Rude!!! As for the bathroom it is literally next to the kitchen (gross) and has to be a fire hazard. There was no waiting area. 

Don't come here.
author: Lisa T.

description: Very nice and friendly people! They have a booth outside the store where things are cheaper but you do not get to sit down. I had a great meal inside with 2 breadbowls and I almost could not finish my main seafood dishes! The people are very nice and friendly. Thank you Nick, Frank and Ed !
author: Harold W.

description: We ordered a whole crab, crab cakes with rice and cauliflower, clam chowder, lobster bisque, and a kid's hamburger and it was very uneventful.  The only items that had flavor were the french fries and oyster crackers.  If you're in the area and using Yelp, move on!
author: M P.

description: THE SERVICE IS VERY DISAPPOINTING. I saw the food stand in front of the restaurant and I wanted food to go. But one man led me inside the restaurant and I sat down in a narrow booth. A white waiter served me and maybe because I only ordered one combination, he intentionally ignored me. He zealously chatted with the table behind me and offered free soups to the table in front of me, but he kept me waiting for near 20 minutes and when he finally served my dish, he turned his back towards me for near ten seconds, oh that would be enough time for spitting on the food. DO NOT ORDER OYSTER BECAUSE YOU WILL NEVER KNOW IT WAS SPITTED ON OR NOT. And HE WROTE THE TIPS AMOUNT WITHOUT MY CONSENT. The only thing reasonable is he knew how horrible he was, and he only asked for 13%.
author: Dick B.

description: love the freshhhh raw oysters !!!! first time having oysters and i am gladddd this was the place i went to ! yum !
author: Jenny N.

description: Good calamari, clam chowder and lovedddd there crab cakes! Nice place to just grab and go at the wharf! Sad to see so much bread bowls being wasted and thrown out by customers and to be left there at the table is gross, -1.
author: Yvette M.

description:
I am writing a review for the food stand right outside of Nick's Lighthouse Restaurant. Ohhhhhhh myyyyyy..... I love their calamari and seasoned curly fries!! Squeeze that lemon they give you and you are good to go!! They also give you some sauce to dip. The calamari is seasoned perfect and the pieces are pretty big. 

They  have a lot to choose from like, clam chowder in a bread bowl to fresh shrimp crab ceviche. Next time I go I'm gonna try their crab sub sandwich, cause they pack the hell out of it until it overflows!
author: Randy P.

description: This place is A OK with me. Honestly I was down to just get a bread bowl from the outside vendors but since it was a weekend and they was virtually no place to sit we decided dining in would probably be the least hectic. The prices and selection are pretty average for a seafood restaurant. Thankfully there were lunch specials which included a cup of chowder or bisque so I felt like I got the bang for my buck. I loved how plentiful the mussels were in my pasta and they were cooked really perfectly. My friend also enjoyed her fish and chips. My sister loved her crab sammie which was on the regular menu.
author: Stephie D.

description:
On our second day in San Francisco, we decided to have brunch at Fisherman's Wharf for some fresh seafood, as they're known to have. We were walking along a row of restaurants when a chef, whom was standing outside a seafood stand approached us with 2 untied and very much alive crabs and playfully handed it over to take some photos with it. I guess since we were satisfied with the results of the photos, we got sold to try out the food. Haha good selling tactic eh?;) 

We tried their clam chowder and lobster bisque soups, which both deserved praises for its thick creamy textures and delicious flavors, with a pinch of pepper to enhance the taste. Their linguini marinara was pretty tasty too. As for the service goes, they were only serving us and 2 other tables so I can't say for other times of the day, but our waitress sure did a good job serving us then:)
author: Crystal O.

description: There isn't anything particularly great or bad about this place.  We just kind of felt that it was a "meh" experience.  As someone else mentioned, the shrimp/crab cocktail is mostly lettuce, and the cocktail sauce portion was tiny and bland.  That was pretty disappointing.  The bread is excellent.  The dinner entrees were good, but again, nothing outstanding, just good.
author: Carlos A.

description: I had their cioppino.. It was okay, a lil bit salty.  Probably would not go back.
author: Juvy M.

description: The worst fish and chips lunch I've ever eaten, and I love fish and chips. I got sick from it. Did not taste fresh at all. STAY AWAY FROM HERE!!! Go to another one of the much better seafood options next door.
author: Aiden S.

description: I ordered a spicy garlic crab right on the street.  It was delicious...and definitely cleared my sinuses.  Everywhere serves crab in the wharf, but they elevated the flavor with the spices and garlic.  I was between 4 and 5 stars, but the 5th star was earned with how kind and personable they were.
author: J R.

description:
We were really excited to eat fresh dungeness crab at Fisherman's Wharf, we walked around to all the food booths.  We eyed all the crab cakes, fish and chips, shrimp/crab cocktails, po boy sandwiches.... all looked delectable.  When I saw the whole crab, my mouth was drooling!  I stopped drooling when I saw the price tag at $12.95/pound!  If each crab was approx 1-1/2 to 2 pounds each, we'd be paying over $20 for it!  Although my love for crab is deep, I wasn't in love with the price. 

We opted for plain fish and chips, so we went for the "red carpet" feeling, as that's what they were saying to entice people to eat at the restaurant.  They explained their fish being dipped in beer and a special flour mixture before deep frying.  The guy who worked there (found out he's from Fiji) told me that if we didn't like it, he wouldn't charge us.   So we tried it, as I didn't want the bread crumby dry looking fish out on the street.  When it came out, it wasn't what I expected.  It didn't have the flakey crispy batter on the outside of the fish.  Meh - it was okay.  We ate it though, and they still charged us for it.

We also had the clam chowder and the lobster bisque.  Clam chowder was really rich and creamy.  Delicious!  The lobster bisque tasted like cream of tomato soup.  Not much lobster flavor at all.  The free sour dough bread tasted really good when you dipped it in the soup!

For $22, it was okay.  We got more food for eating in the restaurant, than eating outside.  So I guess it wasn't too bad. 

The one thing I really didn't like are the tables.  The seats in the booth are really close to the tables, and you can't move either the chair or the table.  Plus, the seat is so short (not long enough from your butt to your knees), so you are sitting really straight, and it's really uncomfortable if you have a bad back.

Oh, one more thing, the owner (or whomever) was yelling at the workers to clean the bathrooms because a customer complained about it.  I don't think you should be yelling in the dining room to clean the restrooms in front of all the patrons.  Just not something I want to hear when I'm eating my food.

Overall thought?  I was still hungry for crab!!!!!.  So I was still on a hunt for my crab!!!!!
author: JME C.

description:
Nicks Lighthouse has been at the Warf for ever because the seafood is fresh, tasty and priced well. 

You can eat inside or do as most people do and buy your good from the outside stand and dine al fresco on the Warf which is my preference.  The restaurant interior is a bit worn and cluttered. 

Try the crab shrimp salad. It is a large portion of fresh crab meat and ship with cocktail sauce. 

The calamari salad was fresh and flavorful. 


They also serve great soup in hollowed out sour dough loaves.
author: Robert C.

description: I couldn't even take more than two sips of their clam chowder. It was too watered down. Cocktail shrimp is overpriced for what they serve you. The shrimp is baby bay shrimp and labeled under "shrimp cocktail". Don't be fooled. They will reel you in aggressively before letting you have a moment to actually decide where you want to eat.
author: Rowena T.

description: Worst Crab chowder soup, water down, no crab meat, but two pieces of square cut potato in the soup and and corn pieces. I could have had a Progresso soup instead. I gave a one star just because service was okay.
author: Irene E.
