description: Interesting clam chowder..,lots of celery and potato (cooked down to thicken, no texture) but not a single clam. Great overall flavor, although a bit bland and the cream was "broken", but it was a very nice bread bowl and they include the bread that was scooped out on the side.
author: Lucas T.

description: Nice place fresh food. I recommend to take the fried calamari, garlic bread, salmon pasta, soups are good, lobster super fresh. Service looks and feel good. Nice.
author: Ofir A.

description:
We were wandering down Fisherman's Wharf, ready to eat, and waved in to this dandy little place by an eager host! We were seated right away, and our server, Elvis, was very nice (no, not THE Elvis!). 

I had to have a dungeness crab appetizer with drawn butter, and I was not disappointed. The kids meal choices were awesome. The food was good and the prices reasonable.  It was a little old school as far as furnishings (there was gum stuck under the tables....haven't you seen that Kitchen Nightmares show? You gotta scrape that stuff off! :)

All in all, I was happy with the vibe, the ambiance, the service and the food.
author: Kathy M.

description:
We had the oysters, fries, clam chowder and shrimp and scallop fettucine alfredo. Oysters were good in size, clam chowder was tasty and the pasta was spot on = rich but not heavy.

Service was timely and friendly. 

Atmosphere was a little lacking, could be a tad more lively for being in such a unique spot.
author: Quack Attack Z.

description:
Best doorman EVER!

It went downhill from there, though.  But for sheer entertainment, the guy was fantastic. An asian guy basically talked us into the restaurant when we were only looking at the fish stand outside. Now that's talent!!  Not his fault we were gullible. Never again, though, and I'll tell you why.

HOVERING.  Waitstaff, don't do this. It makes the patrons nervous at the least and rushed at the worst.  

Unloading supplies.  Yes, we realize the restaurant is tiny but you should figure out a way to bring in your stuff some other way.  When the staff marches by with boxes labeled, "Battered Fish Filets" you lose some of your longing for the fish and chips special. Come on, people. You are on FISHERMAN'S WHARF....you can certainly  make a homemade fish and chips without buying it in (as Chef Ramsay would point out.)  

Our waiter (bless his old heart) had the bad habit of reaching across us all the time as well. Not good etiquette for a waiter...or at least a murmured "pardon my reach" would have been appreciated.  

Now for the food:  Not so good. The oysters on the half shell were tiny and not too meaty.  The cocktail sauce was uninspiring. There were about 14 lemons on the dish to try to hide how inadequate the oysters were. Not worth $12.95 for six.  My avocado salad with crab was pretty bland.  The greens were crispy and there were a few tomatoes, otherwise BORING. The avocado portion was tiny and it wasn't ripe. The crab was overly salty or not washed off enough; not sure which.  Disappointing.

My dining partner chose the sauteed scallops with rice and got the white clam chowder as a starter.  The clam chowder was too salty, yellowish (WHY?) and we couldn't find A CLAM.  The scallops had some interesting spices but were unevenly cooked...the larger ones were a bit undercooked and the smaller ones were a bit dry. 

One last word...the sourdough bread was disgusting. Old, dry, and burnt on one side. When we asked they said, "It's all like that!"

Hmmmm, on second thought, maybe i better change my two stars to a ONE star.  Yep.  

My recommendation is to eat off the carts in front of the restaurants. The seafood looked fresher and the prices were WAY better. :)
author: Deb M.

description: The crab linguini was good. The dinner comes with soup ( clam chowder) or salad. Along with sourdough. The portion was average. Not much as far as atmosphere. I would also say $$$ was average for the wharf.
author: Hollis W.

description: One of the more popular street stands for chowder! The crab chowder is pretty good, and the garlic fries are sinful and may cause acne. :P
author: Esther Y.

description:
Came here with Mr. Face after going to Kiji's because that meal didn't work out too well for me. I didn't know what to get from the many stands, but we decided on this one for the garlic fries and crab cakes. 

The garlic fries were decent, even though they weren't fresh. I realized after that nothing was all that "fresh"... just prepped before and sitting in a case almost buffet style. 

The reasoning for the 1-star was for the crabcakes... I mean hey they didn't taste all THAT bad and it was my first time having one, but imitation crab... really? I could taste it right away and was immediately disappointed because of where we were. I mean it's the wharf for crying out loud!!! Here you are killing fresh crabs and cracking those shells... and we're here having crabcakes made with imitation meat? WHAT GIVES???! 

Sir Face did feel bad for me though when he found out it was my first time, so he said he'd take me to a better place or take me crabbing (which I've never done) and make some himself, so I'm looking forward to that =)
author: Nga C.

description:
Arrived in SF last night from L.A. and we had a craving for crabs.  Drove to Fisherman's Wharf... to our disappointment almost all the street stands have closed except Nick's.  So Nick's it is, because we have no other choice.

Crab tasted fresh and okay.  However, i do not like how their clam chowder and the lobster bisque tasted -- the chowder tasted sour and the bisque is not creamy enough.  The prawn cocktail also tasted okay but a bit cold on a cold night.

That said, they were doing extremely well on X'mas Eve as they are the only place that opens in regular hours.  All other places closed early that night.

Good job for Nick for monopolizing the situation.  Good for me to still get what I wanted.  Bad that food is really mediocre.
author: Maria G.

description: My friends and I were so excited to try their soup bowls.  My friends ordered the crab chowder and I had the lobster bisque.  We were both disappointed.  The crab chowder didn't have much crab.  I felt like I tasted more potatoes.  With the bisque, I was rich and fishy.  Not what I expected.  I guess since I've had better, it ruined my experience.
author: Rachel L.

description: This place has dropped in service quality. I have experienced better days coming to this place for years. I was not impressed by some of the unfamiliar faces. The food still maintains its integrity. You can find some of the freshest crab on the wharf at this place. I always order the garlic and butter spicy crab which is not on the menu but they still make it for you as a secret menu kind of thing. Be sure to ask for it if you decide to try it out. Other than the service being mediocre, I enjoyed the atmosphere of a fast paced restaurant the location is ideal if you are a tourist in SF. its right on the strip of taylor st where all of the oldest fishermans wharf restaurants exist. You should research the history of this wharf before attending and watch how it has changed and what is not so different. Prices sure are not the same. However, its not as bad for the quality of food you will receive. Again the service can improve, they made me feel a little rushed and unappreciated as a customer. I will next time order my crab to go hopefully the waiter was just having a bad day.
author: Ceverino R.

description: Our server Cristina was fantastic! She was cheerful and pleasant and made our experience there very satisfying.
author: B C.

description:
If you like your clam chowder thick and yummy, come here!  

with bread bowl - $5.50
2 fried items is $9.95 (?)

We had the shrimp popcorn, fried shrimp, fried fish and fried calamari.  The clam chowder was indeed thick and good.  I tasted mostly potatoes (which I like) and at the end, started scrapping the side of the bread bowl because I wanted more.  I wish they had smaller bread bowls.. what a waste of bread!

The shrimp popcorn was good.. so was the fried shrimp.  The fish was OK and the calamari was pretty good.  I'm not a fan of cocktail sauce, so I had to grab some ketchup from another place.  No tartar sauce?  BOO.
author: Jennie P.

description: Get the crab with spicy garlic butter sauce. I ate crab a few places on the wharf the last few days and this one is a must repeat!
author: Evelyn O.

description:
This is one of my go-to places by the pier.  This place is like a seafood -togo- farmers market style area in front of a chain of restaurants.  I love the place but it does have some negative factors that cannot be avoided

1. it will alwayz be cramped and busy, especially on the weekends, so just push your way through
2. waiters will try to get you to eat inside so politely ignore them and order away.
3. Since it is outside the food may be cold so if you are not in a hurry, make sure to wait for the new batch of food from the kitchen...
4. i have eaten inside a few times and it is very cramped with small tables so there is not alot of elbow space.
Now to the positive factors...

1. Now that theres a  bigger sidewalk, the eating experience is not as bad once you grab for food.
2. I absolutely love their lobster bisque, note that its flavorful but does not have alot of lobster meat/chunks in them, for about 5 bucks, it is expected.
3. do not forget to get your parking validated if you are parking at the nearby parking lot, if you eat inside you get an hour or two off your time, every 20 mins count :D
author: Tyffani N.

description: We have coming here for 48 years!!  That must tell you something!  In all those years the food, service and experience has remained the same. That is a good thing!
author: Michael L B.

description: My first thought upon eating here was how the hell has this place been in business since the 30's? The service was bizarre(waiter responding to "can i ask you a question?" with whats my number?) and the food was horrible, my aunt's  fried shrimp was not cooked enough so she asked for it to be put back into the fryer again. Our waiter brings her food back and proceeds to tell us that the kitchen was closed so he did something special for her. I got the Saute Shellfish Platter which sounded good when they described it on the menu, but  In reality i wouldn't serve this dish to my dog. this is how they described the dish i ordered, Saute Shellfish Platter Dungeness Crab Legs, Tiger Prawns, Sea Scallops, Calamari & Fresh Fish. They lumped all of the fish together in some indistinguishable blob and added bay shrimp to it which cooked down to nothing. My meal as a whole was inedible and the only thing that was edible was the sourdough bread. I do not recommend this place to anyone unless you want a disgusting overpriced dinner in cramped booths. I think the most horrifying part was one of the guys that works in the kitchen looking for a mouse that lives in the booths, at the end of the dinner.
author: Lauren M.

description:
It was my bff's bday, and we decided to head out to SF and spend the day shopping and eating.  We were so hungry by the time we got to the city, and we headed right to food!  We usually do the bread bowl clam chowder thing, but we really wanted to sit down somewhere out of the wind too, so we came to Nick's.  

We were quickly seated, and the waitress had our drink order to us within minutes.  We also had plenty of warm sourdough bread, and our drinks were refreshed.  I had the beer batter fish and chips, my bff had a seafood filled pasta dish, and her daughter had the clam chowder.  My friend said her food was okay, and her daughter devoured her clam chowder.  I was happy that the fish wasn't over cooked, but the beer batter was so so, unfortunately my fries were warm, and not crispy.

I'd probably come back if it was a weekday, but I think I'd avoid eating here if it was on a weekend cause it can get crazzzzzzzzzzzy!
author: Sandra H.

description:
3.5 stars

My review is only for takeout on the street. I was visiting fisherman's wharf and in the mood for fresh crab. I chose this place because Nick is both my boyfriends and brothers name ( weird I know). Ordered one crab to go. The total came out to around $20 ( it was like $14) a pound.  The crab was really fresh, they cracked it for me and included butter and lemon in the to go box.  I enjoyed my meal listening to street perfomers on a really nice day, it was great :)
author: Molly S.

description: If this review were only based on service, it would get 5 stars...it was excellent. The food was just okay, and the restaurant was ehhhhhh.  It smelled horribly and everything was sticky to the touch - the tables, booths, chairs, door handles.  I had the chowder which was a tad bland by my standards and I had the caesar salad with bay shrimp. The caesar dressing was sparse and bland but the shrimp were tasty and plentiful. Hubby had the cioppino, which was not worth the $30 asking price. The broth was tasteless and the seafood a little chewy, especially the calamari.  The sourdough bread was very good, and our nephew had the fish and chips and they were delicious.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Holy crap....I think there was a reason why there is a dude outside trying to get people to go in.  I don't know if the waiter needed his bills to be paid with tips or something because he was pissed that we only ordered clam chowder, appetizers and not their 25 dollar seafood platter.

Me:can we get a clam chowder...oh how big are the fries and fried zucchini ...
Waiter:small...(weird look)
Me:I know can your show me?
Waiter:small...is that all your gonna get(mad face insert here)
Me:no my friends would like two clam chowders as well

Is it really an issue to get what WE wanted...I mean come on we are at fisherman's wharf...get clam chowder...right?

Anyways going to what really matters because service can be a changing variable...clam chowder SUCKED...it was way to bland. I mean if you like thick chicken gravy with little clam niblets you got a five star rating, but established in 1934 should mean they got CLAM chowder right...especially with such a wide array of competitors right next to each other...JUST DISSAPOINTED...everything else was whatever...want a better place go try Boudin bakery across the street...better bread to accent the clam chowder, better ambience, and can not beat animal shaped bread...so to wrap this whole review up the bus boy was super friendly and made up for the rude waiter, but CHICKEN CHOWDER SUCKED...YES I MEANT CHICKEN...because it sure wasn't clam
author: Kevin T.

description:
Tried this place due to how busy it looked (busy usually means decent, right?). Husband tried the linguini w/clams, bay scallops and crab. I tried the clam chowder and deep fried calamari. The linguini was more of a thin soup and he said it was "ok", my chowder was very disappointing! Extremely thin, maybe 4 clam bits (I counted) and was so salty, I could not finish it. The calamari was EXTREMELY greasy, no taste and so over cooked, rubber bands deep fried! The grease had congealed in the bottom of my plate. The worse was when our waiter started clearing the table before we were even done! May I finish my coffee first? The place was dirty, the booths felt like they were put together by a 5 year old, the ceiling looked ready to cave in and there was a bad odor coming from somewhere in there!
It's a shame they make money off the tourists to stay open!
author: Gina B.

description: Awesome service, good priced food. The gf asked for slightly toasted lobster bisque, they bring out 2 just in case it was too burnt. Gotta love service like that!
author: Tony T.

description: The sourdough clam chowder bread bowl at the stand is just what you'd expect. It got the job done. The chowder is tasty and hot, the bread bowl is good sourdough. Can't beat that.
author: Gil S.

description:
I enjoy coming here especially for my random 1 day turnaround driving trips to San Francisco from Los Angeles.

Prompt attentive service with sometime 2-3-4 different servers checking on you.

I usually order the Shrimp Sandwich with generous servings of Shrimp that nicely overpower the bread. Second choice is the bay shrimp cocktail which doesn't have that slimy seafood taste but rather that fresh can I have some more feel to it that you'd enjoy with an adult beverage. Next try the calamari plate...not too much batter, not too much oil, and just enough crunch to make each bite heavenly.

I could care less if it's considered a tourist restaurant...I drove 360 miles because I like this place! Maybe cause I have the same name but who cares...when I'm at the wharf after watching the Dodgers beat the Giants at ATT Park I'll drive over here and eat like a hungry bear!
author: Nick R.

description:
Josh:
The food was decent.  The crab chowder was not good, but the crab itself was average.

Here's the complaint.  Right when we finished paying the bill (literally 1 minute after) the bus boy comes over and reaches over me to clean the table with his hands, taking my crackers and bread (which I was still eating) in the process.  Immediately after this I pull out my map to see where my girlfriend and I are going next and one of the bigger employees comes over and tells us that if we want to stay we have to go stand over at the bar and leave the table.  I am not the type of person who sits at a table for a long time after I eat to chit chat with company, but I thought that this was completely ridiculous.  Only a couple of minutes after eating and paying the bill they tell us to leave?  Thanks for the awesome customer service...  I will never eat here again.

Carolina: There was still dirty food on my "clean" spoon.  Hmph!
author: CarolinaNJoshsFoodAdventures s.

description:
blehhhk.. I love lobster bisque and when I came here for a vacation i thought "what better place can I get lobster bisque than in fishermans wharf?"

I came, I ate, and I was disappointed.  The lobster bisque was starchy and tasted more like tomato based-- not lobsteresque at all. I got it in the bred bowl, and the bread wasn't even hot or fresh--very stale!

 I told myself that I would try other things like the calamari if I liked their lobster bisque. Alas, I did not, so I didn't even try anything else... Try the other stands!
author: Romi C.

description: it's the one on the wharf on the corner.  I had my food from the street so I'm guessing the price is a little better than sitting down.  Had some bread bowl clam chowder, seems to have more vegetables compared to others.  the bread was okay, fairly soft. nothing special for the most part.  I also had the marinated calimari which okay as well.  it really needed the lemon and cocktail sauce.  there is quite a bit of competition on the street and the prices are definitely competitive.  it was fairly empty overall when i got here around 8pm at night.
author: Kent H.

description: Really wanted to try the food here, it looked really good but unfortunately the waitress took way to long to even offer water. Ended up walking out
author: Claudia H.

description:
The clam chowder at Nick's was perfect - the sourdough bread bowl was nice and soft and the chowder was exactly what chowder should taste like (in my opinion anyway) - creamy, not to fishy, generous portions of clams. Two thumbs up for their crab cakes too. HOWEVER...we bought fresh crab cocktail for my father-in-law and noticed that it look untouched in the container it came in when he was getting ready to dispose of his food. WAIT!!!! Before it hit the trash can, we asked and made sure that he even tried it first. His response:

"What is that anyway? It has no taste!"

[insert astonished, confused facial expressions here]
 
The Hubby decided to taste it for himself and told me that it tasted like water. I tasted it myself, and sadly...AGREED. WTH? So disappointing. Who wants to come to San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf with a craving for crab-anything and get this? So bad, I even had a dream that I returned to Nicks and tried to return the crab cocktail for a refund. Oh well...never again...maybe for the clam chowder.
author: Shaye G.

description:
The food was pretty good.  Very reasonable.  But the best thing was the service.  After having a pretty bad day, our waiter "Estaban" was very professional and very nice. 

Bread Hot Fresh CHECK
Drinks came out quick (refills quick) CHECK
Tiger Prawn Cocktail Fresh CHECK
Chowder Off the Heezee CHECK
Butter Sauce Pasta with Prawns CHECK

and again friendly waiter CHECK

Bill came out under 50.00  - very  nice for a Sat night at Fisherman's Warf.

FYI - notice most of the HATERS are from out of town. lol
author: Amro R.

description: So happy we ate here!! The waiter was so fast and he was very nice and helpful. The bread bowl clam chowder was unique, it had a special something added to it that made it so...good! Oysters were yummy!! My husband had the crab chowder and really liked it. I would definitely go there again!!
author: Nancy J.

description:
With all the choices at Fishermans Wharf, it's hard to tell who's faking and who will be memorable. You can't fake real customer service though. First time I ever went to Nick's, there was a line of 4 or 5 people. (In spaces as tight as the Wharf, it's not comfortable waiting for any number of people) One memory that stuck in my mind was Francis yelling at the door guy for letting 2 other groups in before us, even though they came after. 

Anyway, on to the food. Linguine with Alfredo topped with Prawn and Scallops. Don't feel like Alfredo? No problem. Francis made garlic wine sauce happen.
author: Febre Z.

description:
We have visited Nick's on a few occasions.... It's a great place to stop by for a decent sit down meal with an expansive menu and of course, OYSTERS!  Each time I have come here, I have tried different things - expecting one day to be "wowed", but as you can see by the star level, this has never actually happened.

Their service is great, their menu full of selections.  However, most of the food is bland - even their fried cod fish has a funny tasting batter.  I was expecting a tempura batter, or at least a seasoned flour batter, but got a sort of rubbery tasteless crust instead.  Fries were meh, taste like pre-cut bagged ones that you buy in the frozen food aisle, and the spaghetti was watery.

I do have to say, that this place is the BEST place to get Oysters.  We order them every time we come.  I would have to say the reason we keep coming back is for the Oysters.  If this were all I had ever eaten at this place, they would get 5 stars.  However, I have to minus 1 star for the bland food, and minus one star for how expensive the bland food is!  We ordered 10 oysters, fish and chips and 2 kids spaghettis and total bill was $78!

Like I said before, its a great place to stop for a decent sit down meal, and we will likely visit again - but I'm sure if I was more venturous we can find something better...
author: Matt And Christina A.

description:
Seriously the BEST fish in chips outside of Seattle.  No joke.  Love, Love, Love it hear. Pasta was good too, but after taking a bite of my husbands fish and chips, I regretted ordering what I did. 

And other then the girl waitress swearing because she way undercharged a customer (lmfao), the service was great and atmosphere very SF'ish. WILL be back. Maybe even on Fathers Day.
author: Billy G.

description:
Went last Sunday for the visiting family's last meal in SF. Food was nothing special especially given the cost. The service was laughably bad. 

As a local now for more than year, I should have known better than to go to the Wharf for seafood. Next time I have family in town looking for good seafood, I'll choose to go to any number of the slightly more expensive restaurants where I know we'll get better food, service and a nice bay view.

The good: We got seated right away and the food didn't take longer than expected to reach our table, for the most part (see below for exception). And nobody got sick. (Think positively, right?)

Now to be fair, our server was bad enough that he should have been fired. So assuming so, your experience will hopefully be pleasantly uneventful! 

The bad: It started with two waiters telling us separately that they'd be right with us. I wish the other guy got the table... The guy who eventually won out forgot to give us our appetizers before the entrees, and only brought them when we pointed it out. He gave us at least one wrong entree at first. For another entree I'm pretty sure he lied on the spot and said it was the correct fish ("Uh, what did you have? ...Sure yeah it's that.") At one point he just put a bowl of clam chowder on the table that the kitchen accidentally made. "On the house!" Random. 

To make up for all this he offered us some lobster (but actually grabbed us crab from outside) and $10 off, which he did partly by changing the entrees to cheaper options (including what we suspected the actual fish to be in the b.s.-ed fish entree) and slipping us $4 in cash. Huh?

The worst part was that he messed up splitting our the bill between two cards. The first try, the sum was way over the total bill. After we pointed this out, he said he voided the first charge and re-charged them the correct amount. When we asked for the confirmation of the voided charges he responded by saying "We've been here for more than 80 years." I'm sure you have, but that has nothing to do with proving you canceled the charges. 

Sure enough, today we found out one card was charged twice and the other card was charged only the first, higher amount. As long as the charges get straightened out, I'd say it's nothing more than a funny story now and hopefully Nick's can find better help for your visit.
author: Alex S.

description: It's windy and freezing at Fishermen's Wharf and it doesn't help that you're starving while looking for warm delicious seafood dishes that are affordable. Most restaurants in the vicinity are crowded and the wait on weekends are usually up to an hour. Thank God I came across Nick's Lighthouse and got my clam chowder bread bowl. This is my first time having soup in a bread bowl and it tasted like heaven as it warmed me up with every bite. The soup could have been a bit more flavorful since I'm dipping bread in it, but I was quite satisfied with how fast it filled me up. Don't let the size of it fool you because it's much more filling than you think. Although there aren't any seats since this is an outdoor market, the price of only $6 per bread bowl made up for it. My first experience eating clam chowder bread bowl was great, so I think this is the place to go the next time I'm craving for something like this. The other outdoor markets sell similar food but what makes Nick's Lighthouse special is their lobster bisque. My sister had this and it was pretty good, but I think the smell of lobster was too pungent for my liking.
author: Meilin W.

description:
So my dad was in town and I decided to take him to the touristy area. We found this place cause we were craving crab and saw this place had lobster. So we got a okay size crab (about less than 2 lbs) and a good size lobster. I posted a picture on yelp... The lobster was meaty but not as juicy and succulent as other lobsters I've had before. The crab's weight came from mostly the shell. Not too much meat which I was a bit disappointed. I always get snow crab from Safeway and always get a ton of meat for cheaper price on less weight. So who knows. I'd probably come again if I was in the area, but thank goodness I'm never really in fisherman's wharf. 

The clam chowder was not so good. It was wayyy to thick and only had a few bites. 

Oh yea, for the crab and lobster, they only charged us $50, so not too bad...
author: Helen V.

description:
Delightful...absolutely delightful!  Such a quaint little place.  The bf and I came here, craving chowder one night, after seeing the Blue Man Group.  First of all, it was after 10:30pm (closing time) & they warmly welcomed us in, anyway.  +1 point for Nick's.  Secondly, they let us have 3 generous samples of lobster bisque, clam chowder, AND crab chowder.  +5 points!
Third, our waiter came by often & informed us of when he was bringing out our next items...which came out very quickly!  Another +5.  We had bowls of lobster bisque (the bf), crab chowder, Dungeness crabcakes, and steamed clams.  The clams were recommended by the waiter.  Really great ambiance and great service.  We'll definitely come back!
author: Natalie C.

description: Wife and I ate lunch at Nicks. Good service, the other waiters and busboy, backed-up our waiter and worked as a team. Filling up our drink glasses and clearing dishes. The Calamari Dore plate was very very good. Only negative is the booth seating...very tight fit for us of moderate weight. Only skinny people would fit there comfortably.
author: Joe O.

description:
We were in San Francisco this past weekend and, being from FresYes!, we thought it would be a shame to let the opportunity of fresh crab pass us by. We were staying at the Omni and the referred us to Nick's, telling us all about a cauldron and an "experience" and la-de-da-de-da. 

So, we went there even though we weren't keen on being trampled by tourists taking pictures of seagulls. Once we got there, I didn't see any such cauldron, but it was mostly because I was too scared that one of those shiny, painted men were going to jack my wallet. 

They asked us if we wanted to go inside and we opted in, since the amount of flying rats upped the odds of getting poop in our food. 

When we got inside, it felt really crowded. When they sat us at a table, it felt like you had to sit straight up or you'd run the risk of getting bruised from the table edges pressing into your ribcage. 

The decor was cute, but kind of bipolar. There were these really cute grape lights, like a wine country theme...but then there were also airplanes hanging from the ceiling. I'm sure there must be some relevance, but it was lost on me. I didn't see a lighthouse in sight. (Really, though..I could have been IN a lighthouse and not noticed, because I was too concerned with how to crawl past all of the people inside in the case of a fire.)

The food was okay. We split a whole dungeoness crab ($30), and a 1/3 of a load of sourdough bread, a cup of lobster bisque, and an order of onion rings. The crab was good, the bread was warm upon arrival, but the outside quickly got H.A.R.D, the bisque tasted like tomato soup with a weird lobster aftertaste (I'm sure Gordon Ramsay would go all crazy and slam it down and swear about it if he'd been there..) and the onion rings didn't really taste like anything. They were served with some thick, nasty ranch dressing and the waitress forgot to put them on the ticket, so they arrived after we were done with everything else.

The last thing I've got to comment on is the bathroom. There is an old curtain over by the pick-up window and the bathrooms are in a VERY NARROW hallway behind it. The bathrooms themselves are the size of a small coat closet. If you're claustrophobic, this place is not for you.

There's gotta be better eats on the Wharf. There just has to be.
author: Ashley H.

description: calamari no flavor and it's like eating bubble gum. Same goes with fish and chips, fries is like cement no jokes, clam chowder is probably the best one but serves u little I say this place sucks and oysters is not fresh...  DONT EAT HERE
author: Saige A.

description: I would give it zero stars if I had a choice.  I was really excited for some good and fresh fish and chips in kind of a hurry.  Since we did the outdoor to go option I thought that could happen....  Well I got my food within 10 min of waiting to order and got but one taste and the fries were inedible...  Cut to 7-10 min later... Fresh fries were handed to me with no fish...  Got the fish and after sitting down to eat that was pretty nasty too.  If I had a do over I would have gotten my money back and gone to in and out burger...
author: Jon H.

description:
Lobster brisk, calamari, Carona, kush

Lobster stew, crab cakes, Caronas, Kush. SET
author: Sonny S.

description:
We'd had good luck at Tarantino's before, but I wanted to stop somewhere in that main glut of stands on Fisherman's Wharf, figuring that the competition would mean better food and lots of turnout. And, while Nick's was doing brisk business, it wasn't a great meal by any stretch of the imagination.

The chowder was, unfortunately, fairly tasteless and watery. The crab cakes were far from fresh and were like a mouthful of sand in consistency. The crab sandwich was passable, if a bit heavy on the mayo, and suffered from the same bread overload that most sandwiches on the wharf do. We stumbled back to the trolley stop, defeated.
author: Ryan C.

description:
They tried to usher us inside but I said no-no-no~

Actually I said.. "uhhhh...." while staring at the outdoor menu.  Inside restaurant prices = expensive.  I ain't no tourist!

Anyways, someone saw me a-staring and offered me samples of all their chowdahs!  Clam Chowder, Lobster Bisque & Crab Chowder.  Loved that I got to sample them!

Went with a pint of clam chowder and a sizable piece of baguette for about $7.50 or so.  At first taste, the chowder seemed bland.  As you continued to eat it, the smells wafted up  your nose and combined with the subtle flavours of cream and clam to create a balanced soup that made you want to eat more and more.  Absolutely delicious.

3.5 stars.  I'm going to try all the Clam Chowdahs on this block!
author: Kimiko Q.

description: Its a mediocre place and the food is mediocre too.. I recommend you eat outside rather than in the restaurant..cause they charge you straight up double for the same food..All in all, nothing great about the restaurant. I noted that the restaurant was quite shabby. You can do better, Nicks!
author: Neena S.

description:
After coming out from Sabella and La Torre restaurant which we did not like at all, the bf and I decided to find another place for clam chowder. We saw a long lineup outside of Nick's Lighthouse so we trotted over to the line.

We ordered the Lobster Bisque...not the best one. Also had the Clam Chowder (Boston), well, at least it was a bit better than the restaurant we just came out from. It wasn't salty and had a few goodies in the bowl.

2 out of 5
author: Polly C.

description:
this review is for the seafood stand they have outside the resto.

came to fisherman's wharf later saturday with DH.  we were eyeing on the clam chowder but quickly changed our minds when we saw they serve lobster bisque.  we ordered the bigger size cup of lobster bisque.  it lacked the oomph of other LB i've had before.  it lacked lobster pieces that's for sure.  we were quite disappointed considering seafood is their specialty.
author: Cossette P.

description:
If I order food that tastes and looks like I could make it myself, there's no way I'm going to recommend your restaurant. That's exactly how I felt coming out of this place. 

The good news was that the food was very filling but that's the only good thing I can say about it. I had a cup of Boston clam chowder (mehhh...it was ok) and a plate of fried calamari (again...nothing special, just ok). The bread they brought to the table was a joke and was hard, chewy and stale.
author: Don D.

description:
We were planning to eat inside where we can sit and enjoy but the prices were double from the stand out front.
Clam Chowder bread bowl - good. normal. not hot enough though.
Crab Chowder bread bowl - its whatever. looks like baby food. wouldn't get it again.
Crab Sandwich - waste of money. low on flavor, bread was SUPER hard. had to rip off the top layer of the bread just to bite into the sandwich. wouldn't get it again.
Garlic Fries - i liked it, it was good. not hot enough.
What do you expect from the outside stand though right?
author: Tran T.

description: Place has not been updated since the 40s probably, it smelled like ass. Most uncomfortable seats in SF. Clam chowder barely had any clams, dungeness Crab was TINY and garlic'd to death, but still tasted ok. Waaaaay too overpriced!! Never going back
author: Daniella V.

description: Great with kids! They brought a huge lobster to the table for the kids to see- it was a big hit. The service was quick and the food was good! We will be back.
author: M F.

description: Was a small solid establishment.  Staff was great and the food was excellent.  Both my wife and I would suggest to anyone.
author: John K.

description: Food was delicious, prices a bit high but given the location that was to be expected. The meal was large enough to be split between 2, if you aren't starving. Service wasn't great but not the worst either. Would probably return.
author: Matthew P.

description: Tiny spot for some really fresh calamari and crab. I tried the spicy garlic grab...awesome and I recommend you try the white clam chowder as well. We couldn't believe the size of the calamari. ..humongous. .. service was very good and quick. We will definitely return!
author: Frank W.

description: What the cooks crank out of the world's tiniest kitchen is amazing. The lobster bisque was creamy and delicious and my husband and auntie said the steamed clams were incredible. I loved the cozy atmosphere, fresh food, attentive staff and kind service. I'd love to come again when we visit the city sometime and try more (and have a couple of drinks!).
author: Jennie H.

description: Three of us ate here last week.  Two had crab cakes the other the snapper.  None of us were that impressed.  The crab cakes were very salty and the snapper was just okay.  The bread they gave us was super tough like it had been sitting out for awhile.  Service was eh.  I wish we would've just grabbed a shrimp cocktail outside.  That looked pretty good.
author: Teri L.

description: Been here and ate many times and the end result is always good. Good food and service is not too bad......
author: Andy V.

description: We had afresh crab, we bought 2 fresh crab and it was $55.00. We got the crab an it bleed black water out of the shells n it was horrible. It was as though they pulled the crab up from an oil barged tanker. Really, really gross!  They just lost a loyal customer since 1982. Very displeased and will spread the word on fb and yelp. All our family and friends, don't  go there, go to Scoma's. We threw the crab away with fear of getting sick and spending the day n night sick in the bathroom. Not worth it.
author: Diana R.

description: 1 star ONLY because of the location. Calamari was like chewing rubber. Crab cocktail had shells in it and tasted old and dry. Crab chowder technically had crab in it but you couldn't tell by the taste. Coffee was disgusting. They add a 4.8% charge on all orders indicated in very fine print on the menu. They have a warning sign posted that their food may make you sick. What a terrible place.
author: Blaine S.

description: Food was excellent. Ordered the dungeoness crab with clam chowder, my wife ordered fish n chips. Everything tasted great and was served quickly. service was friendly, attentive, and helpful. Restrooms could be a little nicer but everything can't be perfect.
author: Kevin O.

description:
Best cioppino ever.  It was the best because I have never had one with crab broth in it.  It made all the difference.  
Bluepoint oyster is decent.  If served over ice, would have been much better.
Cherrystone clam was good.  Very sweet and firm.  Had lots of flavor.  Must eat after oyster and not before because the flavor overwhelms the oysters and you can't taste the oyster.  Again, if served over ice, would have been much better.
author: Hy M.

description: "15% gratuity charge is included" for a party of 3? Oh well, I do not think so. Especially with that mediocre service quality. I would NEVER come again.
author: Jason G.

description: I had the fish and chips here at Nick's Lighthouse and it was OK. The service was pretty good and the sourdough bread was great! I'd come here again, but try something new.
author: Mariah G.

description: Our server, Susan, was an exceptional and perky lady who offered friendly service and was helpful in our dinner selection. The ambiance is a bit tired, but heck, when a place is this busy and serving such great big portions of really fresh seafood, they surely don't have time to revamp. We return here on our yearly visits and are never disappointed.
author: Sue W.

description: This is our first trip to nicks but it won't be our last.  The crab cake was amazing, probably one of the best I have had.  I had a New York steak that had a butter/garlic sauce on it, and wow, it had so much flavor.  It doesn't look like much, but the food is great!
author: Kevin V.

description: Stopped in Nick's 3/24---- It was 42 degrees outside and raining. We had walked up and down the wharf looking for a place that served lobster chowder (not just clam chowder) so when we saw nick's had it, we rushed inside. The place has kind of a divey hole in the wall feel but its perfect. I ordered the lobster chowder and my husband ordered the clam chowder, both in bread bowls Our food arrived within 5 minutes and both had visible chunks of the seafood. SO worth the $7.50 price tag. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat!  Full review with pictures here :http://comeoneileen86.blogspot.com/2012/03/san-francisco-fishermans-wharf-pier-39.html
author: Ashley S.

description: We got the fried combo it was good for fried seafood. The place is crammed so be prepared to be close to each other if you eat inside. Our friends got the reg crab it was way good
author: T W.

description:
Portions were small, and it was expensive.
I know it's Fisherman's Wharf and all, but dang...
$20 for half of a crab? 

I just went to a Chinese restaurant today, in Downtown Oakland. And, had a lobster for $13.00.

Nick, thanks....but I'd rather gp elsewhere.
author: Sheila S.

description: What an amazing dinner and experience here. The food was great but our server Justin really made our night. It was my anniversary and my wife and I couldn't have been happier with his service. He went more than out of his way to make sure we had a great dinner. He was very attentive and the meal he suggested was superb! We will definitely be back just for the service alone!!
author: Wes D.

description: This is the place I take newcomers to SF. Wanna know a secret? My friends think I bring them here and suffer the parking issue because I'm really happy to see them. Of course I'm happy to see them-but I'm even happier to be at Nick's. I come here for my C-R-A-B. I love crabmeat probably second only to baby back ribs. This place is all about seafood. They have a great bowl of clam chowder. Try that with their crab a la mode. Try the crab as is with no butter and other stuff. You will find out that you and crabby never really met each other until then.
author: Janet D.

description:
I wonder if people actually know what bisque means, based on some of these previous reviews? I preferred the lobster bisque to the (clam) chowder. Co-worker said the same.

We split actual seafood (3 lb. lobster) and a dungeness.  Was very good 
 (but it's hard to screw up real seafood).

Will be back again later.
author: ninpou k.

description:
I was sucked in by the bay and thought a seafood place this close to water had to be good, I was wrong and wasted my time and money.  Luckily it continued to give, the food sat in my stomach all day, making me uninterested in eating for hours.  

The crab sandwich was crab and heavy mayo without any flavor.  The bread was tough.  The calamari was greasy.  

I was truly disappointed, but blame myself - I should have checked the yelp reviews.
author: Liz I.

description:
It was a Hot and Sunny Saturday in Northern California. The Ice Cream man was out and so was the corn/ mango lady in her homemade push cart.. We needed to get out the house and take advantage of the perfect Bay weather. So the folks and I decided to play tourist and head across the bridge to peep out the scenery one time .

We ended up near the cannary, pier 39, fishermans wharf area.
I tried a few of these crab joints back in the days. They mostly have the same items but different flavors. We ended up at Nicks Lighthouse near the end because the other joints had lines that were ridiculously long. We ate at the food stand in front, not the restaurant. A few of us ordered the calamari/ fries, crab cakes, fried shrimps, fish sandwich, raw oysters and clam chowder.

I myself got the clam chowder in the breadbowl. It was around six dollars. The taste was OKKK, It should of been more thicker and pack with more flavors. Some of the folkers hated on the chowder pretty hard. But it wasnt that bad.. and I wasnt mad... I was hungry, the sun was shinin, and thats all that mattered. And also, this chowder doesnt hit the back of the throat like filthy Campbells and Progressos.I also had samples of the other thangs that were ordered. Fried calamari and crab cake were pretty good. But really, everything was what I expected. Your typical fried stuff, fish n chips style., nothing special. Didnt get to try the fresh crab though, Maybe next time.  The portions were good sizes.
If I can remember correctly awhile back, I think Vendor #1 or #2 had the best clam chowder and fried calamari but I forgot the names of the restuarants.

Afterwards, We did the tourist thing, peeped out the streets and piers. The silver robot dudes, break dancer crews, bush man, and those folk tale singing band guys. Alot of fob/ european tourists with cameras/ camcorders out and about all day. It was pretty nice, havent been out there in awhile.

So anyways, all these things were just teasers. The folks and I decided to head back to the town and stop by Lucky Seafood to pick up two boxes of oysters and do up a BBQ live. And we did.

Basically, a friend of mine makes a much meaner chowder than this joint. Its called "The Ms Trans Famous Clam Chowder(tm)" which is much muy delicioso. (Trademarked 2008. Oakland, California U.S.A)

So 3 Stars Nick, thats all you get mang''
I might be back, I dont know..only time will tell
author: Rudy R.

description:
visit: 6.20.2013

food bought: clam chowder in bread bowl

price:  same price as the other foodstands $5 ($6.xx with charge card)

service:  same as other foodstands, but on this particular day not quite as exciting as the other vendors from which I bough clam chowders from as well)

taste test result::  the chowder was served in a typical boudin sourdough bowl (I believe all the stands get their bread bowls from Boudin).  flavour-wise:  this chowder almost hit the spot... almost.  the chowder itself is nice and thick and full of flavour and seasoning.  We found it to be nicely seasoned even though a little heavy handed with the oregano.  And was disappointed that there wasn't more clam meat.

experience:
treated my sis and out of town visitor to a "clam chowder taste test".....bought a bowl from 3 different foodstands, one of which was Nick's Lighthouse.

Overall:  was a cheap way to celebrate Fisherman's wharf. the chowder itself was a 2.5 but had so much fun with our taste n compare experience that I had to give a little extra star love.  I recommend (if going in a group) that you each pick a stand, and share your chowders with eachother so you can find the better chowder for you.... me? still on a mission, dang, i'd really like to find a stand that I can give at least a 4 star rating..... (a to be continued activity? oh yes, I think so...)
author: Malalini S.

description: Speedy meal and delicious crab cakes! Presentation wasn't beautiful but tasted delicious, but what do you expect from a sidewalk restaurant!  Large portions for a great price!!!  Would definitely snack here again!!
author: Tara A.

description: The food was acceptable, but their garlic bread wasn't really tasty, and.....a Progresso would serve me better than their clam water.
author: CJ E.

description: An okay place to go for a quick bite to eat.  I ordered from the outside stand and got a crab sandwich.  It was decent but not great.  I think there was too much bread for the amount of crab.  Also when eating the crab comes out of the sandwich when you are trying to eat.
author: Nick F.

description:
Hmmm 9 people to feed... (5 young adult children) and not wanting to spend a lot of money in a fancy restaurant.  Could they feed/seat a party of 9 people?  Yes, they could! What caught our eye were entrees under $25 with soup or salad included.  We had a hilarious seating configuration.  5 kids sat at 1 booth with one seating in a foldout chair in the isle at the children's' table and we sat at the booth just across from them. It was like one long table, except that there was a divider between us with a glass sliding window which they slid down for us.  No free sourdough served when you sit down. You must buy it. The group ordered fresh mussels with a garlic, butter sauce over fettuccine , lightly grilled sour dough crab salad sandwiches and wedges of ice burg with crab on top. 
Nothing fancy, just good food. Waiter was funny. 
Interior could use some freshening up, atmosphere was a little lacking. Lots of families with kids like us.
author: Mocha G.

description: The bread bowl clam chowder was amazing! I definitely plan to come back again when I visit San Fran. However, the service was a tad slow and confusing when I purchased outside. The workers were friendly and enjoyable but, again, the disorganized service was stressful.
author: Zoua X.

description: We had the calamari and chips and shrimp sandwich. Serving sizes are huge and reasonably priced. Delicious. Definitely not the place for luxury. Remember it is the fish market. Fresh seafood!
author: Cindy L.

description:
They're cheap... sometimes.

I always come here to eat a whole crab and my boyfriend is always here for the clam chowder in a breadbowl / the fish & chips. They're tassssty!

They aren't the cheapest on the street though, you could do better. The customer service is great though!
author: Mimi N.

description: Omg I just love the claim chowder and the steamed crab here.  Everytime we are in San Francisco,  we always have to pay a visit to the nicks lighthouse.  The sauce that comes with the crab us phenomenal.  Haven't seen it anywhere else.  The place gets pretty packed easily.
author: Jay A.

description: Waitress was horrible french fries were very oily worst  I've ever seen in my life. returned it and walked out do not go here waste of time and staff is very rude
author: Austin W.

description:
Let me start by saying that the service was stellar.  They were absolutely fantastic.  My good experience stopped there (and it was the reason they got the two stars instead of one).

The décor is awful.  This place needs a remodel something fierce.  Plastic decorations that don't seem to flow together and some of the ugliest light fixtures you have seen.  The tables were covered with tablecloths that were too small, unable to hide the atrocious tabletops (some odd sequin thing).  The booths were uncomfortable and packed together.

The food was "ok".  It wasn't good, simply passable.  I had a penne pasta with shrimp.  The crab was more than I was willing to spend ($40) given the look of the place.  There are so many better places to go around here.
author: Ted H.

description:
Don't believe anything the guy at the door says, he will say anything to get you in the door.  We live on the east coast and visit San Francisco once a year. We definitely looked like a bunch of tourists trying to decide which of the Fisherman's Wharf restaurants to eat at.  Having kids, the guy at at the door says "Unlimited soda refills".  So being really hungry we decided fish is fish.  After ordering and getting the kids drinks refilled, they were empty again.  We asked for another refill and guess what, waitress says "only ONE refill allowed"

Their lobster bisque has a real tomatoey base.  The clam chowder is just OK.   Go a little ways down Jefferson Street to Boudin Bakery if you want bisque or chowder.
author: Ben L.

description: Good food. Bad service.  Servers don't write down the order and then forget to place the whole order.  My kid had to wait for over 20 mins to get his grilled cheese because the server forgot to put in his order.  And, she didn't even apologize.
author: Kunal S.

description:
Yes, the fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap but I always go to the Fisherman's Grotto for two things: Clam Chowder and Dungeness Crab, and this place did not disappoint.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.

Yes, it is pricey especially if you are not eating standing up outside...but if you are on vacation on the coast of CA you can afford to splurge a little.  Just don't order lobster since CA is not known for lobsters anyway.
author: tim l.

description: When we visit San Francisco we always end up at Nicks.  Not the biggest or fanciest place but they make you feel at home and welcomed.  Service has always been polite and friendly.   We usually get the clam chowder bread bowl, which is very good.  This time around we got the lobster bisque bread bowl, bay shrimp sandwich and what we went for the Chopino.  The bowl was not the cheapest at $30 but then again it is real seafood.  Everything was really good.  So much so we went back the next day before leaving San Francisco.  Got the clam chowder bowls and a lobster roll; glad I tried something different.
author: Neddy C.

description: Terrible ending to our perfect day in SF! First, we should of left when we were sat at the smallest table ever! Our knees were touching halfway up each other's thighs (no joke!) my seat was broken so I had to keep my balance. Our view of outside was so ugly the window shade should have been down. But decided to not walk out because both our servers were super nice. Started out by playing it safe with first sharing a bread bowl of clam chowder. NOT SAFE. So watery and flavorless. Canned clam chowder is 10x better. Ordered steamed mussels (my fav thing to get when on any menu.) They were giant and gritty and overcooked. As I started to eat one I couldn't bare it anymore and sat there too embarrassed to spit it out and too disgusted to swallow. Finally I had no choice but to spit it out :( Gross. Garlic fries were the worst garlic fries I've ever had. Seriously. Bad. What garlic? It was literally nasty fries with green onion? Who puts green onion on garlic fires anyways?!? Last thing was fried zucchini. Only thing edible but still so bad. The kind that comes frozen you can get at fast food drive thru. Oh yeah and I got so fed up at the dirty chef creeper eating French fries and staring and smiling at me literally every two minutes! My boyfriend (pissed) switched me seats. And told our server after paying 60$ for this nightmare dinner that our tip was only for him because of the inappropriate chef. Never in my life have I been so upset over something that's supposed to be enjoyable.
author: Macy M.

description:
Meh... it was ok.  

The Fish n' Chips was standard fare.  I'd even say the Fish n' Chips at Epcot in Disneyworld was better.  

The Lobster Bisque was subpar.  No lobster meat whatsoever.  The Clam Chowder was blech and BLAND with minimal clams.  Clam chowder from Campbell's canned soup is better.

The only good thing that I had was the Crab Chowder.  The only saving grace from me giving this place 1 star.

Also, waitress was subpar.  I did not get a single refill on my glass of water.  What kind of waiter/waitress has no clue on table responsibility?  One of the main responsibilities of a waiter/waitress is ensuring that the drinks are well managed.  

The restrooms are very small.  Kind of reminds me of being on a boat.
author: Donald D.

description: Come here with a group of 10 people.. We was sitting down by the waiteress and ahe help us with the menu.. When i call her back to make an order she said ' i am not your server so i will get your server ' in one point why she's the one who sat us down and tried to make an order for us on the first place but finally when when i call her back thats what i got..  After make an order we tried to ask the server for the water for the rest of us cause me and my cousin disnt get the water yet, but finally i didnt get my water untill we finish.. Unbelievable.. We ordered cioppino n Deep fried plater is was okay..  But totally bad service ever... And one more things for you guys if you want to charge gratuity make sure you have a good service... I gave 2 star not cause the food but cause there's one guy in the front probably the chef and owner perhaps, he's very kind to my daughter and try to ask everything okay or not..  Feel better with that guy but totally not with the server...
author: Yulius F.

description: Excellent lunch today. Busy but not hectic. Fetuccini with smoked salmon and asparagus and the Snapper were both great tasting and lunch portions and prices very reasonable for the fact that it is in a major tourist area. Our waitress was also very proficient and welcoming.
author: CS W.

description:
Service was awful inside
The crab salad was disgusting it looked like someone took it out of the garbage and put it on the plate
Chowder was good 
Other peoples food looked better
Try one of the other crab places
author: Lorri G.

description:
This place is SHADY!!!

After we ordered, the waiter came back to ask if we were going to pay by cash or credit.  WTH!!!  What kind of establishment asks such a thing?!  They might as well put a sign up saying, "cash only."

We sat at a booth.  I'm not a big person, but even I felt cramped.  There wasn't much room between me and the table.  We also sat next to the restroom.  The lady in the women's restroom was taking her sweet time so I peeked in the men's restroom.  I saw a pubic hair on the rim.  Okay... I decided to wait.  The restroom was tiny.  It was slightly larger than a restroom on the plane.  

We had the fried calamari, clam chowder, the spicy crab, a beer, and a glass of wine. The food was just okay.  For Fisherman's Wharf, I kind of expected the clam chowder to be better.  The crab was not so fresh.  It had been previously cooked and reheated.  I like my crab freshly cooked after I order it.  It makes a big difference and I can tell.

Service was slow at first, but he was attentive thereafter.  He constantly changed our plates of the crab shell.  I sensed a little bit of attitude as he told us to wait when we asked for the check .

When the check came, a tip of 15% was added to the bill for a total of $85.  I'm assuming the waiter wrote it in.  Wow! Really?  Don't they usually just add tip if it's a large group?  

Save your money.  For better seafood, dine somewhere else.
author: Laina T.

description:
This tourist trap got the best of me when I convinced my boyfriend to eat here for an "authentic" Fisherman's Wharf experience. The lobster tanks outside were a pretty big drawing card, but in retrospect, I doubt they actually had anything to do with the restaurant. The interior was old-timey and comfortable. The creaking floorboards and mish-mash of wall decorations gave it a legit feel, like old sea-faring fisherman might have once eaten there. But if the food was anything like it is today, they probably would have left without paying. 

I got soup in a bread bowl, as tourism dictates, and the bread was good (it was from the bakery across the street, which serves its own, probably better soups). The lobster bisque, however, was pretty terrible. It had the flavor of tart tomato soup and had weird hard bits of something in it. I speculate, with ample disgust, that they were parts of lobster shell, based on their appearance. I got this disturbing mental image of somebody throwing a whole, live lobster into a blender with a few cans of tomato paste and pushing "liquefy." I ended up dining mostly on the top and outer edges of the sourdough bowl. 

The place was also more expensive than the food and service seemed to justify. I guess if it's on the water, they can charge whatever. The saltwater and barnacles/wood and vinyl atmosphere gives you enough of the fisherman experience that you don't need to order a breadbowl. Go there for the mood, not the food (I don't mean that to be a rhyming catchphrase) and just get a couple beers. Or at the very least, opt for the clam chowder.
author: Colleen D.

description: The food was great as street vendors go. We ordered the crab cakes and the crab chowder and we were definitely not disappointed. Nothing tells you more about a city than some of the local faire. The kiosk was clean and the employees were good about keeping everything sanitary. Other than that, words just don't do it justice. I will definitely go back and order from them again.
author: Joe K.

description:
This is a review for the cart in front of the restaurant.

We ordered the lobster bisque, crab sandwich and marinated calamari.

The lobster bisque was really good! The portion is definitely on the smaller side... just enough for one person. The calami was good as well but SO TINY for what they charge.. the crab sandwich was OK. Bread was sooo hard and we weren't even sure if we were eating real or imitation crab.

Overall, it was a decent, quick place to get food. If you don't dine, you'll have to find a place to sit and eat. 

Validation is only for an 1 hour if you buy anything that's more than $10.
author: Christine S.

description:
Probably one of the worse restaurants I've been to along the Pier. First off, the service sucked real bad and I mean bad. The guy that brought us in from the outside was real nice and sweet, but the waiters/waitresses at this joint are straight up assholes! We were seated fairly quickly with a nice view. As we were seated, the guy that brought us in actually ended up taking our order and becoming our "waiter."

Seems like a lot of the waiters/waitresses there didn't want the "load of Asians" as they were ignoring the other Asian customers in the place. Little do they know that we all speak English...Oh well, no tip! That's fine with me. The food wasn't all that great either. It was very mediocre and our "non-waiter" guy was so sweet for "re-filling" our clam chowders for free! How generous.

The restaurant and the food only gets 1 star, but if I could rate this place based on the service our party received from that one gentleman that recruits people to come inside, I would've gave him 5 stars for his wonderful service! I ended up tipping only him because he totally deserved it. I will probably never come back here due to the cruddy food and the retarded service. Fail!
author: Hannah L.

description: Pretty crappy place. Really small proportions and wasn't cheap. If you're looking for clam chowder, fish and chips or anything else please go somewhere else. This place is whoot. Save your money
author: Nathan Q.

description: Orders the steamed crab and clam chowder.  It was the same as my last visit.  Crab meat was salty and I think that's because they tried to preserve 'yesterday's ' crab for today's 'fresh' catch.  The guy at the front door quoted me one price and after the meal I was charged another price.  The waitress said the Hispanic gentleman has a poor accent and I probably misunderstood him.  It's hard to misunderstand numbers.  That was my last.
author: Mays F.

description:
The only thing that keeps me coming back to Nick's is the lobster bisque, which I absolutely love with sourdough bread and oyster crackers.  However, everything else is kind of a letdown.

First of all, the staff is so aggressive trying to get people to come in that it kind of felt like I was force dragged in even though I was intending to eat here anyway.  Sitting down at the table, we had to shoo away at least three flies that were running around our table.  Our waiter was not very friendly, and after we ordered the fish and chips with lobster bisque and a crab chowder, he asked "That's it?  Nothing good?" as if he was disappointed that we did not spend an arm and a leg on the whole lobster that he offered us as a the daily special.  First he got the order wrong and gave us clam chowder instead, which we said was fine as long as we didn't get charged the extra cost for crab chowder.  We did not get sourdough bread to start with nor with the fish and chips meal like we were supposed to, and our waiter seemed annoyed that we asked for it.  We also did not get water until we asked for it midway through the meal.  After finishing, we sat there with empty plates for 15 minutes with our waiter (and other waiters) passing by us and paying absolutely no attention.  Finally, they did not want to validate our parking because we were a couple dollars short of $10/person.

The service was so poor that the food didn't really even matter too much at that point.  But just to note, the fish was not breaded very well, was a bit soggy by the time we got it, and did not taste particularly fresh.  The clam chowder was nothing special.  As I mentioned before, the lobster bisque was the only good point of the meal.
author: Carrie C.

description: Didn't even order food asked for checks right after the drinks came. Horrible service, waiter was rude & not at all patient. He messed up our drinks and complained about fixing his own mistake. Also place is very small and uncomfortable.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
It was a random Friday date-night and we decided to play tourist in good ol' Fisherman's Warf.  In pursuit of some seafood (duh) we walked Embarcadero and its side streets for a nice, affordable spot.

The host of Nick's totally grabbed our attention and after glancing over their menu, convinced us that Nick's had the best seafood on the block.

It is a cozy spot, the decor reminded me of restaurants you'll find on North Beach.

Service was fantastic.  We were asked our drinks order immediately and shortly after our bread basket came.

With the place being packed, we were impressed by their speed. 

The food was pretty decent! I really enjoyed our order of Blue Point Oysters and Cannelloni filled Crab & Shrimp. That cream sauce was soo good!

We left super satisfied and we didn't break the bank for fresh seafood :)
author: Earlene C.

description:
This is my go-to seafood spot at the Wharf. While Alioto's and Scoma's get alot of attention, they're too fancy and pricey for the everyday diner like me. Nick's has two dining options - the restaurant and the food stand outside.

The restaurant: 
- Crab Louie is amazingly crisp, cool and fresh. They are very generous with the shrimp and the garbanzo beans and strips of red beet add an unexpected texture and flavor. I'm not sure if they make their dressing in house, but it's fantastic. I've tried to replicate it at home, but I can't quite get it right.
- Seafood pastas are generously portioned, and their seafood (prawns, scallops, clams, mussels) couldn't be any fresher if you plucked them out of the water yourself. I'm able to taste the slightest trace of fishiness, which is why I won't eat seafood from just anywhere. 
- Fish and chips - crisp and not overly "bready". The outside is fried just right without overcooking the fish inside. Topped off perfectly with steak cut fries
- Service is attentive and I've never had to wait for a seat. For two people, the bill is usually between $40-$45 (including tip) without alcohol.
- Three hours validated parking at the lot across the street.

The food stand: 
Even though I have the option to eat inside, sometimes I prefer the experience of eating my food (while standing) out of a paper carton, huddled in the crowd on the sidewalk watching the tourists, snacking seagulls, and street performers that make the area so distinctly San Francisco. 

Food options at the stand are limited to what you can eat while standing... 
- fish/shrimp and chips
- clam chowder (in a cup or bread bowl but I recommend the bread bowl)
- ceviche-style seafood salad marinated in lemon juice


Everything is fresh, flavorful and tasty. You can exoect to pay about $20-$25 for two people AND you get one hour of validated parking at the lot across the street. I usually have enough time to walk over to the nearby San Francisco Chocolate Company and grab a bagful of chocolately goodness before my free hour of parking exprires. Awesome!
author: Mariela D.

description: Friendly staff, good food, and quaint atmosphere. Inside tables are a bit small but if you go at the right time you can get a good table and service. Split the zepharano(sp), which was very good and a bowl of lobster bisque which was average.
author: Cameron C.

description: Friendly service, but college dorm quality and execution.  The mixed saute seafood thing was like $30 and was mostly like soggy breadcrumbs and green onions and the tiny little shrimp things that aren't terribly exciting.  I didn't really expect much though.  The service was friendly.
author: Mike L.

description:
I went here on a rainy Sunday evening with a couple of friends. While deciding which restaurant to dine in at, the guy at the door of Nick's lighthouse was persistent enough to "force" us into this loud, cramped restaurant.

When we told the waitress we'll just have clam chowder bread bowl, she quickly picked up the menus, left, and never said a word. Then the food came- DISASTER! The tiny amount of chowder they put in the bread was ok. It did not have any clam in it. The bread was not great.

Anyways, i give them one star for sheltering us from the rain, and one for giving us enough carbs so we can walk to Ghirardelli.

Summary: Save your money and go somewhere else if you're looking for great clam chowder and good customer service.
author: Jon L.

description: The waitress was fantastic!  but...I almost could not eat the lobster bisque.  My wife had the crab chowder, no crab that we could find.  My son had the shrimp and scallop fettuccine and it tasted like it came out of a frozen food box.  The bread tasted like it was baked in an oven where something burned.  Prices were good.
author: mark d.

description:
We walked up and down fisherman's wharf and was overwhelmed and swept away by the fresh boiled crabs and knew what we wanted to have for dinner. I don't understand why they would have 10 sections all serving the same thing.. boiled crabs and crab rolls... but no questions asked... Nick's Lighthouse caught our attention for some reason... so we stopped there and was very excited to have fresh boiled crabs.. just plane as it gets... 

When the waiter sat us down... i think my face dropped to the floor. the freaking booths were made for kids. it was freaking EXTRA small. I couldn't move anywhere and it wasn't comfortable at all. I couldn't slouch because there wasn't any room to slouch, the only goods coming out of this booth is maybe good posture? 

Still, we couldn't get up and leave... just couldn't do it. Then we got served with burnt sourdough bread and the waiter was trying to convince me that it comes like that. I wanted to shove it down his throat and let him try to swallow burnt sourdough bread. I have to say that the butter was excellent! 

Apparently, we have some unknown cool EPS connection with the chef himself because we requested to have our crab not cleaned... meaning that they don't deshelled it, don't crack it.. just boil the crab and serve as is... The chef was totally cool with it and he event  went to pick out a special crab for us. I thought that was really neat. Or maybe that's what he does for everybody else too... LOL. 

The crab was so juicy and sweet!! I also ordered the crab rolls, next time i'll asked for the sourdough sliced bread instead of the baguette. It was really hard when it got to me. I was tearing up the inside of my mouth trying to bite into it. ugh!! But the crab itself was soo good. The things I sacrificed and do for good food...
author: Karly G.

description: So bad. The calamari tasted like it'd been out for some time and the lobster bisque was dissatisfying. Skip!
author: Sally T.

description:
pretty terrible.  cafeteria food at tourist prices.  avoid.
nuff said.

stupid tourist (yeah that was me)
author: Jeff L.

description: Went here over the weekend.  The place is cute and cozy, definitely has an old feel to it.  Started off with the lobster bisque soup which was really good, just a little salty..  The for my main course, I ordered the crab and shrim stuffed canelloni...loved that.  The crab tasted great, the shrimpg was good too but didn't taste as fresh.  Anyway, the meal overall was good and our server was attentive.  Would go back again next time I don't mind spending $50 on two pasta dishes.
author: Sara W.

description: This place is a hidden gem! Found it while walking through Fishermans wharf. The clam chowder was the best I've ever had and the fresh cod fish and chips was to die for. Will certainly come back next time I am in the area.
author: Greg C.

description: Last night we had dinner at Nick's Lighthouse.  I knew going in that we were going to pay through the nose because the places in Fisherman's Wharf take advantage of tourists, but I would think that with a high price should come good food and a clean restaurant.  NOT.  The restaurant is run down (complete with duct tape on the booths), not very clean (bathrooms are extremely tiny and filthy), the food was marginal at best.  I would recommend going someplace else.  If this is the presentation they give you in the dining room, I cannot help but wonder what the kitchen looks like!  I will say that the  server was very good and tried to work with what he was given, but other than that, I would steer clear of Nick's Lighthouse!  Too bad the owner of this business doesn't have any pride.  With the money he is making, he could give a lot more!
author: Rob S.

description:
For some reason, the line here was the longest and we assumed Nick's is the best out of all these stands that seem to sell the same menu items. Checking back here on Yelp, we should have known better!

The clam chowder was pretty bland but the fried shrimp was okay.  I appreciate that they give you a choice between garlic or curly fries, both which are better than plain french fries. The line moved amazingly slowly for a stand that has all it's food pretty much pre-made.  Next time I will go with Alioto's.
author: christina c.

description:
I came here over Labor Day weekend because I was craving some seaaaafood from Fisherman Wharf! 

This is my third time here and I never remember which vendor I usually got the food from, I remember one time I got it at Boudin but then decided to go back to the vendors. 

When I got to the vendor, it seems like everyone was lined up for one particular vendor, Nick's Lighthouse, I wasn't sure why but I decided to sheep it up and follow along.  I was going to ask the people around me and my friend why they lined up here but then being my shy self I opt'd to just not question the crowd.

My friend got the clam chowder bowl $6, and I was planning to get the clam chowder bowl too but last minute switched to the crab-wich $7.  It was a pretty packed Sunday (like all Sundays) and there weren't many places to eat, so we snuck into Boudin's back patio area =X and ate there.

I tried a bit of the clam chowder and it was great as always, the crab sandwich on the other hand was kind of bland, and too much.. mayonaise? The brand wasn't that fresh either, and mine was actually made on the spot.  I definitely would not order the crab sandwich anymore.

Overall, when I saw them pile the fried food they were definitely not cheap on it, they would stack as much as possible until it starts falling off, and the food is decent for it's price, $10 for the two item combo.

Next time I might try out the other vendors, first there's no lines, plus I felt bad that we were actually lining up in front of THEIR little place but was getting food from Nick's Lighthouse =X.
author: Willis C.

description: Eat anywhere else! Chowder too thin. Clams old bread & wine were good.
author: Lisa M.

description: Booths are small & the place gets crowded. Our server sucked. Other waiters took care of us bc ours wasn't paying any attention. Crab chowder in the sourdough bowl was good, but not worth going back for. If we go back to San Fran, we'll skip this stop at the Wharf.
author: Dawn R.

description: I would suggest to order outside instead of eating in because the,price to sit inside is much more. the food is ok, nothing different from any other seafood place. The servers are nice though.
author: Bobina B.

description: Always jam packed, but has been our spot to dine at Fisherman's Wharf. Brought the entire family here (all 16 of us), and they were incredibly accommodating, seeing as it was the holidays and lunch hour. Wait was only about 15 minutes and they managed to sit us in side-by-side tables. Clam chowder was good, amongst other orders. Our waitress did have a mix-up with a kid's order, and it came about 30 minutes after everything else, but she fixed the mistake and it wasn't much of a problem. Seeing as everyone left full and happy, it was a pretty good meal.
author: Nikka M.

description:
Probably one of my favorite spots at the Warf; and just like everywhere else, be prepared to spend some cash on small amounts of seafood. My favorites are the variety of fried clams, calamari and jumbo shrimp, the shrimp louie sandwich is also very tasty. The Clam Chowder is not the greatest but fortunately there are variety of spots to go taste testing to find the best clam chowder. 

There is no dining area if you order from the spot outside so be sure to grab a space behind the kitchen and stand near the sidewalk. Service is fast and you can pretty much watch the servers prepare your food as you wait.

If you get a chance to sit inside at the restaurant then you definitely have to try the whole fresh crab.
author: Brian U.

description: Good food, excellent service. Very accommodating for our large group. Would absolutely return. A small place, needs a good scrubbing& bathrooms leave much to desire. But that's the charm of eating in a small place by the water.
author: Tami P.

description:
There are lobsters clacking around in a tank outside! The place, with all of its storied history, has been nestled by this salty dock since the 30's! The place is notorious for its bread bowls! All of this information seems superfluous once you actually eat at the restaurant. This celebratory brouhaha seems about as believable as pull quotes from the jacket of a bad blockbuster movie. 

A specific bread bowl we ordered, from the menu's proud description, said it contained lobster. If so, it tasted like they threw the crustacean into a blender, shell and all, then poured it out into a concave of bread. Is lobster supposed to have the consistency of soupy jawbreakers? Doubtful. 

My tuna sandwich, on the other hand, wasn't much better. The mix was dark, sans any albacore at all, and thinly smeared over two slices of bread that were harder to tear through than beef jerky. I asked my girlfriend if she had thought they had popped open a can of Starkist tuna mix instead of crafting their own blend.

The prices are pretty bloated here, probably because of its location and history, with none of the items deserving their price tag.

I would also appreciate it if four members of the staff wouldn't stop, start giggling like seventeen-year-olds in the middle of the restaurant, and completely disregard their clientele for minutes on end. Bush league, man, bush league.
author: Rob P.
