The decor was very small and the booth was very uncomfortable. I admit we're both thick guys, but this place is not catered all sizes, they had to move the table in order for us to sit comfortably.

Anyhow, if you decide to try Nick's Lighthouse be warned with the food we mentioned. We haven't tried any of the other food, but seeing how three things went wrong with just the simplest orders, I'd hate to see how their main entrees will taste.

Just two buildings over is #9 Grottos ( I believe it's spelled like that), their food was actually good.
author: Anthony H.

description: There was a long line when we got there. We were being squeezed in a booth table with four of us. The space is just so tiny. However, service is pretty good and the food is pretty good also. Honestly, the price is quite not valuable.
author: tobey t.

description: Had the prawns and curley fries.  It was a total waste of money.  Maybe other items on their menu is their claim to fame, but definetly not the prawns and fries.  Fries were oily, soggy, doesn't get worse than that.  The prawns... it was a disgrace.  I saw ther shrimp sandwich in their refegerated section, it looked like it was couple days old.  Save your money and eat elsewhere.
author: susie l.

description: Our family has been coming to Nick's for several years. We visit twice a year. This time our service was terrible. We waited for quite a while for our initial drink order. Then I had to ask for bread for our table because it wasn't forthcoming. No refills at all. On top of that the waiter added gratuity on our party of 4.  The last couple of times we've eaten here the food hasn't been as good as we'd hoped.  The clam chowder was virtually clam-less. The prawn fettuccine was okay, small portion for the price.  I'm not sure if the service was terrible because the waiter planned to add gratuity or just lacking in general.  I spoke to our waiter and explained that I was fine with leaving the tip, but I felt his service could've been better.  He blamed the new crew...managers, waiters and busboys.
author: Michelle W.

description:
If I could, I wouldn't even give this place a star at all. 

I usually just order the fried shrimp outside which always tastes great. I have to say, the service outside is way better outside than inside. The first time I ate inside, it was fine. The second and LAST time I ate inside was with a group of friends and the service was HORRIBLE. The entire time, the waiter had a snarky attitude which I assume was because we were a group of young diners. We ordered some fried shrimp from the outside portion of Nick's Lighthouse and brought it in. The waiter felt the need to rudely let us know we weren't allowed to do that, even though it was allowed the first time I ate inside. It seemed stupid that we couldn't bring it inside considering it is the same business and we were still ordering inside food! After that, the waiter was still rude and rushed us while he took our order.  He didn't even come back to check on us after we received our food and no one came by to refill out waters. 

Also, it is super cramped inside. The tables are too close to the seats in the booth. When I went to the bathroom, it was occupied so I had to wait in the small "hallway" for the person to come out. When the person finally came out 15 minutes later, it was an male employee coming out of the women's bathroom! 

Finally, when we were ready to leave, the waiter brought us the bill. He wrote in a 15% tip at the bottom. It looked like it was a required gratuity and there was only 4 of us. We were really displeased by then. We asked him why it was written in when there was only 4 of us. He then explained that they usually write it in due to foreign tourists who come in that don't tip. It seemed like an extremely stupid excuse! I don't know if it ever occurred to him that maybe the tourists that don't tip were just not satisfied with the service! Then he asked us how much we usually tip, I said 20% when I'm pleased with the service. Then he tried to argue that I just wasn't satisfied because he told us that we couldn't bring in the outside food. If he really wanted the tip, he wouldn't have argued with us and would NOT have had the bad attitude the entire time. Needless to say, we did not leave a tip!

Don't waste your time eating here! If you do, please just order outside!
author: Amanda H.

description: We went to this place when we were visiting down in San Francisco for my son's birthday. The service as far as seating was prompt however, that's where it ended. The server was completely sub par and even though we left a tip he was absolutely not worthy of one. He took our drink order which was mostly water with lemon he brought the water said he would go get the lemon and never came back until we ordered our food. We ordered calamari as an appetizer, my son had chicken strips and the rest of us had soup in a cup or bread bowls. The first thing out was chicken strips, then we got our soups which in the bread bowls were literally 4 bites of soup and the rest bread. Oh and our Calamari the cook was busy so we didn't get that until after we were all done eating and with a perfect view of the kitchen window had sat for at minimum 10 minutes before we got it!  I told the server it was my sons birthday and he told me we don't really make a big deal out of birthdays here but I will see what I can do. What he could do was literally a bowl of whipped cream and 3 cherries ! ! !  Wow , That's Special !!! Oh and you notice I never mentioned refills on our drinks right well that's because he acknowledged we needed refills said he would bring us more water on a couple occasions and would never return. I will never return to this place AGAIN ! ! ! The bill was $70+ for 2 beers, 1 glass of water per person, 12 bites combined of soup out of a bowl of soup and 3 bread bowls of soup,  cold calamari, overcooked chicken strips oh and a bowl of whipped cream and 3 cherries, pretty pathetic if you ask me.
author: Briana S.

description: great spot to eat. nick's has been around for decades. i recommend getting clam chowder, you're in sf so might as well stick with the best. all in all, it's a great spot, you can also order your food to go outside, if you want to eat at hyde beach or what not.
author: Kelli M.

description: we had a craving for crabs  sandwhiches and everyone in the group got food  poisoning... worst place ever we all have been too.. sucked worst than McD's or nasty king..
author: Randy P.

description: I had a spicy shrimp linguine dish for only $14 which came with a small bowl of lobster bisque which was pretty good. That's a great price for a filling a decent meal. The place isn't the most aesthetically pleasing and I was examining my water glass for dirt stains, but my meal was relatively good. The seats are very uncomfortable but my food arrived quickly, was piping hot and the shrimp tasty. I didn't care for their sourdough but given how much of it is in SF, who cares. Eating at a stand would have cost me at least $10 so this was the best value for my buck. The space is cramped, service was rushed, I mean rushed...very, very rushed...but that's to be expected as they expect high tourist turnover and few repeat customers.
author: Gary B.

description: My first experience here was decent.  All I remember was how good the crab sandwich was.  So, friends and I decided to visit again and it was quite a disappointment.  The food was still good, but the service was nothing great.  First, the waiter failed to ask me my options with my order and just served me whatever he came up with, I guess.  Secondly, our server only checked on us ONCE and by that point, we had already finished eating.  We had to ask someone else to refill our water and for some napkins.  The waiter took a looong time to pick up our check and took an even loooooooooonger time to bring it back.  I mean there was only 4 other parties eating and there was no reason for our wait.  There are so many great seafood places to eat at Fisherman's Wharf and you HAVE to stand out with service for repeat business.  I don't plan on returning here again nor recommending it to anyone else.
author: Jennifer N.

description: I've eaten here a couple times.  The sit-down service is has never been all that great.  However, as my boyfriend and I have decided; Good food beats out good service.  We love the crab cakes!  The specials are always decent, as are the prices.  We've eaten at about every restaurant on the wharf, so it must say something that we come back here every once in a while!  I'd recommend it, but just warn not to expect constant and attentive service.
author: Kendra R.

description: The worst restaurant on Pier 39 bar none! Stood in line for 10 minutes while I watch the mexican waiter bring in four of his ese friends without having to wait in line. They got the preferential treatment while we had to wait 30 mins just for bread and water.I also witnessed them skipping out on paying the bill. Cramped dining area, left little room to do much of anything. Ordered the fried combo platter which promised an assortment of seafood including crab legs. They skimped on the crab legs and filled it up mostly with fries and calamari. DO NOT EAT HERE! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!!
author: Jamal J.

description: We went here for dinner since last week was at the place next door. It was definitely kind of weird how they sort of jump at you and grab you in the restaurant as if you're going to run somewhere else. The menu is very similar to those that are on the same strips and once again they do not carry whole fried clams as an appetizer (which leads me to the conclusion that people do not like fried clams). I asked the server if he can make it as a smaller portion because I definitely cannot finish the whole entree portion myself, they gladly said yes for $15. I mean $15 dollars is not very cheap, nor very expensive for clams and I have gone to places where they charge $25 dollars for a plate before. As we patiently wait for our food to come in a very crowded atmosphere, the clams came out in a very small plate with 5 pieces of clams on there. Do the math guys! It's 3 dollars per piece and each pieces were the size of a quarter and a half. Talks about being ripped off. The other items including very bland clam chowder, crab chowder with very little crab, so little that you can't even find or taste it. After my super disappointed meal with very little service we leave with a very empty stomach and heads to Burger King on the way home.
author: T Is For Tom N.

description: This place was just OK.  It's not the BEST seafood restaurant out there.  But givin its on the strip of Fisherman's warf where there's all the crabs out... the atmosphere is quite fun and bustling.  INSIDE the restaurant the atmosphere wasn't as great.  It seems like the waiter is too busy serving people.  The host while we're waiting in line suggested that we get a COMBINATION platter as an appetizer since we have a group of five.. so we did exactly that... AND IT WAS HORRIBLE.  do not repeat the same mistake as me.  The sauteed seafood platter looks like u can make it at home.. and since it is an entree. it comes with rice and veggies and not a lot of seafood.  Don't get that as an appetizer.. u're better off ordering two dishes from the appetizer list.  The entrees were not bad however.  I had the seafood canelloni.  It was really cheese which i looove. it's stuffed with crab and shrimp.  My boyfriend had ordered the manila clams with the hwite sauce.. but they took it out with RED sauce instead.  The waiter was just like oh try it.. if u don't liket it i guess we'll jsut try to make antoher one fo ru... soooo we werne't tooo happy with that.  The clam chowder was ok.  So over all.. this place was just.. OK.. not a must... i think there's better ones out htere on fisherman's warf.. oh i must say the Clam chowder at boudins was better than at Nicks.  Just a little comparison
author: Stephanie C.

description: If a date hadn't mentioned this place, I would never have darkened their door.  It is a tiny little place tucked in one of the side streets off of the main Fisherman's Wharf.  There is a guy standing outside like a barker, drumming up business.  The decor is very simple.  Comfortable booths.  Only thing is, they keep the door open so if it is cold outside, ask to be seated in the back because you will freeze.  I started with the lobster bisque which was delicious.  I have had some great lobster bisques and theirs is right up there.  For the main course we each ordered the cracked crab which was delicious.  None of us used any drawn butter or cocktail sauce.  The wines are so so.  It is kind of a family restaurant sort of place so I didn't walk in thinking there were going to be great wines but I think they could do better.  All in all, I will definitely be back.  It is a great value and the service was very friendly and attentive.
author: David S.

description: finger-licking whole crab.....drool-worthy oysters...good food, good price!  what more can you ask for?  the service is great 60% of the time, the other 40% of the time they're just too busy to crack a smile at you, but it's okay, I'm looking at my crab anyway.
author: Chrisy C.

description: ok, i know  it's my fault for volunteering to tag along with my darling bf's bratty houseguests. i knoooow as a local  that going to the hell-hole known as fisherman's wharf on a saturday, or any day, is just plain bad news.  so it's my fault that the clam chowder was terrible - flavorless and there were less than 3 clams in it. (should have ordered something else) i know it's my fault that the other dish i tried was pasta and they're clearly a seafood place. I know I can't blame the busboy that spilled an entire iced tea into my lap - it happens - but WILL blame the waiter who hardly apologized and barely discounted our meal at all. Never coming back.
author: Violet C.

description: I Always get a Bread-bowl of Lobster Bisque, it's the best!   I'm from the east coast, we I think we have a different idea of what constitutes "good" clam chowder...  It's very thin compared to NE chowder, but certainly not bad, just different.  I stick to the bisque.  Get a free hour or 3 with validated parking!
author: John M.

description: good tourist joint with decent seafood.  my buddy really enjoyed the cioppino,  but the lunch specials were nothing special.
author: Richard Y.

description: Today is March 14, 2008, My friend and I went to Nick's Lighthouse for dinner. I requested another basket of bread and the waiter told me to finish what bread we already have.  I then asked another waiter for more bread and he told me that there would be an extra charge.  I don't mind the extra charge. I'm was there to order food.  I know how much bread I can eat. Those two waiters do not know how to treat customers. Bad customer service. Rude waiters.  I won't be returning.
author: R H.

description: I don't even want to give this place 1 star!  We were walking around Fisherman's Warf with a friend from out of town and the guys outside the restaurant were trying to get us to come in.  We past by first time, but then wandered back and decided to try it.  They stuck the 3 of us in a corner booth with a table that was way to bid for the booth, so we weren't very comfortable, but we were hungry and it all sounded good.  I don't even know who our waiter was supposed to be...we had someone take our order which included a couple of beers and an ice tea.  It took them 10 minutes to get us that and then we finally got to order.  When the food came the soup my friends ordered was not very good and the entrees were worse!  Mine was edible, but very boring and the pasta was very dry without much sauce at all.  My friends food was worse...the fish and chips one of them ordered just looked awful, so I can just imagine what they tasted like.  Oh and speaking of the fish and chips...they didn't bring out any vinegar with it and 10 minutes after she asked for it she walked up to the bar to get it herself along with mentioning that we all needed drink refills.  We mentioned to 21 other people that we needed drinks, but no one seemed to want to take care of it.  It even took them forever to get our check.  In fact it took so long my friend was ready to just estimate the bill and leave something.  I was adamant that I didn't want to chance leaving more that what we owed, so we waited and dug through our purses to find exact change for the bill so they wouldn't even get a penny tip!
author: Rhonda M.

description: My boyfriend and I were showing a group of friends (13 of them) around the Fisherman Wharf.  The day was coming to an end and we were all craving some crab, we walked around and decided to just pick a random place near by.  My boyfriend decided Nick's Lighthouse and so we went to the host and asked him if they is room for 15 people and to my surprise he accommodated us immediately. We didn't all sit together but was split amongst 3 tables nearby.  The staff were friendly and courteous even though we were a rowdy group due to the majority of the group being young guys.  We ordered some crab, appetizers, raw oysters, cooked clams, some white wine and a dish of pasta with shrimp.  The spicy crab was really good, the oysters were fresh and yummy.  The pasta with shrimp did not really have any taste though.  Overall, we had a good meal with some good service.  The place is a bit small and have to maneuver your way around but we will definitely come back.
author: Noreen W.

description: They do say to pick the shack with the longest line to get the best food, but in our case it really didn't turn out that way. Seeing that Nick's did have a really long line of patrons outside eating from their sidewalk stall, my husband and I went into their sit down dining room. We were served by the grumpiest Mad Hatter (Halloween) ever. Rude and pushy. The booths are way too small and close together. We started with sourdough that was so burnt it tasted like charcoal. Our lobster bisque was the highlight of the entire meal as my Cod Fish and Chip and my husband's Pasta with bay shrimp and scallops we're worst than getting freezer dinners from the groceries store. The Cod fish was no where near fresh. The flesh was falling apart and the batter was soggy upon arrival. The fries were limpy somewhat resembles microwave fries. Coleslaw was so bland it tasted like straight up cabbage and mayonnaise without salt nor vinaigrette. The pasta dish tasted like hospital food. It was really bland with RUBBERY bay shrimps and scallops. It was definitely a reminder of the time we visited San Francisco and how not to eat at Nick's the next time we visit.
author: Jamie T.
